title: Baby Taj or Mini Taj !!!
review: Believe it or not but the inlay marble work is more decorative in this Tomb than the Taj Mahal. Breathtaking, No crowds. If there was no Taj Mahal, then a visit to here would be a World Class one !!! Not to be overlooked.

title: Lots of floral marble inlay and frescoes - must see!
review: This 'Birthday Cake' style mini Taj Mahal is a symmetric little jewel where you can peacefully examine the beautiful inlay and fresco work without the crowds like her nearby Big Sister of them all - the Taj Mahal. Highly recommended!

title: Incredible monument
review: This monument stands as a beautiful reminder of the incredible skill of India's historic architects and the famed Agra white marble. Enjoy a quiet stroll across the monument and grounds, and enjoy the splendor of the "Baby Taj". Colorful inlays of precious stones decorate each wall of the building, and will make for beautiful pictures. I went just before sunset and enjoyed spectacular views of the monument and river alike, and I was met with absolutely zero crowds.

title: Englishman Abroad
review: Visited as part of s R600/- Tuk Tuk tour of tourist spots. Entrance cost is R200/- to enter this ‘small Taj’. Fine craftsmanship but disappointing after the Taj. But well worth a visit for an hour.

title: Let down after Taj Mahal
review: We went to the so-called 'Baby Taj' straight after the Taj Mahal itself. It is clearly a big come down from that, but apparently it is draft version. Maybe we should have come here first.

title: Known as Baby Taj.
review: I visited here 10 years ago - now visiting again, it appears that the gardens have been beautifully restored, in fact the whole site seems to have been restored.

title: Not as beautiful as the Taj, but much more peaceful
review: On a Friday mid morning visit, we seemed to have the place almost to ourselves for a while, unlike our visit to the Taj the day before with its surging crowds. Don't miss the chance to visit the "Baby Taj" which has to be the second best monument in a country full of them.

title: Must see - the "Baby Taj" is simply gorgeous!
review: This building is exquisitely built and beautifully decorated. It is well worth a visit to admire the craftmanship and simply to enjoy the serenity of the well proportioned gardens that surround the "Baby Taj"

title: The mini Taj!
review: The outside is another wonderful example of art and architectures.  Inside not quite as interesting since it is a tomb.  This is the first Mughal structure built totally with marble.

title: Trip To Tomb Of Itimah-ud-Daulah
review: A very memorable day added to best days of my life and that day was when I wanet for trip to tomb of Itimah-ud-Daulah. I booked my trip on Trinetra Tours and there services was awesome. The cab reached to pick us on time and the cab driver was very nice to us. Then after reaching Agra we went to visit the tomb with our guide. The guide told us everything about tomb and its stort he also told us that the tomb is sometimes called the "Baby Tāj". Then after visiting the time we reached Delhi safe and in time. We really had a great time there.

title: Baby Taj, but really worth visiting!
review: Although often neglected by daytrippers, I-U-D is a magnificent piece of architecture, with marble screens even more finely carved than the Taj Mahal. It's also quiet and peacefull there, and easy to combine with Mehataba Baga (view point on Taj).

title: Inside is better than the Taj!
review: In a beautiful setting - across the river from the actual Taj - the workmanship inside is actually better - or at least better preserved than in the Taj. Very well worth a visit.

title: Interesting
review: Firstly you have to pay to use a video camera.  Still camera ok - just profiteering and by comparison to other sites relatively exoensive.  Conservative dress required and if not you will be provided with a cover-all.

title: Trip was wonderful but the guide could have been more friendly.
review: We did enjoy visiting this place and the guide was providing all the details about the associated history but it would have been little better experience if the assigned guide could have been more friendly and free to talk.

title: Mini Taj!
review: Despite a number of visits I make to Agra, I had not heard of this wonder! Mini Taj as most taxi drivers call it, it was a lovely experience visiting here. Mumtaz Mahal’s father is burried here. It is significantly less crowded than the Taj and the structure is extremely beautiful. Must visit if you have a little extra time.

title: Worth a visit while in Agra
review: We visited in the late morning prior to our departure for Ranthambore NP, having been to the Taj Mahal earlier that day.  We had a guide for Agra but it was not really necessary.

title: Baby Taj was the inspiration for Taj Mahal!
review: Visited for about an hour and not heavily visited by tourists.  Great spot for photos.  This site was by same Turkish architect as the Taj Mahal.  Well worth a visit!

title: "Mini Taj"...a jewel box!
review: My husband and I visited the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah, sometimes called the "Mini Taj." Like the Taj Mahal, it is very beautiful with elaborate designs. Ornate Persian gardens are planted on the grounds surrounding the tomb, complete with water fountains and reflecting ponds. It does not disappoint!

title: A real gem!
review: I agree with the comments made by all previous travelers. It is just beautiful! This Tomb is known as the Baby Taj, even though it precedes the construction of the Taj Mahal. Its elegance, sophistication, great care for the detail makes it a more feminine construction than the Taj Mahal. It was indeed ordered by Nur Jahan, a woman, the Persian spouse of the Emperor Jahangir; whereas the Taj Mahal was ordered by a man, Emperor Shah Jahan for his favorite spouse. This place is a heaven of peace and serenity, with few tourists. This makes it all the more attractive.

title: Great little gem
review: If you have time, visit this much smaller tomb.  It has some very elaborate inlay and very nice grounds.  Does not have the bus loads of visitors so you can enjoy a relatively quiet visit.

title: Mini Taj
review: The small version of the Taj. Once again a thing of beauty, but not on anything like the same scale as the real thing. Well worth a visit.

title: So very beautiful
review: This tomb is so very lovely- the inlay work on the building is magnificent. It is so peaceful and quiet after visiting the Taj Mahal. This would rate next in line to the Taj and we were so glad it was on our itinerary. Don’t miss it.

title: Almost impossible to correctly Pronounce, so 'Baby Taj' it is then
review: Another fascinating place to visit - full of history, intrigue, beauty and not a little romance, as well as a intriguing tale of miraculous survival.

title: Amazing detail and peaceful
review: Baby Taj is well worth a visit when in Agra, the craftsmanship is amazing and it is beautifully put together. It is much quieter than other attractions in Agra and therefore is even better due to the peace and quiet it offers. Whilst it is much smaller than the Taj it is still a great attraction to go see. You can take rucksacks into the site but not food.

title: Baby Taj, amazing details and peaceful
review: Not a lot of people here, so it is very peaceful and quiet after visiting the Taj Mahal. This tomb is very lovely and the inlay work on the building is magnificent.  This I  would rate next in line to the Taj. Don’t miss it.

title: I feel it is more picturesque than the Taj Mahal!
review: Really beautiful in a garden setting - a joy to behold & well worth seeing. Not as well known a sit should be - Baby Taj - I love you!

title: Must visit
review: This is a beautiful, beautiful monument and should be on everyone's list! Commissioned by Noor Jahan (Jahangir's wife) for her father, this is the inspiration for the Taj Mahal to be made entirely in marble. However, the inlay work and the colour palette are distinctly unique and more Persian. The interiors contrast with the exteriors and you will feel you are in Persia, not Agra!

title: Known a Baby Taj - and well worth a visit
review: White Marble with the same impressive architecture as the Taj Mahal. You step aware from the traffic and madness of the town to this quiet haven. Very enjoyable

title: Worth a visit!
review: The local call this "baby Taj" as it is an excact replica of the Taj Mahal. There were not many visitors there and it was very peaceful.

title: The testament to a daughter's perseverance and love for her parents
review: This massive mausoleum was built by Nur-Jahan as the burial place for and tribute to her parents. I learned that Nur-Jahan was a beautiful woman who caught the eye of a King. This King arranged to have her husband killed so that Nur-Jahan could be his.

title: Another work of art in Agra
review: Also known as the "baby Taj" this  Mughal mausoleum should not be overlooked.  Beautiful white marble from Rajastahn and hand painted motifs, landscaped grounds and views of the river make this a beautiful place to sit and relax since it is far less crowded than the Taj Mahal.

title: Not to be missed
review: After being with the masses at the Taj Mahal. It was a real treat to visit here at dawn. We were the only visitors then and we loved the magnificence and serenity. We were able to enjoy the fantastic inlays and artistic skill on the marbelled tomb.

title: Baby Taj
review: Popularly known as Baby Taj because it looks like Taj Mahal and is a miniature version of the Taj .Situated on the banks of the Yamuna. Worth a visit

title: Mughal mausoleum
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is a Mughal mausoleum in the city of Agra known as baby Taj. Tomb is decorated with red sandstone and white marble inlay work. It's a place of tourist interest in Agra.

title: Better than expected
review: Although older than the Taj Mahal the buildings were much smaller and more intricate and well worth the visit

title: Mini Taj...
review: I was so oriented don visiting the Taj and in less measure, the Agra Fort, that I didn´t had this magnificent monument in the radar. The mini Taj, as our tour guide called it, is of resemblance of the Taj, actually it was built before. Both are tombs… Don´t miss it, maybe before seeing the Taj, but might not be possible as tours are structured to see the Taj early mornings, but you never know.

title: A mughal mausoleum
review: It is a Mughal mausoleum on the banks of the river Yamuna. This monument was built even before Taj was built. Very less crowd but still a place of tourist interest in Agra.

title: Nice
review: Nice place but compared to Taj Mahal it’s not a must see

title: Great place
review: Very nice with a fantastic view of the river and vey fascinating architecture of the building. And also good entrance fee

title: Lovely place and worth a visit
review: Called the baby Taj, it sits on the river and has beautiful marble inlay work, the gardens are lovely too.

title: Fantastic place with stunning architecture
review: If you have extra hour in the evening, do yourself a favor and visit this stunning place. It was built few years before Taj Mahal and its decorations are even more stunning and more detailed then Taj Mahal. We could not believe our eyes. There was a group of monkeys that came through gardens and we took fantastic pictures as sunset was setting down. Please bring your ticket from Taj Mahal and you will receive small tax discount. Otherwise, if I remember correctly, it was 200 rupees. The street outside is little scary, so I would definitely go with car and have driver wait for you. We used Saniya tour company and highly recommend it.

title: An exquisite gem!
review: This quiet little tomb seems off the main tourist trail but is well worth a visit. Surrounded by lovely Persian style gardens it looks like marble lace on the outside and is beautifully painted inside.

title: Excellent Sight to See
review: Very good history and story line goes with the tour of the beautiful building . Not sure we were given all the correct facts!  Some different versions were understood from each guide. Either way it's worth a visit .

title: Walls are alive with texture and tradition
review: What a lovely place to visit.  There were very few tourists here, unlike the Taj Mahal.

title: Another wonder of the World
review: This is a "must visit" place, away from the big crowds of the Taj, a real gem. From a distance or at close range, fantastic photo opportunities. And such a quiet place.

title: Absolutely Amazing
review: What amazing architecture and history surround this place.  Plan to spend plenty of time here and look closely at the gorgeous artwork built into the building.

title: Handcrafted, every bit
review: We are truly mesmerised by this handcrafted building. Ethereal is an understatement. Follow the shadows the Sun casts, inside and outside the monument.

title: Beautiful mosaics and engravings.
review: The bay Taj was a delightful place to visit. The mosaics and engravings are plentiful and beautiful with many in amazing condition!  You can see the resemblance to the Taj Mahal.

title: The pet name says it all.
review: Baby Taj. That is how this monument is referred by the locals. Intricate design. Must be included in the itinerary if you are planning to visit Agra.

title: One of the best places to view the sunset
review: Beautiful little monument.  It has a great view overlooking the the Yamuna river to see the sunset.  You'll be able to watch the sunset over the little town.  It was breath taking.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is a crowd free monument where you can enjoy some peace and nature. It is also situated on Yamuna bank just like the Taj Mahal. The tomb is situated in the middle of a crisscross with long walkways and beautiful garden.

title: Beautiful monument in Agra after Taj Mahal
review: If you are planning to visit Agra then visit this monument also. Locals referred it as baby Taj. It is very beautiful where you can enjoy nature's peace and calm. It is also situated on the Bank of river Yamuna. It's worth going there.

title: Quieter and on a more accessible scale
review: This site is well worth a visit - it was pretty peaceful with only a handful of visitors when we attended (on a day when there were heavy crowds streaming round the Taj Mahal).

title: Beautiful monument that inspired the Taj Mahal
review: This is a good monument to visit before visiting the Taj to see where the emperor got his inspiration to build the Taj Mahal.

title: The Baby Taj
review: Such a beautiful and intricately decorated building that was a little bit of peace in the middle of a busy city. 100% recommend visiting this tomb, not only is the tomb beautiful but there is also a lovely view of the river. There's the added bonus of loads of monkeys hanging around the place.

title: Beautiful
review: Missing the scale and majesty of the taj but this is a absolutely beautiful sight in its own right. More colour and intricate detail inside and fewer crowds made this a lovely stop off during our agra trip.

title: Tomb of the Royal Family
review: This place is a tomb for the family of the emperor, Shah Jahan. It's amazing how their resting place is preserved. The only thing I don't like is you need to remove your shoes and socks. I don't mind actually, but the ground was so hot that time that I got blisters on my feet.

title: A small and "better" Taj
review: The Tomb of Itimad-ud-Dulah, also called Baby Taj, is a beautiful place to see and especially the inside of the tomb as the gate facing the Riverside is worth a stroll.

title: Baby Taj - neat
review: Well done monument and predates Taj by a hundred years.

title: Do not miss
review: Many visitors to Agra return after seeing the Taj and maybe Agra Fort.  I would include the Itimad-ud-Daula tomb as another ‘must see’ attraction in Agra.

title: It's Amazing
review: Tomb of itimad-ud-Daulah is the second most beautiful and amazing place in agra after taj mahal. It's also called as baby taj with love. Must visit place for everyone. It is beauty will make your heart happy.

title: A MUST SEE
review: Called by some the "Baby Taj" this place is stunning.  Whilst not as sumptuous as the Taj Mahal this place is fantastic.  It is quieter and not as noisy as the Taj but it deserves a visit to see the workmanship that went into producing this masterpiece.   To walk through the tomb and to marvel at the skills of the builders long ago.  One of my favourite places in India.

title: serene and calm place.
review: This overlooks the river Yamuna and you feel this sense of peace and calm there.Its a very serene place that lies unaffected by the millions visiting it.

title: Taj Mahal
review: This is amazing place considering time that was building lots of efforts has been invested to acquire such a wonderful place must see place

title: Amazed by this place
review: Only happened to visit as the tour guide suggested. It was a serene place as it was intended to be. Apparently it was built as shrines to bury her dead relatives by Nur Jahan - Shah Jahan's mother.

title: Nice and quiet!
review: Lovely sight, very peaceful... beautiful architecture and grounds are well kept.  Just a few families walking around; great for photography!

title: Continued pleasure
review: Visiting this tomb after the Taj Mahal and the Agra Fort simply added to my high estimation of the elegance of Mogul decorative arts.

title: Agra seeing
review: Its a tomb built by Noorjahan wife of Jahangir for his father. It's a good place to see and enjoy. So visit this place.

title: Baby Taj Mahal
review: You have undoubtedly come to Agra to visit the Taj Mahal in all its splender. But you would be doing a dis-sevice to your trip if you did not taketime to visit here.

title: The baby Taj
review: It is a Mughal Mughal mausoleum in the city of Agra, on the bank of river Yamuna known as baby Taj. It was constructed by empress Nur Jahan for her father Mirza Ghiyas Beg, originally a Persian Amir in exile, who had been given the title of I'timad-ud-Daulah  (pillar of the state)

title: Tomb
review: This is a tomb which offer you a view in the past . Is has historical things stored in it.a must visit if you are in agra

title: Itimas UL DAULAH
review: Tomb of Shahjahan's father in law. Good architectural works . A place worth visiting. its a few minutes drive from Taj Mahal

title: Marvel in White Marble
review: A beautiful monument in white which predates the Taj Mahal is definitely worth a visit and best if you go there before you see the Taj. It will help you appreciated the magnificence of the Taj even more. Situated by the River Yamuna, it has some very intricate works in marble and is inlaid with other precious stones. Not much crowded so you can take your time to go around and admire its beauty and architecture. Built by Noor Jahan, wife of Emperor Jahangir, in memory of her father, the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is a fine example of Mughal architecture.

title: Nice Place Beside the river
review: It is indeed a nice place beside the river. I visited at the morning and had a nice view of the river beside.

title: Mesmerizing
review: Visited again after more than 12 years and the place was a pleasant surprise. Very well maintained now as I remember from my last visit. Well kept gardens and well maintained monument. Has a beautiful overlooking canopy over the river Jamuna, which was running full due to rainy season and is a very relaxing place to spend some quality time as well. Must see place in case you are in Agra. Need shoe covers (or take off shoes) to go inside the tomb. Now has washrooms as well.

title: Baby Taj
review: Itimad-ud-daula known as Baby Taj also because this Monument is a small white colour building which looks like Taj Mahal..

title: MUST SEE
review: Although not as popular as the Taj Mahal and often overlooked by most tourists (and tour operators), I personally think it is worth the small detour.  It is smaller in scale and more intimate than the most famous monument across the river...

title: Mini Taj
review: This is a mini Taj Mahal. You may visit this place on your way to mehtab bagh. Be careful with your ticket since the guard may ask you to show it again once you exit.

title: Good place
review: Must watch place when you go agra..mini tajmahal also you called.beutiful sculptures outside the building with impressive design.

title: "Baby Taj"
review: Incredible marble handicrafts. I would recommend to visit it before going to Taj Mahal. Relaxing place.

title: Definitely worth visiting before the Taj Mahal
review: We had a day in Agra before visiting the Taj Mahal and stopping by at the 'Baby Taj' was certainly worth it. Not on the tourist routes, we found it with only 5 or 6 other people there meaning we got a true feeling of the peace and quiet that its builder intended. You can't spend long here as there isn't much to see but the marble work and gemstone inlays are fantastic.

title: Practice Taj
review: Built to honour Empress Noor Jehan's father, Itimad-Ud-Daulah is the exquisite tomb of Mirza Ghiyas Beg.

title: Nice place!!!
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is situated near Yamuna River, Agra. Its a nice place to visit in Agra. Beautiful architecture and designs outside the building.

title: Baby Taj
review: Visit this before the Taj Mahal.  This is the Taj's smaller version, thus it is dubbed as the Baby Taj.

title: Splendid Baby Taj!
review: Itmad-Ud-Daulah, nicknamed Baby Taj was veritably built by the mughal empress Nur Jahan for her parents. It is actually a miniature version of the Taj Mahal and is also the first example of a Mughal tomb that used stone inlay to adorn its exteriors. Simple yet charming, you hardly need an hour to visit Itimad-ud-Daulah.

title: Very Impressive Stone Inlay
review: This is such a great landmark to visit. It has it's own unique place in history as not only the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah, but also showing the Mughal's transition from red sandstone to white marble as a precursor to the Taj Mahal style. Again, toured with Rashid from Mysha Tours and he was a great source of information on this site.

title: Amazing architecture
review: We came past Baby Taj on our way in to Agra, and it immediately stood out. We were glad to take the time to visit. The architecture is stunning and intricate. Really beautiful.

title: Rightly Titled Baby Taj Mahal
review: Like all the other Gems in and around Agra, this one too rightly reflects the Mughal Taste in Art, Taste and Grandeur.

title: Nice
review: Nice, but it is nothing compared to the Taj Mahal, of course.

title: Most Beautiful Masterpiece of Architecture of India
review: It is very beautiful historical monument situated nearby Yamuna. The masterpiece of Mughal period is still proved to be very beautiful monument. The tomb is built of marbleoutside and there are very beautiful paintings inside the tomb. Really it's a beautiful output of Indo-persian achitecture.

title: Nice Place to Visit.
review: Nicknamed the Baby Taj, the exquisite tomb of Mizra Ghiyas Beg. This Persian nobleman was Mumtaz Mahal’s grandfather and Emperor Jehangir’s wazir (chief minister). His daughter, Nur Jahan, who married Jehangir, built the tomb between 1622 and 1628 for her father.  You can combine a trip here with Chini-ka-Rauza and Mehtab Bagh, all on the east bank. This tomb is worth a visit for it's lovely architecture and well kept gardens.

title: Jewel Box
review: This tomb is like a draft of Taj Mahal, itimad was an Irani. Tomb is really beautiful and worth to visit.

title: Only if you have time
review: or go before you see the Taj Mahal. The workmanship might actually be more beautiful, but the scope after seeing the Taj, is sort of like seeing the Catskills mountains after the Alps -- both beautiful, but....

title: Beautiful place
review: This stunning huge place is also sometimes called little TAJ. Worth a visit for its expanse and beauty

title: Exquisite
review: My second visit. Fortunately, my 30 year old memory did not play tricks.

title: Combine with other sites in this area
review: We called in on our way to visit the gardens across the Yamuna river from the Taj Mahal - Mehtab Bagh.  It was certainly worth the 30 min stroll around the grounds but not worth it being a sole destination across the city.

title: Not worth
review: Truly nice piece of marble, but very small and gets boring soon. After the entry fee, we had to pay for the shoe covers, and got a very rude and aggressive guide with poor English who also demanded money in the end. The place was full of little offenders seeking for their prey.

title: Quite a pleasant surprise!
review: This monument was built by Empress Noor Jehan for her father Mirza Ghiyas ud din Beg who was the treasurer at the court of Jehangir. The monument has beautiful floral ,geometric motifs in marble with inlay work , delicate jali carved in marble..it is thought to be the inspiration for the TAj

title: Nice, quick visit.
review: We knocked this one off in about half an hour. The tomb is on small but well-maintained grounds. Not a must-see but is one of only three sights we visited in Agra, so we had time.

title: Very nice.
review: I thought this place was beautiful.  The way the sun hit the tombs was really nice to see.  The floral patterns on the structure are really nice.  Not too busy either!

title: Worth a visit
review: If you are interested in history and architecture it is a nice place to visit. Situated by the Yumuna river. Probably one hour maximum needed to visit this place.

title: Referred to as the "baby Taj" - worth a visit
review: This tomb is worth a visit for it's lovely architecture and well kept gardens (smelling of lovely jasmine). I

title: The original draft for Taj Mahal
review: This is supposed to be the draft for Taj Mahal and is indeed beautiful. One also gets an idea about the great historical past of Mughals. The gardens are excellent and well maintained.  Must visit.

title: Original architecture and wonderful stone inlay work
review: Housing the tombs of Noor Jehan's parents and siblings, this is one of the most beautiful and original tomb concepts of the moghul period. Built in marble outside and inlaid with various different colored stones, it is a sight to behold. The insides are in plaster, covered with beautiful paintings. Specially the central dome paintings as something extraordinary. A wonderful mixture of Indian and Persian architectural elements and definitely a must visit site in Agra

title: Baby Taj
review: This tomb was built before the Taj, hence could be seen as an inspiration for Taj. The carvings on marble are exquisite but are losing charm due to lack of proper maintenance.

title: Beautiful building
review: Beautiful building from the outside, nothing much to see on inside. Nice to have a walk around and would definately stop by on your tour through Agra.

title: Nice place
review: This place struggles to get anywhere near the visitors that the Taj receives, but that actually helps make it quite a nice place if you have time to go see it. Obviously it's too easy to compare this place to the Taj, but it should be kept in mind that this place was constructed first - so it would have been amazing, until it was trumped by the Taj across the river.

title: Mini "Taj" they say, not wrong I guess.
review: Fine detailed marble carvings and almost maze like chambers will make you rethink this Gem as The "Taj".

title: Superb for sightseeing
review: This is not the place in our list actually, but once we visited, it made us feeling clam and peaceful with its environment surrounding with silent and holy statutes.

title: Itmad ud daulah - Another jewel in the crown
review: Also referred to as Baby Taj sometimes, it is a beautiful Mughal era mausoleum with intricate inlaid work and craftsmanship.

title: Baby Tajmahal
review: Marvelous piece of Persian art. It was build in before Tajmahal for the family of Noor jahan. Nice place not so crowded and beautifully constructed.

title: The Little Taj - worth a visit
review: This is small garden tomb which was the precursor to the Taj Mahal. It is architecturally beautiful and impressive, constructed of white marble, with painted ceilings, mosaics, and elaborate marble ornamental screens. One should visit this tomb before seeing the Taj Mahal itself.

title: Worth a visit
review: While this tomb cannot compete with the grandeur of the Taj Mahal, it is a very beautiful place and definitely worth a stop. Like others said, there is not much to be seen inside, but the outside is quite impressive, with it's beautiful carvings.

title: Lovely!
review: Very nice attraction, beautiful decorations! Worth a visit! We got given shoe covers and then made to pay for them don't know it was completely necessary to be wearing them unless you were going inside the to see the tomb which we didn't because we didn't want to take our shoes off!

title: A JEWEL OF MUGHALS
review: It is a building with a sunning garden ... and in the center it has one of the most spectacular works of art ... The whole setup says just fall in love. I feel that if Taj shows how much love a king had for his queen ...Itimad-ud-Daulah says where King fell in love with the Queen..

title: Baby Taj - Didn't even know it existed!
review: Baby Taj is just that, Baby!  Way smaller scale than the Taj, the Baby Taj is still big! Our guide brought us here, I didn't even know it existed! We learned about the history, which I won't dive in to because you should go there for yourself! BUt I would recommend a hat, sunscreen, water and small rupee notes to use the washroom!

title: Interesting place to visit
review: Our guide showed us round here the day before we visited the Taj Mahal.  It was really interesting and I loved all the inlay work.  Definitely worth a visit.

title: Baby Taj Mahul but big on detail.
review: I had thw opportunity to visit the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulahi.

title: Baby Taj
review: It's known as the baby Taj. The architectural was interesting and each room is intricately and individually painted and carved.

title: The baby "Taj" draft of Taj !
review: Me and my client visit this place. My client are shocked after he see awesome marble work "Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah" built at bank of Yamuna River. Also it's garden are very well maintained.

title: Tomb of itimad ud dulah
review: Tomb of itimad ud sulah is the another creation of mughal era..place is beautifull and neat..place similar of taj..but less crowded

title: Big and beautiful place
review: This place is another famous tomb in Agra. It looks like another Taj Mahal with no water. Most area are wheelchair accessible. Nice big garden with deer.

title: The inspiration for the Taj
review: Often referred to as the Baby Taj it's simple to see why. The structure, although relatively small, is great in detail & finishing. Given its location there are very few tourists here so you have plenty of time to take in the details & enjoy a pretty peaceful atmosphere. Well worth the diversion if only to learn more about how the taj came together.

title: Itmad ud-daulahs tomb
review: It stands near bank of  yamuna and is set a garden full of little canals of water and walking paths.The central structure is about a meter high and 23 square metres in area,with hexagonal towers in each corner,The walls are buil of rajsthani marble with semi precious stones in variety of shapes

title: Baby Taj
review: One can see why there is a possibility that this monument inspired Shahjahan to make Taj Mahal. It's older than the Taj and has exquisite and intricate carvings and architecture,

title: Famous for carving in it's jali
review: This mosque is also have tomb of Mizra Ghiyas Beg. It's also known as "Baby Taj". It's really good and worth to visit for its architecture. A carving in marble jali(Decorative panel made using marble : Lattice screen) is awesome.

title: Lovely, very worth visiting
review: Lovely, worthwhile, and -- completely unlike the Taj Mahal (same day) -- almost empty during our visit. Fills out your knowledge of the Mughal period and the styles used in the Taj Mahal.  Nice gardens as well.  In 20 years it will probably be overrun, like the Taj Mahal, so see it now.

title: Quiet and Peaceful
review: We came here in the afternoon and there were not many people around at this time. Was a good chance for some photos as there was no one in the foreground. A really beautiful place and would definitely recommend visiting whilst in Agra.

title: I was blown away! Truly beautiful
review: Like most people I came to Agra to see the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort and when the tuk-tuk driver suggested seeing the 'baby taj' I was happy to do so but I wasn't expecting much.

title: sacred and small sanctuary
review: the tomb's symmetrical features often earned its title as the baby taj or mini taj mahal but it was erected way before the famous mausoleum of india. it also has gardens in front and the yamuna river at the back.the only assymmetrical thing in this structure is that the cenotaphs of the dead leaders have been set side-by-side, a formation duplicated in taj.

title: Shouldn't be missed
review: This is called Baby Taj as it is often seen as a draft to the iconic Taj Mahal. The tomb of I'timad-ud-Daulah is a mausoleum 5 KM away from the 7th Wonder Of The World. Although not as impressive as The Taj, it is still a stunner showing Mughal architecture and raw materials used. It should definitely be seen when in Agra. Hardly any people here

title: Really nice
review: Quiet and peaceful tourist site- nice to admire the amazing detail on the buildings.

title: Baby Taj
review: More commonly know as The Baby Taj and a lot quieter so you can have a lovely stroll round without too much hassle.  Just like The Taj Mahal stunning architecture and worth a visit.

title: Worth Visiting
review: Impressive design and craftmanship. Gardens are large and well layed out. A visit should be followed by a viewing of the Taj Mahal from across the river to maximize the value of travelling to this part of Agra.

title: Mini Taj - Maxi impact
review: This small but beautiful tomb is well worth a visit. Half an hour is all that's needed.

title: Small and Beautiful
review: This is a gorgeous place located just close to a  river bank. The architecture style is classic mughal and it is mostly unharmed from damages. It is better to visit in the evening when the temperature is lower and you can spent more time and relax a bit.

title: Its was a god place
review: This place very good and a place forevery one to say there problem to god and remove the tension in body

title: Baby Taj
review: This was a beautiful place to see. Right on the river with a great view to just sit and enjoy. The tomb is smaller than you'd expect but still beautiful. There is no crowd whatsoever so take your time and enjoy the peace and quiet. You must remove your shoes so bring socks or hotel slippers to wear as the floor outside gets quite hot. A must see in Agra.

title: Beauty
review: We came to Agra to visit Taj Mahal but our driver advised to visit this monument as it was on way it's a small monumenr with taste and will certainly recommend to future travellers to certainly visit this monument.

title: Little taj
review: The tour guide said this was locally known as the little taj, the taj was later designed off of some aspects of this amazing building.  It's stunning at sunset,wild monkeys roam around so beware if you carry food.

title: Beautiful!
review: This tomb is dubbed the Baby Taj and it's quite a shame that it's overshadowed by the more famous iconic Taj Mahal because Itmad-us-Daulah's tomb was actually built first and is stunning in its own right.

title: Baby Taj !!
review: It's such a beautiful place, very quiet and a small showcase of where the Taj Mahal build got its inspiration from.

title: small and pretty
review: it is right near the river. it is worth a visit when you are in agra.  nothing to talk home about but it is definitely beautiful. little dated and old but it reminds you of an old monument from the ancient historic days and brings back fond memories

title: a lesser known site
review: 15th century mausoleum, as is the Taj Mahal, but this is smaller and dedicated to Itimad-ud-Daulah. It is also made of marble and inlaid semi precious stones.

title: Visiting Agra
review: After seeing Taj Mahal, I didn't find this place as a must see. You can skip it as there is not much to offer

title: Nice tomb
review: After spending the morning at Taj Mahal and then at Agra fort the tomb of itimad- though truly amazing in its own way- was nothing in comparison. If you're driving past I would recommend to stop and have a look. But I wouldn't go out of the way to see it. But yes it is as they say a mini Taj Mahal- kind of.

title: Good to see once
review: Very less crowded to experience Mughal monument with good work on marble. Can be visited along with Mehtab Bagh.

title: Surprising site often called the Baby Taj
review: On our way to Agra, we stopped at this site.   We had not previously been aware of it.  Our guide called it the Baby Taj since it is much smaller and was designed and built before the Taj Mahal.   It is clear once you see it that the Taj Mahal is patterned very closely on the design of this structure.   The mausoleum was built by Nur Jahan for her father.  Nur was the wife of Shah Jahan who built the Taj Mahal in her honor.  This building marks the transition in Mughal architecture between red sandstone and white marble.

title: another must see in Agra
review: you will definitely miss out if you do not visit here after you have been to the Taj Mahal ! same as at the Taj it is so impressive what kind of work was possible so many hundreds of years ago

title: Tomb of Nurjahan's father
review: This is a mausoleum of Nurjahan's (Jahangir's queen) father Mirza Ghiyas Beg.  Mirza Ghiyas Beg was referred to as Itimad-ud-daula which means pillar of State.  This structure has the mausoleum of Mirza Ghiyas and few other structures as well. A great piece of Mughal architecture, having few similarities with the Taj Mahal, also referred to as baby Taj or precursor to Taj Mahal.

title: Included in our tour
review: Very quiet only a handful of visitors. A good place to visit before going to the Taj Mahal as it was designed before. Many interesting features. Unbelievably some people have vandalised parts but now it is being managed and looked after.

title: Impressive
review: We could have spent many hours here. The marble and carvings were overwhelmingly beautiful. We spent time studying the different carvings surrounding the tomb. We had a great time and stopped on route to Agra. My husband felt this tomb to be more impressive than the Taj.

title: not so crowded
review: if you have the chance to go to the real deal please do but this place is nice for you to apreciate everything without someone pushing you. we went at 6/7 pm and it was almost empty

title: Worth a visit
review: This is also known as the Baby Taj and the design inspired the building of the Taj Mahal. Quite spectacular at sunset and well worth a visit - quite underrated. Though it is quite small it is set in gardens and overlooks the river.

title: Baby Taj!!!
review: Mumtaz Mahal's (the wife of Emperor Shah Jahan) Grand father named Itimad-ud-Daulah. Yamuna River criss-crossed by water courses and walkways it is situated. It is also called Baby Taj wich is best for Sun Set observing. Worthy & Must Visit

title: Take water with you
review: We did the Taj Mahal at sunrise, the Agra fort at 10am and then got to the Baby Taj at midday. It was hot and we were thankful we took water with us. We had a professional guide that clearly knew the history and took pleasure in brining it to life for us. We did note that one or two other "guides" seemed to be making it up as they went along !!

title: The Jewel Box!
review: This edifice is a small jewel box that MUST BE SEEN. The stone carvings, pietre dure (or parchinkari) and the harmonious balance of the architecture were breathtaking.

title: A Must See
review: For many people this is THE treasure in Agra. Fewer tourists make the effort and yet it pre dates the Taj. My advice is to try and get to this for sunset.

title: Can't avoid to visit
review: But i will avoid to write much about history because the monuments of Agra so well read, there's no place left for me to write anything in regard. The mausoleum was commissioned by Nur Jahan wife of the 4th. Mughal Emperor Jahangir  for her father Mirza Ghiyas Beg titled as Itimad ud Daulh (Pillar of the State) between 1622 and 1628 on the opposite bank of river Yamuna. The monument is not big as Taj Mahal or Agra Fort but the beauty and it's craftsmanship equally wonderful even better, not only me most the visitors say so and here comes a but, about 4 millions overseas and domestic tourists visit Taj Mahal every year but not even 25 percent of them don't include this monument in their itineraries and they don't know what they miss. It was little difficult to reach bad road and traffic congestion but new road bridge has been constructed on the river Yamuna and roads from Delhi converted into highways, now it has been comfortable and convenient to reach to the monument. My suggestion, whoever has a plan visit Agra don't forget to include Itimad ud Daulh in the itinerary.  Ashit Kumar Das.

title: Beautiful building, such ornate details in exterior!
review: Calling it "The Baby Taj" is a disservice as it's not got anything to do the Taj Mahal. It's a beautiful building in it's own right with extremely fine and beautiful detail. Definitely worth a stop while in Agra.

title: Worth visiting
review: Although I have been to Agra before I have not been to this tomb. One tends to to go to the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort. However we decided to visit this tomb one evening, it is small but beautiful and without the huge crowds at both other attractions. It is called the "baby Taj" and one can see why, the marble is inlayed  with different coloured stones and very attractive. There is a lovely green garden and although it does not take long to look around it is worth a visit if you can.

title: interesting Baby Taj
review: It's called " Baby Taj " and it deserves his name.

title: Nothing special
review: Average spot.Nothing special. If you have extra time then you can visit once. It has a name like BABY TAJ.

title: Worth a visit if you have free time
review: If you have visited historical buildings with Islamic architecture before,  cities of Iran for instance, Itimad-ud-Dualah won't grab your attention very much.It reminded me of Yazd.

title: Baby Taj
review: A precursor to the Taj Mahal.  Very few visitors but the building is beautiful so I don't know why more people don't visit.  It is set in the middle of the city on the opposite side of the river from the Taj Mahal and you would have no idea it was there.

title: Pretty
review: Its called Baby Taj and without doubt the place actually is pretty to be called so, the best part being the monument is less visited and hence its quite calm and serene

title: Nice View
review: Nice little monument, very few visitors. Not easy to reach but overall experience is good. Do visit if you are in Agra

title: Much quieter than the Taj
review: We visited this after seeing the Taj Mahal and it was pleasantly uncrowded after the clamour of the Taj. We thought it beautiful and the carving and inlays just as lovely as the Taj but on a smaller scale.

title: One of my favourite places in Agra!
review: Thoroughly enjoyed my visit to the baby taj, it's really quiet with not a lot of tourists around.

title: Decent landmark but could be maintained better
review: We visited after seeing the Taj, so on the one hand it was nice to go somewhere quiet but on the other this tomb is less well maintained than the Taj which surprised me. But this isn't a massive issue - I just didn't expect it. The views from the river bank are very nice as well as lovely green gardens surrounding the Tomb. If you have time to kill it's a good landmark to visit.

title: This was better than the fort
review: Relatively few people here, nice gardens, nice detail in architecture, abit out of town, it is not a must see but worthwhile extension if you have spare time in Agra.

title: Poor cousin of Taj Mahal
review: The architecture of the monument is similar to the Taj Mahal...raised platform, minarets, in memory of a person...however, what stands out for the place is the calmness because of the limited people being present, great views of the Yamuna river and the gardens which are surrounding the Mausoleum and lastly the intricate carvings on the wall.

title: Excellent Alternative to Taj Mahal
review: If you are tire of the crowd at Taj Mahal, this is. a great alternative.  Frankly I like this tomb better.  Intricate inlaid walls predates Taj Mahal.  Beautifully proportion structure.  There were perhaps 10 other people there when I visited.  Highly recommended!

title: Nice view
review: Nice view of Tajmahal. And the designs on the wall is outstanding. A must see for everyone if you are at agra.

title: A refreshing change from the conventional Taj like monuments
review: An absolutely stunning beauty this monument is. Pretty different from the monuments you find this side of the country.

title: The 'baby Taj' is even better then the big one in some ways.
review: We really loved this little gem. It has the most spectacular inlay that I've ever seen and in so many different colors and patterns that it's just amazing.

title: a beautiful baby
review: Tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah aka the 'Baby Taj'

title: Another beautiful site
review: The tomb has such beautiful intricate detail. Even after visiting the Taj Mahal, this is still not disappointing.

title: Stunning art work with stones
review: What you just can't miss when you see this building is the striking similarity to the bigger Taj Mahal in its architecture and the whole layout. Indeed it is also called the mini or baby-Taj. Go there to witness the simply stunning and beautiful stone art work which you are unable to see that up close inside the Taj.

title: itmad ud daula is baby taj
review: Itmad ud daulah or baby taj, as it is known to the travelers is a beautiful small mausoleum built by Noor Jahan,  the wife of Emperor Jahangir, in the memory of her late parents. Noor Jahan's father was a rich person in Tehran who lost everything & came to Agra in search of job, where Emperor  Akbar employed him in treasury. He was later on promoted to the position of Itmad ud daulah( pillar of the state).

title: Not very big but relaxing
review: Really nice and less tourist here. It doesn't take much time but it's great to see the marble inlay with a closer up view than the Taj Mahal.

title: Worth a visit if you can stand the crazy traffic
review: Pleasant visit here.  Nice gardens and nicely positioned by the river.  Amazing to still see people doing laundry in the river. Sadly like a lot of places in Agra the surrounding area is littered with rubbish and the roads are complete chaos. I would suggest only going with a guide.

title: Almost as beautiful as the Taj Mahal and less a crowd
review: Our guide told us that the Taj Mahal was designed based on this beautiful structure.  It is magnificent!  It was built as a home but became a mausoleum.  Beautiful inlay work and definitely worth a visit, even after seeing the Taj Mahal.

title: Do Stop By for some very nice Art Work
review: After a visit to the Taj Mahal, we stopped to visit the Baby Taj, as they call this,  and found it an interesting building.  We had the grounds practically to ourselves. It does not get the tourist traffic anywhere near the Taj, but it does have some very attractive close up features to be enjoyed by those who do visit.  It is a smaller version, funny saying that about a still large structure, and the care in the workmanship is what there is to see here. I would hope that they maintain this lovely building, because what we saw, was the need appearing at a faster pace than satisfactory.  The grounds needed more care, and possibly, we may have been there in between tendings, so be it. But it looked to me to be a little neglected.  Still, that is not unimportant, but inside more importantly needs some attention.  We liked our visit and how silly this but I Love it's nickname "Baby Taj".   Check it out.

title: Min Taj is a real gem
review: Lovely to visit a quieter historical building and be able to find somewhere to sit, relax and contemplate in relative peace. Not one to miss if you are in Agra!

title: Visit this before visiting the Taj Mahal
review: I would recommend visiting the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah before going to the Taj Mahal so you can appreciate this tomb a little more. After visiting the Taj Mahal this does not look as impressive as it actually is. It is still very cool place to visit with much less people inside.

title: Gorgeous
review: "Baby Taj" was stunning from every angle. It was a gorgeous, intricate building and had much less crowding than Taj Mahal. The grounds were lush and blooming. We went the day before we saw the Taj Mahal, and our ticket was 250 rupees.

title: Historical but can be avoided
review: Been there, lovely building with beautiful glimpses of marble art. Other than that nothing much to excite. Getting there needs good 30 minutes. Can be avoided

title: Nice place
review: This place is historical and interested place.Many people are visit and enjoy this place.m any this are available

title: beautiful
review: The gardens must be seen! It is a marble tomb (baby Taj) for the grandfather of the queen at the Taj Mahal.

title: Students of History/Designers/Architects/Photographers- Must See
review: As you go from the old bridge from Agra Fort to this attraction,you will enjoy the ride

title: A lovely position beside the river.
review: Steeped in history, this bijoux tomb predates the Taj Mahal. Shah Jehan took this modest but finely executed building as the model for his masterpiece. The incumbent of this fine tomb Itimad ud Daulah is the grandfather of Mumtaz Jehan. It is situated well by the river Yamuna with goats grazing nearby. Small but beautiful, it is worth visiting as a contrast to the Taj Mahal.

title: Nice serene place
review: The place is beautiful.. The carvings are awesome and well maintained gardens.. Less tourist which is a plus..

title: Baby Taj Mahal
review: A great place to visit. Known as the baby Taj for obvious reasons when you see it.

title: Incredible building with stunning paintings and inlaid marble
review: Beautiful and surprisingly quiet. Don't miss this gem of a building. Wonderful artwork that takes your breath away.

title: Part of 10 day Golden Triangle tour
review: We went there as an extra unplanned side trip and were were really glad we did. It is a very pretty place and nice way to spend an hour ...... would highly recommend it.

title: In search of peace
review: This place is one of the best examples of Mughal architecture. It is known as Baby Taj. This pretty place is a must visit.

title: Baby taj
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is also know as baby taj and its a replica of taj but differs in beauty. still not bad for a visit,

title: Beautiful ancient artwork.
review: Just take your time to wander around and take pictures. Lesser crowd than Taj Mahal. Have a guide who knows the history well.

title: Perfection in marble..
review: If there is any other building in the world that can stand beside the Taj Mahal, it is this Tomb. Marvelous is all one can say!

title: worth visiting while in Agra
review: Called the "baby Taj" its a worthwhile visit across the river in Agra.  It was built earlier than the Taj Mahal but in a similar style.  While smaller than the Taj, it is not crowded and easy to tour through.  It also has some interesting detail work and history which our guide was helpful with.

title: Okay quiet visit
review: Entrance doubled to now Rs200 - just stamped tickets to adjust the price from the original printed ticket at Rs100

title: Baby Taj
review: If you go to the Taj Mahal try to follow it with a visit to here. It doesn't have the grandeur but it is older and is as good, and there aren't any crowds.

title: Finest example of a craftsmanship
review: The tomb is the inspiration for one of the wonders of the world TAJ MAHAL people call it as a baby Taj the tomb which was built before the taj mahal a magnificent craftsmanship i have ever seen a hidden jewel in the city..

title: Very nice
review: If you are staying in Agra for the day, this place is worth the visit. It's a smaller complex (nothing compares to the Taj Mahal...), but it is nice and has beautiful ornaments.

title: Worst place
review: Towards this place there is huge traffic, despite of traffic we went there to explore but it was total waste of time. Don't know we felt it's not worthy because we visited here after agra fort already there was benchmark set. Anyway this place can't be said as baby of tajmahal except the fact that both are made up of marble. A very small tomb made up of marble , we couldn't find any similarity between tajmahal and this baby tajmahal

title: Beautiful
review: A must see. Known as the Baby Taj, it's lovely and very well decorated inside and has very well kept gardens.

title: The "baby Taj" - precursor to Taj Mahal - beautiful inlay and off main tourist path so you can take your time and look
review: A most relaxing place to visit. Seems like this is off the main tourist path, so you can really take time to inspect the inlay and really enjoy this fantastic building. Loads of very amazing patterns and stone work. There are great paintings on the ceilings that are unique to all of india. The grounds are quiet so if you need a place to get away from the hustle and bustle of things out on the street, this is very tranquil.  Faces on the river that runs through Agra.  Although there are no domes like at the Taj, the towers are very inspired and the inlay work, though not of the calibre of the semi-precious stones on the Taj, is still quite amazing.  It is more intricate than that on the Taj as well.  Definitely a must see if you are in Agra.

title: worth a visit
review: It is a beuatiful and an interesing attraction close to Taj Mahal and the Fort Agra. It is only small and does not take much time to go through it. Visit this attraction first before visiting the other two, as it is no comparison with them.

title: Even more beautiful than the Taj Mahal?
review: Often known as the 'baby Taj', the tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah was built by Nur Jahan (wife of the emperor Jehangir) for her parents, a few years before the Taj Mahal itself. It sits in a quiet garden, beautifully laid out in the Mughal fashion, on the bank of the Yamuna river. Smaller than the Taj Mahal, and built entirely of marble, it is even more exquisitely decorated with marble inlaid with precious stones, delicately carved marble lattice screens and beautiful frescoes. Far fewer visitors so you can gaze undisturbed. We loved it even more than the Taj Mahal - and if that sounds like heresy, our Rajasthani friends feel the same way!

title: Baby Taj is easier than Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: As others have noted, the Baby Taj was a precursor to Papa Taj, but is in some ways, equally fascinating.

title: Taj's Little Brother
review: This little masterpiece along the Yamuna River may be even more stunning than the Taj Mahal.  It was built on a more human scale;  visitors can easily imagine people living,  laughing and sleeping there.  The  building by the river, though long abandoned, still feels as if royal guests could stay there, cooled by the breeze from the river below. The gardens have been beautifully maintained, filled with healthy plants and flowers from far and wide.  Even today, centuries after their time of glory, these gardens evoke a sense of the earthly paradise that the Mughal rulers sought to build.

title: Beautiful Tomb with beautiful story
review: Knowing the story behind this beautiful building makes it that much more special.  A daughter's tribute to her parents and siblings.  She must have been as beautiful inside as she was outside.

title: Baby Taj
review: It is actually a replica of Taj. The architecture is beautiful. Takes you back to history text books.

title: Quiet place and beautiful
review: I would like to say tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is really worth a visit. It is so quiet and beautiful. Its details in somehow is better than Taj Mahal.

title: Very impressive tomb
review: We enjoyed our visit to the Tomb, the architecture was wonderful, we had a really good guide who enhanced our experience

title: A must visit
review: I'm really glad we came here to see this monument. Known as Baby Taj the building is so pretty with stones set in the marble and painting decorate the walls inside. We arrived early in the morning and we're the only ones there. I can't remember the entrance fee, it was only a couple of hundred rupees or there abouts. You have to cover your shoes to enter the tomb. A man puts covers on for you. Make sure you have 10 rupees handy to pay him.

title: A smaller Taj Mahal
review: This is also known as the "Baby Taj" by local guides and less crowded than the Taj Mahal itself.  One get up really close to see the stones set in the marble walls, the paintings and the tombs. It is probably best seen first before the main event as in the Taj Mahal.

title: Worthwhile, before or after the Taj Mahal
review: We went to see this the morning after visiting the Taj Mahal. I was a bit concerned it would be underwhelming in comparison, but it was wonderfully beautiful as well. Early morning was nice as it was quiet and there were very few people.

title: Nothing much
review: There is nothing much to see if you went to the Taj and the Agra fort.its just to spend time.. Nothing more

title: Do not miss - spectacular
review: This mausoleum, built by the grandfather of Mumtaz Mahal (inspiration for the Taj Mahal), is known as the baby Taj for good reason. Preceding the Taj Mahal in construction this spectacular mausoleum signifies the period when the Mughals became jewellers rather than titans. The inlay work on display here arguably outshines the Taj Mahal. One can only imagine the colours and fragrances apparent in the original buildings and gardens; constructed to represent a paradise in earth.

title: Great warm-up for the Taj Mahal
review: Beautiful white marble building, which showed various tints as I viewed it as sunset was beginning. Set within a well-kept park that has a clique of small monkeys running around, which adds a certain character.

title: Baby taj - the real gem of agra !!
review: Baby Taj as locally known is best to be visited before visiting the Taj Mahal.It is older and smaller but similar in structure and design of the taj.

title: A jewel
review: This was a perfect little jewel of a building. A must see! I visited it on the way from the fort to the park on the opposite side of the river from the Taj. I'm so glad I did.

title: Out of this world.
review: Known as 'Baby Taj'. A glorious creation. Calm green gardens, brilliant white marble with intricate inlays in every colour. A view down to the river where you can see bolts of cloth freshly dyed and drying in the sun. Utterly beautiful and in such contrast to the general surrounding area of Agra.

title: Better than visiting the Taj Mahal
review: This monument, often referred to as "Baby Taj" was built before the Taj Mahal, and is similar in style, albeit smaller in scale. It is also beside the River Yumana and on a clear day can be seen from the Taj Mahal across the river.  It is a real gem, with beautiful marblework and interior and exterior decorations.  When we went, in mid-morning, there were hardly any other sightseers.  A multitude of other sightseers were probably already fighting through the hawkers and crowds at the nearby Taj Mahal.  Here it was peaceful and the monument was rightfully treated with due respect by those visiting. True, it doesn't have the magnificence of the Taj Mahal, but we enjoyed the experience of visiting here much more.  Our guide, Prince, was excellent, pointing out many things we would have missed had we been by ourselves.

title: Calm, serene and beautiful
review: If you want to escape the hustle & bustle (and smell) of Agra, this is the perfect place to come. We went on a Friday afternoon and had the place virtually to ourselves. We hired a tuk-tuk driver from our hotel in Taj Ganj for INR300 for the afternoon and he drove us here, before taking us on to the Mehtab Gardens to watch the sunset over the Taj Mahal. I would recommend that you do the same.

title: Really excellent
review: the art works with the stones really it is so beautiful and scenic. though it is a grave its look heavenly and beautiful. visitors should be see it once in life.

title: Go here before visiting the Taj
review: This mausoleum was built by the 4th Mughal emperor's wife for her parents.  So their son saw this before building the Taj Mahal for his wife.

title: Do not miss this
review: This was a very unexpected delight. I am so very pleased to not have missed it. We arrived early in the morning and was one of the first in. It felt wonderful to walk around with hardly no one there. The Taj has a lot of tourists in the morning, because the guide book tells everyone that it is best then. - not true. Especially in the vintner, then it is almost always misty and you can't see so much + lots of people and long lines to get in. In the middle of the day there is no lines to the Taj. So do baby Taj in morning and the big one midday instead.

title: Beautiful Tomb Architecture!
review: Itimad-ud-Daulah tomb looks beautiful and stunning. It has got geometric carvings and patterns done in marble and other precious colourful stones. Beautiful piece of architecture. Jali geometric patterns and design in marble are very intricate.Must visit in Agra city!

title: wah baby taj
review: Must see after taj mahal in agra. The baby taj is fantastic on the outside and the inside requires maintenance. The shining taj in agra

title: so peaceful
review: this does not have the well known initial wow of the Taj Mahal but it has a lot to offer.  When we visited we almost had the place to ourselves and were able to quietly explore the incredible stone work and screening of the marble monument.  Stunningly beautiful and away from the manic chaos of the city streets that run nearby.  Well worth a visit and time to relax and absorb before another long drive.

title: Mini Taj
review: Most of the tourists give this monument a miss as it is eclipsed by the Taj in terms of publicity and visibility. However this beautiful monument which is actually a tomb is a beautiful monument built of marble with intricate designs carved and jharokhas for ventilation. The complex is generally less crowded and one can explore the place at leisure.

title: Try and see before the Taj Mahal.
review: You will appreciate this place more if seen before the grandeur of the Taj Mahal. If not, like us, it resembles a pretty trinket box.

title: Mini Taj Mahal
review: Since I am a local resident of Agra.

title: So much grandiose in respect for the dearly departed
review: This mausoleum is often not on the prescribed tour list but I think is worth the visit. The massive structures and detailed work here is surely unique. The story behind this place is intriguing too especially about the queen nurjahan and her various political schemes...if that is the right word!!

title: We were in a bit of a rush
review: We did not have a great deal of time here. It is a beautiful place a bit like the Taj Mahal but not as big or ornate. Worth a visit

title: The Baby Taj!
review: Yes the Taj Mahal was magnificent, but to be truthful, we gasped more when we visited the far more user-friendly and relaxed Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah.  Older and much smaller than the Taj (though it is a mini version of the Taj) it is made of inlaid marble and has been described as a jewel box in marble.  Absolutely exquisite and so quiet in comparison with the swarms of tourists at the Taj Mahal.  We revelled in the lack of people and acres of space we had as we wandered into and around the building and enjoyed the gardens that surrounded it.  It was also lovely to look across the River Yamuna to the city. This is not on the must-do list for tourists but it should be. Don't miss it.

title: nice place
review: baby is the best place in agra after agra for and taj mahal. I also recommend it for visit. its a copy of taj mahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: This little tomb is very similar in structure and design to the Taj Mahal. The inlay patterns that cover every inch are amazing and the symmetry and simple layout make it a very interesting sight. Plus the crowds dont make it out here

title: Yes, the "mini Taj" is beautiful and not too crowded, but it's not THE Taj.
review: I'm happy I went here and I enjoyed the casual, less frantic nature of the place, but I wouldn't say that it's more impressive than the Taj, as some have said. With that said.....YES, add it to your list of places to visit while in Agra.

title: Well worth a visit - similar to Taj but smaller
review: Our driver took us here after the Taj Mahal and we were pleasantly surprised. This is similar overall, but much smaller than the Taj - the actual building is a bit different, but the layout of the monument is the same in the way the different buildings are payed out.  The monument was pretty quiet compared to its big brother, and its actually older than the Taj.

title: Baby Taj
review: Not as popular as the main Taj. We did not know it existed until we arrived in India. It was a draft version of the actual Taj which took 7 years to build. He then went on to build the Taj which took 22 years. Same level of detail and precision and worth a visit

title: Beautiful structure
review: While Taj Mahal is grand and awe inspiring. Itimad Ul Daulah or Babj Taj is beautiful and mesmerizing.

title: Small, beautful, uncrowded
review: Overshadowed by the "top" attractions in Agra, the "Baby Taj" is a very pleasant sight.  The ornate and 4-way symmetrical building can be walked through and around.  It's along the river so might get a breeze.

title: Beautiful 'Baby Taj' - worth a visit
review: This is known as the 'baby Taj' and is a very beautiful and interesting monument.  The stonework is stunning and it is much quieter than the Taj itself.  We really enjoyed it.  Our guide gave us some interesting facts about it.

title: A must place to visit
review: Beautiful place, the inlay work done on the stone is mesmerising. We visited this place around sunset and that made this place look amazing. It's aura go golden at sunset. Better if you get a guide along to make you know about the place as we were pretty clueless, there were no info plates installed anywhere around, neither we found any guide in the premises.

title: The Mini Taj Mahal
review: That is how locals call this imposing structure by the banks of the Yamuna river.

title: Beautiful details
review: I loved this!  Also called the Baby Taj.  The details of the inlay on the side of the building and the frescos and paintings on the inside impressed me more than the Taj Mahal.  Much quieter and a lovely view of the river behind.

title: A garden walk
review: It is a pride to visit an architecture in India, masterminded, planned and constructed under the auspices of a woman Nur Jehan. A legendary female figure in the history of Mughal dynastic kingdom. A female who was the eminent inventor of rose essence and the hunter of tigers, controller of mughal politics and other vicious intrigue, also spent her valuable time in constructing this noble architectural piece, which lies on the bank of yamuna.

title: sight seeing
review: this is not a place where you could spend a lot of time but if you have plans to visit agra you may add this one to your list.

title: Baby Taj
review: This tomb of the grandfather of the famous Taj Mahal wife is called the "Baby Taj". It is covered in marble inlay but clearly not as refined as the later Taj. The layout is the same as the Taj but smaller in scale, although I think the garden is better than the Taj. Be sure to go to the temple on the river bank as the view is terrific.

title: Itimad-ud-Dailah
review: Among one the best monuments in Agra. A very nice monument and amazing art on it. It is the small Taj of Agra. A must see and memorable experience.

title: Estimate place
review: It was not not planned but worth going there.

title: Overshadowed by the Taj, but worth a visit
review: As everyone else did, we got most excited about the Taj Mahal, but this, the "Baby Taj" is definitely worth a visit.  Ignore the guys yelling about you about taking off your shoes and just carry your shoes with you or set them aside where he's not going to expect you to pay him for watching them for you while you're inside the mausoleum.

title: Pretty cute!
review: Smaller and less crowded than the Taj Mahal, but i would not say less beautiful. Good place to just spend some time also. Very nice Details.

title: Peaceful sanctuary in Agra
review: This lovely little oasis in the heart of Agra offers much needed peace from the frenetic streets. Gorgeous architecture and cool gardens make this a must visit while in Agra.

title: Fair Visit!!
review: The tomb is situated in not so great location, but still worth a visit. It is also called Baby Taj because of the looks. Upon entering, you'll feel like you an entering the Taj Mahal :) This is so peaceful and pleasant.

title: Baby Taj
review: This place is also know as Baby Taj, The tomb is the precursor to the Taj Mahal as it was built by Nur Jahan for her father, Mirza Ghiyas Beg in the years 1622-1628, 5 years before construction of the Taj Mahal began.

title: A mini Taj, not bad for a day out
review: This is a complete mini version of Taj Mahal. A lot quieter and peaceful than Taj Mahal. You will notice this is a heaven for young dating couples sitting around the monument having a great afternoon. Worth visiting and lots of chances to take a great photoshoot!

title: Amazing strucure
review: This building is so beautiful. I especially love the inlays into the marble. The designs are gorgeous and the craftmanship is amazing. This is a must see sight when visiting Agra.

title: Not a must see
review: If you are visiting the little Taj, do it before you see the Taj Mahal.  If you do it the other way, it will feel like a waste of time.  Plan on 30 - 60 minutes to visit.  You will have to take off your shoes to go in.  The person who polices this very aggressively asked for a tip for looking after our footware.

title: Beautiful baby Taj
review: The baby Taj as it is known is obviously on a much smaller scale than the Taj Mahal and may not be as awe inspiring. However, it is still a beautiful monument in its own rights. Definitely another must-see if you're in Agra, but suggest you see this before the Taj Mahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: While smaller than Taj, it it not insignificant. Also being restored. Once can see intricate details on marble.

title: Baby Taj
review: It should be seen before the Taj so as not to be anti-climactic, but it is a wonderful place to go, especially if waiting out the morning fog prevalent in the winter months.  There are many monkeys here and be careful about aggravating them.

title: Baby Taj
review: Very beautiful inspiration of the Taj Mahal...definitely worth a visit. The marble inlay work is incredible and the paintings inside are beautiful as well.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah also known as Mini Taj
review: Mini Taj or Baby Taj Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is definitely one of the must visit monument . It houses and is a tomb of Nur Jehan's family.

title: Marble Masterpiece
review: I love the smaller, more intimate scale of this tomb of Nor Jahan's father/Akbar's vizier. The marble inlay's are just gorgeous, as are the ceilings. I'm so glad that I included it on our itinerary.

title: Baby Taj!!  Less crowded, just as pretty.
review: We visited Baby Taj after the big Taj, so the scale was a little less impressive, but it was worth the visit.  We were there just before sunset, and there was almost no one else there.  Expect to spend maybe an hour here, but an hour very well spent.

title: Very Different Architecture.
review: The architecture of this tomb is very different from the other mughal tombs. Very beautifully designed. Right on the bank of the river Yamuna. Very quiet place not much rush.

title: great building nice garden
review: We had a little time to kill and our guide took us here. We loved the place and its gardens with the animals.

title: Tomb
review: Nice tomb same as all over the world well built fairly impressive miss if short of time not very exciting

title: Wow!
review: This building is magnificent and does not get the hype or attention it deserves.  The murals and inlays are absolutely stunning! We were very impressed when we visited and highly recommend it

title: Not to miss
review: If you have some time to spare in Agra and you have already seen the Taj Mahal, I would highly recommend you go and visit this spot it's actually on the way to the gardens where you can photograph the Taj Mahal from a different perspective (best at sunset). It is really beautiful and worth the visit, it's well kept and a beautiful garden.

title: Pretty cool!
review: Baby Taj Mahl, I was lucky enough that my guide Gulshan Mughni took me here during a quiet time. I really enjoyed walking around without bumping into other tourists. Peaceful and serene.

title: Worth seeing the "Baby Taj" first
review: We visited the Baby Taj first thing in the morning, and were able to walk around almost alone. Well worth seeing before the iconic Taj Mahal to understand the architecture and workmanship all the more.

title: Another gem
review: This tomb is very good only in comparison to the spectacular Taj Mahal and Agra Fort.  Actually it is a gem with its own Persian style.  Not to be missed.

title: Serene - under rated
review: So you've heard of the Taj? Well this is worth a visit in its own right. Serene and much 'quieter'. Interesting history - spoiler alert that it's not really the baby to the Taj. You'll have more time to take it all in here.

title: A masterpiece!
review: I adore this mausoleum.  The artistry and craftsmanship are superb.  This deserves an art historian as a guide as there is so much innovation and blending of old and new architectural features.  Truly exquisite.  And the story of Nur Jahan and her family is also fascinating.

title: Anniversary trip
review: Its again must visit place. People can see immense architecture marvel. Plus back buk n peacocks. The giant ness of structure the water fountains and the technology to run it is amazing.

title: Baby Taj - an oasis of calm
review: We visited this Tomb in the afternoon, having visited the Taj Mahal in the morning.   It was very peaceful with not many people around.  I think there might have been more monkeys than tourists!

title: Baby Taj in its best
review: They exercised here the principles of symmetrical building, stone carving, and the result is very impressive. Highly recommended

title: you can't afford to miss this place!
review: its a wonderful place, you just cannot afford to miss this one. it has a lot of architectural resemblance with the taj mahal. its sad that lot of tourist are unaware of this beautiful place.

title: The Baby Taj....
review: Some architectural features resemble the Taj Mahal, certainly not as grand or majestic though. Could be up-kept a little better, worth a visit for the mosaic work....

title: A must-see!
review: When visiting Agra this tomb is a must-see! Known as the 'Baby Taj' the architecture and detail is absolutely beautiful. The marble walls are encrusted with various semi-precious stones detailing images of flowers, fruit, vases etc. Light inside is provided by delicately carved marble that lets in the sunlight and looks beautiful. Being a keen photographer I could have stayed here all day!

title: aka Baby Taj
review: This tomb was built by Emperor Jahangir's queen, Nurjahan, in memory of her father. Built entirely in white marble and inlaid with semi-precious stones, this mausoleum sits on the banks of the Yamuna River. It's definitely worth a look as historians feel it greatly influenced the design of the Taj Mahal.

title: shot visit 1.5 hours
review: This is  one of the sites to see in India and the structure is amazing and is such good condition the tours are well conducted but you need a local tour guide to gain the best experience they know the history and the bet spots to see just pay the guide and your trip will go smoothly and the information will flow all day.

title: Nice place
review: It was a good place to be nice atmosphere and buliding the interior is good and thr place is worth visiting

title: Simply Beautiful!
review: This place is little known, but if you are in Agra, you should definitely visit it. It is a smaller version of the Taj Mahal, and some parts of the architecture are more beautiful than those of the Taj itself! The interiors aren't very grand, but the delicateness of the designs on the outer walls is fabulous. It is a quiet place because most people don't come there; you can it there on the cool marble for hours and relax in the peaceful atmosphere.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is a jewel box of a site and referred to as the "baby Taj" because of the architectural elements that are similar to its more famous older parent.

title: Historians delight
review: Not well kept, Isolated and on the banks of Yamuna. A must visit in case if history interests you, By the bank of Yamuna (dirty) and construction all around does not set that royal tone !

title: Nice Place but not a Must-See
review: It is very pretty, but not as well kept as Agra Fort or the Taj Mahal. Not a bad place to stop if it is part of a package deal, but I wouldn't make a trip out of it.

title: mini Taj Mahal
review: Despite very small dimensions, it was this mausoleum that served as inspiration for the construction of the Taj Mahal

title: Beautiful
review: My wife and I visited the Itimad-ud-daulah (“Baby Taj” and pronounced “Atma dolla”) whilst in Agra during a tour of northern India.  Although it is relatively small and does not take long to visit, this tomb of Mirza Ghiyas Beg is a “must see” if you are in Agra. Located on the banks of the Yamuna River on the opposite bank to the Agra Fort and Taj Mahal, it is a stunning example of Mughal architecture. Constructed of white marble lavishly decorated with inlaid stone, it really is beautiful.

title: As beautiful as real Taj
review: This is also called as Baby Taj.

title: Beautiful mausoleum
review: People call it baby Taj.. It's a really nice area. We went here a bit early in the morning, so there were not a lot of people yet.

title: very good
review: Part of a whirlwind tour of Agra, very pretty architecture and lovely point of history. well worth seeing.

title: Baby Taj a mini delight
review: Not the Taj but a mini version built 100 years before hand. This tomb is well worth a visit and is cheap to see being lesser known. The architecture is like a pre-run of the Taj with rough inlaying and symmetry all it lacks is the famous dome,size & gems

title: Baby Taj Trip
