review: Had a nice trip to the Baby Taj. Literally as it suggests it's a miniature version of the Taj Mahal. It's very beautiful and extremely well maintained, the gardens are very well kept. It's cheap to go in. 200 rupees I think. Only takes 10 mins to wander al the ground but a good visit in all.

title: Not a great place
review: Visited this place. It is not a wow place. A normal old architecture. it is not a must see if you are visiting Taj Mahal and Agra fort. It is a little boring and you can manage to skip it. But you can get the Taj tickets from the ticket counter here

title: Nice beautiful structure..
review: Its very less crowded and you can enjoy it as much as you can with good privacy factor ..unlike Taj Mahal which can get crowded at times..

title: Worth visiting if you're in Agra anyway
review: Itmad-ud-Daulah, also known as the "Baby Taj", is a beautiful marble mausoleum that shares some of the Taj Mahal's design features. The grounds are reasonably small, so don't plan for too long here (half an hour is enough), but it is well worth a visit to supplement your day. The entrance fee is ₹300 per person (after a ₹10 discount if you have your Taj Mahal ticket).

title: A beautiful and less crowded miniature version of the Taj Mahal in Agra
review: This beautiful building can be visited along with Mehtab Bhag in the evening, as both are located close to each other, in a two day visit to Agra. However I would rate Sikandara ahead of this in Agra.

title: Squat Squab Taj
review: Baby Taj is easier on the tongue than the gurgling of Itimadcetera.

title: Okay
review: Visited this tomb at the end of a heavy sightseeing tour day it is worth a visit great artwork and architecture

title: Baby Taj Mahal
review: The architecture is baby Taj is  fascinating, The tomb is located across the river from Agra inside a small garden,its very less crowded and very few tourist visit this place

title: Baby Taj
review: Also known as the Baby Taj is a splendid attraction in Delhi. Built before the Taj Mahal in the memory of the parents of Noor Jahan.

title: Definitely a must see
review: This sight must not be missed while in Agra. It's especially a good idea to go there before going to the Taj Mahal. Devote 45 minutes to an hour to stroll on the site and admire the bulding from all sides. It's much smaller than the Taj Mahal, but incredibly impressive.

title: Baby Taj Mahal
review: The local persons recognize this place in the name of baby Taj Mahal . You can visit all this places in s single day .

title: Complimentary visit.....
review: It was on-route of Mehtab garden, so we visit there. Nakashi work on marble stone was good. Will take half hour to visit this place.

title: The baby Taj Mahal
review: The baby Taj Mahal is a small but older monument than is "bigger brother" but it is worth the visit.

title: Also called a Mini Taj
review: One should start to see the famous places from this Tomb. This is a very calm place on a very congested main road.

title: Good attraction
review: This is referred to as Baby Taj since it looks similar to Taj Mahal, beautiful architecture, can be visited if you have time

title: Baby Taj Mahal.
review: The tomb is located on the right bank of the Yamuna river, the mausoleum is set in a large cruciform garden criss-crossed by water courses and walkways.On each corner are hexagonal tall towers.

title: Fit in the 'baby Taj',  it's worth it.
review: Often overlooked by your companies and therefore relatively empty. Nice compact site you can go round quickly and still feel it was worthwhile. A good guide helps.

title: Don't miss it.
review: Although not as grand as the Taj Mahal, this is definitely worth a visit.  It is another feat of fabulous architecture and beautiful within the 4 symmetrical boundaries as in standard surroundings of such a building.

title: A real Gem - visit before Taj
review: This is truly awesome,

title: Small in Size, Grand in Design
review: A small Royal tomb, which is very well designed, built and decorated. The marble carvings and inlay works are fantastic. Although many people visiting Agra, skip this place, it is not time consuming to visit this place as tourist footfalls are less and the place is not much crowded. Overall it is beautiful structure and worth a visit.

title: See this before visiting the Taj Mahal
review: This is a lovely little tomb, very pretty and nowhere near as busy as the real thing, the Taj Mahal itself. But it is a gem. You will be overawed by it if you haven't seen the Taj Mahal first. Not sure if you would love it as much after.

title: The Baby Taj is not to be missed on any trip to Agra!
review: Very overshadowed by the magnificant Taj Mahal but the baby Taj as it is known is truly worth visiting

title: Delightful monument in Shadow of Great Taj Mahal
review: This is a relatively unknown yet beautiful experience.

title: THE BABY TAJ
review: A stunning small royal tomb called the baby Taj a predecessor to the larger Taj Mahal

title: Visit before you go to Taj and Agra fort
review: We went early in the morning around 730. It was secluded and quiet. By the side of Yamuna it's a beautiful place. Architecturally very rich. A lot of the places which are not allowed to be visited in Agra fort can be seen here from the architectural point of view, especially pietra dura work.

title: Baby Taj - As Glorious as Its Bigger Counterpart
review: The Baby Taj as it is widely known is gorgeous, some would even go as far as saying that it is more beautiful than the Taj Mahal. An extremely gorgeous construction, you must visit this place as well when in Agra.

title: Fantastic place
review: Great place to visit.. Situated near Yamuna river at the opposite side of Taj Mahal.. Great views under sunset

title: Very nice place like duplicate tajmhal
review: Its a also like tajmahal structure.same as entry as tajmahal here is mazar of noorjhan and her family behind this beautifull yamuna river whole structure is made by sangemarmar pure white and fully designable also moti and small masjid for pray nice plce for tourist visit who came for agra

title: Mim Taratanaphol
review: The baby Taj Mahal is very lovely. Good for a sunset view. You can get the view of Yamuna river too.

title: Breath taking
review: My guide book called this 'The Baby Taj'. It really was. It's smaller and quieter but just as beautiful.

title: Magnificent
review: Magnificent and beautiful. Incredible workmanship and intricate details. We were so impressed with the beauty of this placed and completely wowed.

title: A must visit for those who love architecture
review: Is is the tomb of Itmad ud Daulah , the title conferred on Mirza Ghiyas Beg, the father of Noor Jehan. The tomb was built by Noor Jehan . Though it is not as magnificient as the Taj , it has its own  uniqueness. It is a non domed structure. Marks the transition from red sandstone of Agra Fort and Fathpur Sikri to the marble magnificience of the Taj.

title: This is the Baby Taj - the inspiration for the Taj Mahal
review: I didn't know that there was a baby Taj and how this beautiful building was the inspiration for the Taj Mahal.

title: Good one....
review: Visiting thisxplace on a hot sunny day during noon time and we had to walk in barefoot to enter the monument....the toes were burning while walking barefooted....

title: Itimad -ud-Daulah has a WOW factor if get a Proper Guide
review: Itimad -ud-Daulah has a WOW factor. The carving is better than that of Taj. It is a small isolated tomb, so no one really cares , in front of Taj which is majestic. If you want to see proper marble carving then this is the place and see it with a trained guide. Then only you will be able to appreciate.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is also known as Baby TAj. If you first visited the Taj Mahal than you know that its just like a Taj Mahal but in smaller size. Thia is located on the right bank of the Yamuna River,

title: Beautiful and simple
review: Smaller version of the Taj Mahal and the legend says that after building this monument the Emperor got the idea of building the Taj Mahal, and it also has the basic and same design of the Taj Mahal, it is beautiful and simple place, calm, it was our first stop at 9am, so there was not much crowd.

title: Baby Taj!
review: This was excellent warm up for the actual Taj Mahal the next day, really beautiful and peaceful. Quite a quiet place, tourist wise :)

title: I love Tomb of Itimad ud Daulah, Agra
review: I went to see the tomb of Itimad ud Daulad - its also called as Baby Taj... This exquisite tomb of Mizra Ghiyas Beg should not be missed. This Persian nobleman was Mumtaz Mahal’s grandfather and Emperor Jehangir’s wazir (chief minister). His daughter Nur Jahan, who married Jehangir, built the tomb between 1622 and 1628 in a style similar to the tomb she built for Jehangir near Lahore in Pakistan. The workmanship on this tomb is really very good. One does not need much time to go around at Itimad...

title: Good for sunset viewing
review: We saw the 'baby Taj' at sunset.  Naturally it's not as good as it's bigger relative but it is still well worth seeing.

title: Beautiful!
review: Stunning monument, definitely worth the effort to visit. Peaceful and not as busy as other places.

title: Great place to visit
review: Beautiful tomb to visit ... great riverside view ... parking is a big problem. .. great architecture. .. best for sunset

title: Stunning architecture!!
review: On the way to Taj Mahal,Agra, we visited this place. I was completely awestruck by its beautiful architecture..built on the banks of Yamuna, in the city of Taj Mahal, Agra, this white marble building is a stunning example of the Mughal Architecture. Though tourists visit Agra for #tajmahal, one should not miss this one..this building stands out in itself, the glow of its white marble has not faded anywhere.  Highly recommended.

title: A  Must Visit
review: Fascinating, great inlay work using some amazing stone. The whole sight is in a reasonable condition. Some areas very good Take your shoe covers from the Taj. Very few visitors so peace to look and enjoy

title: Marvellous
review: Excellent architecture.Must visit for all tourists of all ages to learn more about Mughal era architecture.Time  to be spend 1hr max.

title: Nice place
review: As they called it the baby of taj mahal

title: Next to tajmahal
review: After seeing tajmahal i went to this place and it is a nice place to visit. It is in the city of agra

title: One of the places on the must see Agra attractions list
review: Good place to get some nice photos against the monument backdrop. Of course, you shouldn't mind the stray dogs or monkeys. Security is a joke as the lone male guard can only check male tourists. Please remember to leave your foot wear just before you enter the main monument. Not worth staying for more than 1/2 hour. Parking charge is ridiculous Rs 60. Definitely fleecing those come via car. Guess it is case of robbing the middle class more :-)

title: Nice stop if you have time
review: The 'mini-taj' is a lovely little stop if you have some extra time in Agra. It doesn't take more than 20 minutes to walk around the grounds, have a peek inside, and look out over the river.

title: Better Preserved than the Taj Mahal
review: This is a must visit and although smaller than the Taj Mahal is better preserved and its more decorated inside. I would highly recommend a visit to see the tombs and the intricate decorations

title: A stunning must visit jewlery box
review: A really amazing tomb (also known as the "Baby Taj", delicately and artfully built in marble, with beautiful floral designs.  Everybody goes to Agra for The Taj, but frankly, if you go to Agra and not visit the "Baby Taj", you are missing a lot.  Setting on the other side of the river is very beautiful.

title: Baby Taj
review: Thats what it is named as Baby Taj ... Very similar to taj mahal and also on the bank of river yamuna... You can make a plan of this place as well if you want to explore more of agra

title: Beautiful, and only takes about 30 minutes to enjoy
review: Travellers spending more than a day in Agra could do worse than to visit the incredibly picturesque Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah. We visited in the afternoon, and we had the place almost to ourselves. It's a small investment in time, and shouldn't be a major detour for anyone in the area.

title: Beautiful and exquisite
review: A relatively small complex, this has beautiful and exquisite carving, inlays and decoration. Often referred to as the 'baby taj' it's much smaller but the quality of the craftsmanship equally beautiful. Definitely a must see in Agra

title: Baby Taj
review: A smaller version of the Taj Mahal, which lots of details.

title: Awesome Place
review: I had a really nice time at "Baby Taj". I went there just before sunset and it was a really nice atmosphere. Of course it is not comparable to Taj Mahal, but definitely a must see.

title: Honest Review
review: I (31/m) and my gf (35/f) visited in early August 2016.

title: ok to add on as an additional tour
review: this tour in itself does not take long - we did it in about 45 minutes - not much to see and the grounds are quite small - the baby taj.  The architecture was a point to note otherwise this is something that can be done without a guide in my view...

title: another amazing place in Agra
review: When I book my trip to see the Taj Mahal I was not aware of some many other things to see Agra.  Please do you research and also get a good local guide like Azdar Khan.  He show many other sites beside world know Taj.

title: Truly a precursor to Taj visit
review: This tomb which is just a few kilometres away from the Agra fort is a must visit when you are arriving at Agra, The entire structure along with all the artistry will take you back to those glorious days of the Mughals. The premise is well maintained and the view of the Yamuna is excellent especially in the evening when the cool breeze makes you feel so relaxed. The bridges across the river and the buildings on the other side of the river are an eyesore but then that's the price we have to pay to be modern. One needs to open your shoes and go inside the mausoleum and whatever is left of this beautiful piece of art is a must go. Here you wont be bothered by touts or guides or hawkers so you can go around in peace.

title: Baby Taj
review: Which build 100 yrs. Before Taj mahal.. Intresting history of tomb of itimad ud... Must visit.... Better with guide.....

title: Go now before its fully discovered/mobbed
review: "Baby Taj" is stunningly beautiful and seriously under-visited. Small and doable well within an hour of arrival. It's a very quiet and contemplative place which is every bit as beautiful and meaningful as the Taj proper.

title: Beauty
review: The work on the tomb is so beautiful that you get a feel of a mini Tajmahal. The actual idea was this.

title: A must see!
review: We visited the 'baby taj' on recommendations from online. After a busy morning at the Taj, we were shocked to be the ONLY people visiting at that time. The baby taj was stunning, a personal favorite for the extensive and intricate work with the marble and painting. Don't skip this one!

title: The Baby Taj
review: We were surprised by this gen in Agra. Had visited Agra several times until we discovered this tomb. Now it is a must see, usually in the afternoon. Very few people are there.

title: Baby taj!
review: One of the most underated monuments here in India. The building is gorgeus with obvius paralelisms with Taj. It was very fun to see the kids swiming in the Yamuna river while we rest on the grass

title: It's good place
review: Nice view behind tomb and it's funny thing I saw there river a kid who was swimming in river and teasing there tourist but nobody dare to stop them no security guard and I keep my shoes there and somebody said its not free and he charge me some Money!

title: Love it!
review: So called as baby taj and justifiably so, amidst history of the place you see eyecatching architecture which makes even lovelier sight when sky above is colorful. Must visit!

title: Interesting Place
review: It is one of the beautiful places to visit in Agra. Along with the main building it consists of the sub-ordinate building which glorify its beauty. It is made up of Red sandstone with marble decorations all over the building. The monument is the center of the garden and the garden is well preserved with trees of many types. The monument is also known as ‘Baby Taj’ and it has lot of monkeys.

title: Mughal Architectural marvel
review: Supposedly built by Nur Jahan (wife of Jahangir) for her father and mothers tombs, this is a architectural marvel of Mughal (more of persian) architecture.

title: Agra
review: A very good example of the wealth of the mughals in those days. Worth a short visit. Although not as grand as the Taj.

title: Nice place
review: It is a nice place which is also known as baby taj. It is very great.Every room has different patterns printed on walls...

title: What a fabulous architecture
review: It is one of its kind architecture and should not be missed by anybody visiting agra since it is on the way to the TAJ Mahal.

title: Mini Taj Mahal
review: If you are in Agra must Plan to visit this place as well ...Great Architecture , Calm Place adjacent to Yamuna River .

title: could be given a miss
review: Also known as Baby Taj. Built by Noor Jahan as a memory for her father Itmad-ud- Daula. Very intricate marble work outside. Paved with beautiful water channels which are getting renovated i guess. Must be a beauty in all its glory. Insides are savaged and poorly maintained. Not sure if the fresco work is done. if at all done, it has been done really poorly. We did not take any guide, may be taking a government authorised guide along would help you appreciate the place more. Did not find it worth spending more than 20-30 minutes.

title: The quieter cousin
review: Also known as the little taj, this monument on the river banks is far less visited, and is much less crowded. It is not so nicely maintained. However the structure, Windows, roof and architecture is equally fascinating.

title: You can see see where the Taj concept was born
review: This was a very low key attraction, probably more so because we visited during monsoonal down pours.  If it is raining be prepared to get wet feet walking in, there is simply no way around it.

title: Baby Taj
review: Stunningly beautiful. Well worth a visit. Good precursor to visiting the Taj Mahal. Advice take plenty of water.

title: Built before the Taj Mahal
review: This tomb looks like a Baby Taj and the local guides refer to it as that. It is a lot smaller, but still has impressive art works and inlayed marble.

title: Very pretty and decorative marble.
review: Stopped here for a good 30 mins walking around the "baby taj". Great example of marble work skill and techniques to see. Went late in the afternoon so not many people there at all. Was nice to walk down to the river and see Agra beside the river.

title: White marble Mughal Architecture
review: Nice historical architecture. This white marble Mughal Architecture is worth to visit for history lovers.

title: Commonly known as 'Baby Taj'
review: The Taj Mahal was based on this much smaller palace. Still very impressive, far quieter than Taj with lots to soak up in terms of history. A useful short add-on to the main attractions in Agra.

title: A little jewel
review: This is a beautiful small mausoleum for the family of Mumtaz Mahal. Lots of details in the walls and ceiling. It is worth a visit!

title: Must Visit
review: Also known as baby Taj it Is a wonderful pièce of architecture. Very fine and intricate inlay work. Take time to enjoy the craftmanship. Huge open Space around adds to the charm. Car parking outside is not proper at all. Visited third time. One of my favourites in Agra.

title: mini Tajmahal
review: This is also one of the most beautiful  mausoleum in  Agra ( India). No doubt Agra is famous for taj mahal but as  a guide  i always recommend  my guest to visit this small building.This is first building  was built with white marble. Shahjahan got an idea  to built tajmahal with white marble.That's why this is also called as mini tajmahal.

title: medival marvel
review: itmad-ud-daulah is the another beautiful historic building in agra. it is situated on the opposite side of river jamuna about 15k.m. from the city.it was built by empress noor jahan , the beloved wife of prince  saleem or jahangir , in the memory of her father mirza ghiyas beg , who was the prime-minister of the mughal court.it was built in 1622 a.d  and completed in1629 a.d.

title: Baby Taj!
review: This place also known as 'Baby Taj' is not very far from the heart of the city. All tourists must visit it.

title: Good place on the way
review: This place came across when we were on the way to Agra Fort. This is dedicated to father of Noor Jahan. Nice place to see. The marble work is very good and shows what has gone into building the great taj mahal.

title: Good for an hour
review: Well worth a visit. Lovely tomb with impressive architecture and lovely features to explore. Friendly, welcoming and calm. Bring a camera.

title: Must See at Agra
review: Not part of normal tourist circuit but its a must see.  Lovely work on white marble..  Its a small attraction.

title: Small place
review: Centred on a tough neighbourhood.   Nice and quiet sanctuary.   Pretty little place.  But expensive considering how small it is.  200 rupees.

title: Not a must see
review: 20 minutes here is enough to visit this attraction as there isn't much too see. Gardens are not like the Taj. Structure itself is different. Worth a visit if your passing.

title: Monument that has inspired the Taj Mahal
review: Tomb of Itimad ud Daulah is a 17th Century monument located in Agra. It was built by Noor Jahan (wife of Mughal Emperor Jahangir) for her father Itimad ud Daulah.

title: Best kept secret
review: Also known as baby taj.  Many tourists miss this extravagant piece of work.  excellent picture opportunities.  More styles used in the decorations here than Taj Mahal.  Please go with a Government Guide as they will reveal the beautiful story of the tomb.

title: Go with guide and enjoy the full details of tomb
review: It looks like another print of tajmahal but nice architecture lot of works there for taking photos .. you must have a guide for tomb's history details .. so many not visited this place .. so go and enjoy peacefully

title: Mini Taj Mahal
review: not very much crowded very small  it on the bank of river its inlay work is done by using different types of stones and not semi precious stone this monument has the grave of Noorjahan father mother and other relatives and it is told to be design by Noorjahan herself.

title: beauty at its epitome
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is a Mughal mausoleum in the city of Agra in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh. Often described as a "jewel box", sometimes called the "Baby Tāj", the tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah is often regarded as a draft of the Tāj Mahal.

title: Masjid
review: This mosque is inside of Taj Mahal.. Very spacious one with houze in built... History says people were performing five times prayer in this mosque.

title: Must see this site!
review: I didn't know this was here!  Our guide called it the mini- Taj.  I actually enjoyed it better than the Taj because it was not crowded& it was a surprise to see!  The inlay is not to be believed!  I think it was built 50 years before the Taj Mahal & built by the same architect.  The Taj Mahal is based on this design.

title: Beautifully cratfed!
review: Very impressive and beautiful design walls! it's architecture, ancient look, will send you back in the past.

title: Truly a wonder of the world
review: This is one amazing, capturing,  inspiring and awesome place to visit. Highly recommended, and my advise is to book all through Trinetra Tours And Agra Walks. We had a great experience and customer service was awesome.

title: Nice to see..
review: We stopped by on the way back to Delhi. It is a nice tomb, also called "Baby Taj". Worth to be seen!

title: Well worth a visit, but watch out for the aggressive monkeys!
review: Often labeled "The Baby Taj," this tomb is quite large and impressive in its own right.  With less than a fraction of the visitors at The Taj Mahal, this place gives you plenty of space to walk around and explore without the hassle of lots of people.  The inlaid marble is beautiful, but not quite as nice as the Taj Mahal.  So beware the monkeys who live there... they can be quite aggressive! Two of the people in our party were scratched by monkeys who didn't like us being in "their" space.  Carry a stick or something to fight them off, if need be.  Otherwise, beautiful architecture and amazing craftsmanship is to be seen throughout this structure.

title: First Tomb of India
review: Built between 1622 till 1628 by Noor jahan for her father is built by res stone and with marble decorative inlay works very beautiful work ,I think taj mahal work is inspired from this.

title: Somewhat interesting
review: This is normally included in a tour circuit, and I guess it's worthwhile. Of course it doesn't compare with the big Taj, but what does? My take is that it's good to see even if only to compare, to serve as reference point to the perfection just seen on the other side of the river.

title: Absolutely stunning
review: The architecture in India just kept continuing to amaze us.  The colours, the cleverness of the designs, the history.  This was breathtaking.  A guide is recommended as you get so much more information.

title: 1st visit
review: This site just happen to be on our list, and we spent a lovely morning here, very well kept grounds, Well worth a visit

title: Nice place, but not in very hot days
review: its nice place to visit, but in summers, the temperature are approx. 47 C which makes difficult to move at outside, it's better to visit in the evening.

title: Itimad-ud Daula is the most beautiful sculptured monument in a Agra About 3 Km away from Agra red Fort
review: The carvings of the monument is said to be done by Noor Jahan The tomb is in remembrance of her foster parents who brought her to India after the death of her parents in deserts. If one enjoys the carvings this is the place to visit while in Agra

title: I preferred this to the big Taj
review: The Baby Taj, was my favorite of them all. Unsure as to why but i Love everything about it!.

title: Attractive
review: Attractions in agra city. There is already many tourist places include taj mahal. This is also one of the attraction.

title: Nice tomb
review: Nice place like Taj it's called baby Taj and nice embroidery design culture of art and the front stone nice looks

title: Baby Taj
review: With the same ticket as the Taj you get a discount(if you visit it in the same day) and Baby Taj is a great place to visit.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: Baby Taj is actually the predecessor and inspiration for the Taj.  I found it to be even a nicer experience but that was probably because there were only about 5-10 people there when I was there but there were 1000s of people sharing the taj with me.

title: Nice place
review: Little Taj Mahal, small place with nice structure. Not too crowded. You can visit if you have extra time.

title: Best Experience
review: Tomb of itimad-ud-daulah, also known as "jewel box" as well as "baby taj".

title: BABY TAJ OF AGRA - INDIA
review: I t is a great example of Mughal Musoleum in the icty of Agra.  It is a  tomb of   "ITIMAD-UD -DAULA " .  It is commisioned  by Noorjahan the wife of Jahangir.  It is the palce of rest of Noor Jahans Father 'MIRZA GHIYAS BEG"  a persian  Amir who got the title " ITIMUD=UD=DAULAH"  from his  son in law..  The tomb built between 1622 and 1628 reperesents the first phase of monumnetal mughal architecture primarily built  from red sand stone with marble decorated with gems and gold platings..

title: The "baby Taj "... Beautiful
review: Didn't even know this existed before this visit! Absolutely incredible to think this was built between 1622-1638. Saw this before our visit to the Taj Mahal , and were blown away by its beauty. The peace & serenity were palpable. Even though it was a very hot day, it was wonderful to spend some time there. Certainly prepared us for an even more stunning visit to the actual Taj Mahal . A "must see" attraction

title: Baby Taj -- very good
review: From our point of view there are only 3 attractions in Agra, which are Taj Mahal, Agra Fort and this one. But all three are really worth visiting. Of cause the "Baby Taj" this is how tomb of Itmad-ud-Daulah is called sometimes, ist not as spectecular as the real Taj Mahal but is is really nice, friendly and deliveres a big portion of harmoniy and rmantic. We would strongly recommend to visit this BEFORE the Taj as this order leaves you the more spectacular for the end.

title: Baby Taj or the Jewel Box
review: Another beautiful tomb.  The materials (marble and stone) are slightly different than others we saw.  They are working on the sunken garden, which is designed so that you can reach out and pick fruit from the trees - should be extraordinary.

title: An inspiration for the Taj
review: On the banks of the Yamuna lies the Baby Taj or the Jewel box. It is said to be the inspiration behind the Taj Mahal. This structure was built between 1622 and 1628. Commissioned by Nur Jahan as a mausoleum for her father Mirza Ghiyas Beg who was known as the Itimad-ud-Daula( pillar of the state).

title: Is this a mini Taj
review: Our drive told us this to be a mini Taj - I am not sure what actually is this. We saw this from out side nly. It was very very hot in May to travel about details. We could not see details because of the extreme heat 45C.

title: Baby Taj - Copy of Taj Mahal
review: Tomb located on the bank of Yamuna River in the city of Agra. Famous with the name of Baby Taj. Another monument representing greatness of Mughal Architecture, lush green garden and view of Yamuna is awesome..

title: The baby Taj
review: This is not to be missed, it is gorgeous, smaller than the Taj but just as nice.

title: Better than the Taj
review: Maybe its because we have all seen a thousand images of the Taj Mahal before, that we felt less impressed than perhaps we would have done otherwise. Whatever the reason, we certainly had our 'wow factor' moment when we visited here to see the Baby Taj.

title: Corruption!
review: Though the building is beautiful, the lacks of tourists are given aeroplane slippers by the security guard after removing footwear and money is demanded. This is actually a free service

title: Baby Taj?
review: This is a nice little place to visit, known as baby taj and is kept in good order, glad I went, my guide Vikram was full of interesting? facts about the place

title: Often overlooked
review: The Baby Taj, built 90 years before the Taj Mahal is very bit, it not more so, as intricate as its bigger cousin, although it has been fire damaged.  This is not high on most tourists radar and as a result, is much quieter.  The gardens are being restored and the building will also receive some restoration attention soon.  It is a photographers' dream.

title: The Baby Taj
review: This is a monument of amazing beauty and one should not miss when you are in Agra. It is not so popular and hence not covered in the tourist circuits. However, you should take time out and see this place without fail. Its a monument built by Mumtaz (wife of Sahajahan) for her parents. The Marble architecture and the stone work art is very beautiful. It is located on the opposite banks of the Yamuna and is about 9 kms from Taj mahal. It is also known as the Baby Taj by the locals. You can reach by Auto or can hire a cab to reach this place and spend about 30 to 40 mins here. So, do visit the Baby Taj at Agra.

title: Not known enough
review: We were there alone - nobody (locals or tourists) was there. Pity, because it is beautiful monument, full of details. We were told by our guide that this is the only building made completely by marble.

title: Baby Taj treasure box
review: We were the only visitors-perhaps due to extreme heat (110+)- and really enjoyed the solitude. This should be visited BEFORE TAJ bc after seeing that wonder, everything seems "small". Use this as lead-up to the Taj. Look at the delicate details-ceilings-views-

title: Great attraction
review: I have not much heard about it, however the experience after was very nice. Take in enough water with you when in summer.

title: 3 girlfriends visiting Northern India
review: Gorgeous architecture.  Make sure you do this before going to the Taj itself.  It is called the "baby Taj" for a reason but well worth the trip and $$

title: Stunning
review: Almost better than the Taj, the surface of the building close up is stunning.We were lucky in that the grounds were almost empty and we had the place to ourselves and really appreciated the grounds and the building as a quiet interlude to the hustle and bustle of the Taj. Highly recommended

title: A gem of indo-islamic architecture
review: Wikipedia was right, when it stated that the marble works at this older tomb is more sophisticated than the Taj's. The little visited monument is awesome and we were very happy to have seen it.

title: So glad I visited.
review: Well known by everyone as Baby Taj. It was a surprise how good it was. I really enjoyed.

title: fine architectural marvel
review: its something similar to Taj Mahal.very fine blend of persian and arabic art. great place for history lovers

title: Very interesting
review: Located across the river from the Taj Mahal (you can get a good view of the "back" of the Taj), it's beautiful in it's own rite. Intricate inlays and relief carvings. Certainly worth visiting if you have a bit of extra time in Agra.

title: surprise
review: What a little gem this place has virtually no visitors and a minature version of the more famous Taj Mahal. I would not miss this off your itinery

title: Taj in a small scale
review: This little Taj, built before the great one, is quite stunning as an early example of the white marble vogue. There is the usual architectural symmetry, lovely in laid marble drawings (the love of flowers and the wine bottles for Nur Jahan's father supposedly), beautiful designs on the marble ceilings and floors... There is something delicate about this little Taj that is very attractive. It is worth it to take a little break sitting outside or walk the grounds a bit.

title: Beautiful marble inlay work
review: Another beautiful building to explore and admire. This mausoleum was one of the first to use marble in the interior and on the exterior. There are beautiful floral decorations and intricate patterns to enjoy.

title: A Little Gem
review: The Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah also know as the Baby Taj, completed in 1628 predates it big sister by 20 years. Whilst much small than the Taj it's no less impressive. A must visit, it's less crowded and maintained in pristine condition and provides stunning views over the Yamuna River. Highly Recommended.

title: Tiny perfect alternative
review: This monument is a photographers dream, without the hordes found nearby at a certain world-famous edifice. That's the point: in some ways, this smaller structure was the historical demo model for the Taj. Take your camera there first thing in the morn and you will experience a fantastic foto op, with easy access to pietra dura panels every bit as appealing as those found on the Taj: birds, vases, patterns and more. There is also a tunnel-framing perspective here as well. A must-see, trust me. I am done. The end.

title: the baby Taj Mahal
review: Beautiful and really particular. If you want to understand the Taj Mahal, you have to visit this monuments.

title: Great structure with great detail
review: The place has tons of details. We went in the afternoon and it was empty, which was great for pictures. The area is quickly seen but it is worth seeing.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: This is a beautiful tomb of Empress Noor Jehan's father.

title: Also called the Baby Taj, this is a nice addition to the Taj Mahal in any Agra Trip.
review: Nice little tomb, also called the Baby Taj. This is a tomb to Noor Jahan's parents. It has the same white marble look and feel of the Taj but has not been maintained as well as its more famous counterpart. Nevertheless its a great addition to an Agra Trip. The tomb has many references to the emperor's wine habit as well as other vices.

title: Great place must see
review: IF YOU THOUGHT TAJ MAHAL IS GREAT.

title: Baby Taj - Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: A terrific, non-crowded site in Agra.  A smaller version of the Taj Mahal that is located on the other side of the river.  Pay for the shoe covers - cost about 10 rupee tip per person.  Well worth it.  Doesn't need much time, but a very symmetrical picture and great photo op.

title: Better than Taj!
review: This place was really interesting and apparently the original Taj - its more detailed than the taj albeit not semi precious stones, for 200 its a steal also and its nice an quiet to soak in the ambiance.

title: Baby Taj....
review: personally for me it is equally splendid and marvellous than taj mahal. The lattice work here is splendidly done and you will get good view of Yamuna river but river is dried up and you will see people taking bath and washing cloth their which is very common in india.

title: A MUST visit !
review: After seeing the Tripadvisor reviews we made time to go here (even though it is not as talked about as the other attractions ). And, it is truly a JEWEL . Exquisite, we were so glad that we were able to visit it. The maintenance should be better. It is breathtakingly beautiful ,peaceful and serene. The paintings and inlay work are stunning.

title: Quiet and Stunningly beautiful!
review: Many simply refer to this tomb as "the Baby Taj" - what I can say is that it was Beautiful!  The sheer amount of inlay on this monument was amazing!  To imagine the effort that went into the construction of this tomb is beyond words.  I was simply in awe that this was not mobbed with tourists, but it truly was quiet and reflective.  Be sure to visit when you are in Agra!

title: Incredible! Please, make the time to go visit
review: This was an amazing place for us to visit. The history is storied and the architecture is fascinating, a precursor to the construction to the Taj Mahal.

title: Mini taj
review: Small in comparison to other buildings in area but still fantastic to see

title: difficult to find roads not very good
review: Called baby Taj,  excellent marble carving of mausoleum , well preserved,   must see while in Agra,  can take photos

title: Exquisite little delight
review: Built between 1622-28 and sometimes nicknames the Baby Taj this delicate tomb on the banks of the Yamuna River is delightful. The first Mughal structure built entirely from marble it has lovely lattice screens. It also seems to be largely ignored by the crowds making it doubly pleasant to visit. A must see whilst in Agra.

title: Historical
review: Very nice place. Remove shoes. Take about 1 hour to see the place. Parking and paid toilets are available.

title: Stunning
review: If you enjoy the beauty of Taj Mahal and other Mughal architecture, go here too. In April it was very quiet, and the gardens with antelope, etc make it a peaceful place.

title: Pleasant, But Not Far From The Ordinary
review: Overview: Relatively small, but well-kept historical structure.

title: Baby Taj
review: We spent an hour visiting The Baby Taj. It's small compared to all other tourist sites in India, so I feel if you're short on time you could skip this, I think you could see everything you see here at other sites. I would also double check your change when you pay for your ticket-we gave the ticket seller 1000rupees and he tried to give us change for 500rupees-they can spot a tourist who may not be used to the currency a mile off!

title: Update
review: I have been to the tomb a couple of times. The last in 2012. Having visited again this year it is worth noting that an investment is being made in restoring aspects of the monument and the historic format of the gardens. A recommended attraction which is likely to improve further.

title: Fascinating baby Taj
review: Nicknamed as baby taj is actually an inspiration for Shah Jahan to built the grandeur Taj Mahal. Itmad-ud-Daula hold a special place in Agra. An exquisite monument built by Shah Jahan's grandmother Nur Jahan for her parents.The Tomb situated on the left bank of river Jamuna. Entrance fees INR100 applicable for adult & children below 15 yrs old enter for free.

title: worth a visit
review: If you are in Agra, this is worth a visit! Also called the Mini Taj Mahal, the building follows the basic structure of taj mahal!!

title: Inlay Work is nice
review: It is small but the quality of inlay work is nice it is little out of city on the way to express high way to Delhi but it is worth visiting once

title: Locals call it 'the Baby Taj"
review: This is on the opposite side of the river to the fort and it houses a beautiful 17th Century mausoleum with lovely inlaid marble.There are lovely views over the river and it's quite quiet but not worth going out of your way to visit.

title: Mini Taj and without the crowds
review: We enjoyed our visit here - beautiful buildiing on the river with very few people when we visited. does not have the awe and spendour of the Taj, but the craftmanship is still splendid.

title: Fabulous
review: It is a wonderful white monument made by Nur Jahan for her father on the bank of the river Yamuna. I took a shared auto-rickshaw from Bijli Ghar (very near Agra Fort ticket counter) which charges Rs 10 to Itamad-ud-daula. Always ask for the auto to Rambagh and monument falls on your left minutes after you cross Yamuna.

title: White Mausoleum...!!!
review: Just opposite of river Yumuna built between 1622-28 AD.This is the tomb of Mirza Ghiyas Beg and his wife Asmat Begum he hailed from Iran and served Emperor Akbar he was father of the famous Nur Jehan and grand father of Mumtaz.The tomb is master piece of the dome less class of Mughal tombs,it was the first building finished in white marble and marks the traditional phase from red stone to white marble from Akbar"s tomb Sikandra to the Taj Mahal,it reflects the personality of the polished Iranian who lies buried here.Best place for photography.

title: A Mini Taj Mahal
review: This place served as a model for the designer of the Taj Mahal.  Across the river from the Agra Fort.  Beautiful location, a well laid out site.  Interesting as it preceded the Taj in its construction.

title: History a Must
review: As i have mentioned with the other sights of Agra although beautiful to look at it is the history that gives you the full appreciation of what you are seeing and this can only be done by having a very knowledgeable guide. A must see.

title: Baby Taj !!
review: Much more impressive than expected. Really peaceful park and well preserved, relatively small but elegant monument, which was truly impressive.

title: Not a very great place to visit
review: Itimadola is not a very good place to visit nothing to see here not located at very good place no facilities available here.

title: Baby Taj
review: House of tombs, less imposing than the big Taj, though along the same lines.

title: AKA Baby Taj Mahal
review: Because there's not a ton to do in Agra and if you have the time, I would definitely recommend visiting this tomb. While known as the Baby Taj, make no mistake, it's no where near as powerful but in it's own right, worthy of a visit.

title: Must see Baby Taj
review: Thus mausoleum was part of the inspiration for the much larger Taj Mahal. The outside decorative work in marble, as well as the inside decorative features are amazing and so beautiful. The whole site is perfectly symmetrical with the other buildings also interesting to see. The garden is being restored so that will be lovely one day.

title: Absolutely stunning
review: I loved this visit.  The Baby Taj as it is otherwise known.  Just stunning stonework.  Really quiet and a good view out across the Yamuna.  A must visit on the Agra trail.  Don't get too close to the monkeys here, they are really aggressive, but then having seen the way the staff chase them I am not surprised.

title: baby taj
review: this is called baby taj. this is outstanding building and very first tomb in India, which was built of entirely white marble.

title: Nice Tomb
review: Went there because we wanna see the baby Taj before the real one. It's nice but nothing really special. The price is high for what you see. But it's a beautiful building.

title: Don't bother
review: Not often I say this, but you can skip this one without regret, especially after seeing the Taj. Our guide was reluctant to take us here, even though the tour company had listed it on our itinerary. Had to pay 100INR each, plus shoe "minding " fee of 20. Total waste of time and money.

title: See this one first !!
review: See the baby Taj first because you will be disappointed after you saw the big Taj Mahal. It's still fine to visit this tomb, not so many tourists and you can sit, rest and watch the river. Very nice marble inlay work !!

title: The beautiful minaret!!!
review: The beautiful era of Mughal can be clearly seen here with all the architecture and a hard work of thousands of people....

title: Father of a queen, lying here
review: Also known as silver tomb, the monument should not be missed and one can spend a couple of hours here, watching this tribute of a queen daughter to her Father

title: Wow
review: The first ever built building by marble in India and very first time used inlay work on marble. Fantastic place to see. Highly recommended .

title: A money grab!
review: It's an emotional experience for many, buy basically a tourist trap and a waste of time. The tour guides, who tend to be Muslims, are in cohorts with the cheddar sellers who mint money circulating the same offerings over and over again!

title: Mini Taj
review: Liked this monument very much. It is well maintained. and less crowded. Provides good photo opportunity too. You could spend upto an hour here...

title: Quick pre-Taj
review: The structure itself is tiny and with the surrounding grounds offers cca 15 minutes of lovely views and nice photography sceneries.

title: Baby Taj, stunning, almost as good as big brother.
review: Our second stop on our organised city tour of Agra. Itimad-ud-Daulah's tomb or Baby Taj as it is affectionately known is beautiful.  As the sun shines on it, the marble building seems to sparkle.

title: Another architectural building named as Baby Taj
review: If you are lover of Architectural buildings do not miss If you are in Agra

title: Must visit..!!
review: Although tajmahal is a gigantic in itself. Itimad lies nowhere less in beauty. Rest on a stone and adore the beauty of the beautiful composition. They were freaking good in there architecture.

title: Another great companion visit with the Taj Mahal
review: Known as the Baby Taj Mahal, it was built before the big Taj Mahal.  Worth a visit, later in the day after you've been to other sites, not as crowded.

title: charming
review: The tomb is located across the river from Agra inside a small garden. It should be visited before you see the Taj. Beautifully decorated with inlay and fresco.

title: Typical Moghul structure
review: If you visit this place after seeing Taj Mahal, you may not like it. But a typical Moghul style architecture to see the mausoleum.

title: Interesting to compare to the Taj Mahal
review: You don't need to battle throngs of tourists like you do when you visit the Taj Mahal. This "Baby Taj" is quite beautiful and interesting  and overlooks people doing their laundry in the river below.

title: The Baby Raj
review: This was a beautiful building we visited and whew had only a handful of people ath the tomb - it was so quiet.  It overlooked the river and there were interesting sights there too.  Look up into the tomb roof in the corners where the colours are amazing considering the age of the building.

title: Marvellous sculpture
review: Marvellous sculpture but nothing in front of Taj indeed. Can give a mis if running short of time. Not necessary

title: Evening or Dawn
review: From a photographic perspective the best times to visit would be dawn or dusk. We visited at midday and the sun reflection was quite harsh, it was a nice never the less, not a popular attraction in the area.

title: Baby taj
review: Quick visit for pics. Has a bathroom but need to pay 5 ruppes which is nothing. Can not wear shoes so wear socks or bring shoe covers. If not there is someone that will sell u slippers for $2 dollars or re-use some shoe covers for any rupees you may want to give. Has 9 different styles of art which makes this very unique.

title: Baby Taj
review: Beautiful building but nothing compared to Taj Mahal. Not a must see but worth a visit if you have some time over.

title: Baby Taj
review: We went for the sunset here, it was quiet and like others we actually liked it more than the crowded big Taj Mahal.

title: The quiant little Baby Taj
review: It's a pretty small place so you won't need alot of time here. 30mins is more than enough. It's place right on the river bank.

title: Cute
review: This is cute from afar but the one thing is that you gotta pay to enter and already Taj Mahal is 750 rupees and on top of that to pay for Baby Taj, I would rather go for the main.

title: Agra Tour 12.03.16
review: No Guide is required. Recommended to visit this place first before going to Taj so one can admire this place. Please carry your shoe cover otherwise you have to pay and use a used pair of shoe cover. You can visit Mehetab Bagh on the same route.

title: Cutee Taj Baby !!!
review: Right on the river bank is situated this Tomb. Pretty small place but beautiful. It is also known as Baby Taj. Could be avoided if your are short of time and already spent considerable time at Taj. You need to buy tickets again at this palace.

title: Time to spare? Worth a visit.
review: A mini Taj Mahal set out very similar to its younger brother. A nice place to spend some time wandering around with gates on either side. Remember to take your Taj ticket and you'll save a bit of money.

title: Beautiful elegant structure
review: Beautiful elegant structure, low admission price (100RS), not much frequented by tourists. You will be able to visit this ezquiste monument in peace and quiet.

title: A peaceful place
review: Itmad ud daulah tomb is located on rivet Yamuna.

title: If you've got time ...
review: Another nice tomb around Agra. If you have time might be worth a visit. If you take your Taj Mahal ticket you will get a slight discount. Couldn't really work out the significance of this place but it's like a mini Taj.

title: A good attraction if you have time
review: We visited this "baby Taj" after tour the Taj Mahal. It is much smaller and less people. Great for taking photos and relax walk.

title: Mini Taj
review: Visited this tomb on an extra excursion on the Kuoni Taj tour. It is a lovely peaceful place next to the river. The stone work is stunning inside and out and there is no restriction on taking photographs. It is also quite quiet. Again shoes have to be removed to go inside. They are busy renovating the gardens which I am sure will be stunning in a few years time. The monkeys entertained us. If you are in Agra this is a must place to visit. I am sure that is going to become more popular.

title: Inspiration for the Taj Mahal?
review: Built by the grandfather of Mumtaz Mahal perhaps this building gave her grieving husband the idea for the Taj Mahal. It is in any case a lovely building, well worth a visit.

title: Lovely grounds & Baby Taj
review: Mughal Gardens of Agra & Mausoleum complex of Itimad-ud-Daulah is also known as the Baby Taj.  This exquisite marble tomb was built in1622-1628 A.D. by Emperor Jahangir's queen, Nurjahan in memory of her father, Mirza Ghias Beg . The tomb’s elaborately carved white marble with inlaid semi-precious stones reflects major influences from the Persian empire. It is believed that this tomb and intricate stone inlay, called Pietra-Dura, inspired the design of the Taj Mahal.  The grounds are quiet and peaceful without a ton of tourists. Worth a visit if you have the time.

title: disappointing
review: the tomb on banks of Yamuna, is ill managed, dirty and sows lack of interest of government . it needs a lot of restoration, and cleaning

title: Nice place, Baby Taj Mahal
review: Baby Taj Mahal as they say, this place is good to start with, its near to Yamuna bridge, less crowded, should visit if you have time to spare

title: Very, very, very nice
review: Agra is famous for many monuments. The Taj, Agra Fort, Fatehpur Sikri and Sikandara. This beautiful tomb does not get the same publicity and spotlight.

title: Architecture par excellence
review: Must visit place not just for history but more for its fine and beautiful architecture. You will love the art on white marble. Fine example of Mughal monument after the Taj in Agra.

title: Lovely baby taj
review: Lovely and peaceful baby taj. Great quiet and peaceful. You must wear foot covers over your shoes. Please take an information book or tour guide to advise you on the history as there is limited information there.

title: Mini Taj
review: It looks like a replica of Taj but it's far behind from that.Made of white marble.Great piece of architecture. A must try spot if you are in Agra.

title: Dainty Jewel Box.!
review: Swing by this place after our Taj Mahal and Agra Fort visit and we didn’t regret it.! It is the 1st Mughal structure built entirely from marble way before the Taj Mahal was built. It’s like a dainty jewel box as described by many. Beautiful marble artwork and still very well-maintained.

title: Even more beautiful than the Taj Mahal
review: this is by far one of my favourite places/monuments that we visited. it is a pre-cursor to the Taj Mahal and is much smaller with fewer tourists. its not just made of white marble, it is inlaid with so many more gems and stones that it looks like a jewellery box, it really is beautiful.

title: Impressive
review: This tomb is the forerunner to the Taj Mahal and is just as beautiful but much smaller. The painting inside the building is incredible - bearing in mind it's over 300 years old. A must visit if you are in Agra.

title: Exquisitely beautiful.
review: This is on the other side of the river to the main town so takes a little while to drive there, but it is absolutely worth the visit, and much less crowded than the Taj Mahal.  It has exquisite architecture and decoration.

title: Pretty but needs maintenance
review: +ve's:

title: The Baby Taj!
review: Most visitors to Agra overlook this beautiful tomb.  I find it to be an excellent complement to a visit to the Taj Mahal and something visitors to Agra should not absolutely not miss.  Indeed, I'd put it third on my list after the Taj and the Red Fort.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: The mausoleum was commissioned by Nūr Jahān, the wife of Jahangir, for her father Mirzā Ghiyās Beg, originally a Persian Amir in exile  who had been given the title of I’timād-ud-Daulah (pillar of the state). Mirzā Ghiyās Beg was also the grandfather of Mumtāz Mahāl (originally named Arjūmand Bāno, daughter of Asaf Khān), the wife of the emperor Shāh Jahān, responsible for the building of the Tāj Mahal.

title: Worthwhile the visit while touring the Agra area
review: While touring the Agra area visit this place as well! It doesn't have the grand feeling of the Taj Mahal. But keep in place that this place isn't a copy of the Taj but was build many years before the Taj and may have been the inspiration for the Taj. Your visit here won't take more than 30 mins to an hour but worthwhile. When the river levels are low you will see the people cleaning and drying the canvas in the river bedding.

title: Beautiful
review: I did not even know of the existence of this place, our tour guide included it. I was happy we stopped, it was beautiful.

title: Unbelievable details
review: A perfect example of hoe delicate a building can be when a woman designs it. It is like a lace work built using marbles. Every detail had been designed carefully and the color of the stones used fits as good as a painting.

title: Worth a visit
review: It's a sample of craftsmanship.. All the designs, engravings the marble craftsmanship that you find I the Mughal architecture all of it is present here in this small Tomb which is in the middle of char bagh design garden.

title: Also known as "The Baby Taj"
review: This building is a jewel of Indian architecture. It is smaller than the Taj Mahal but is just as ornate and lovely in its intimate and serene surroundings.

title: Nice
review: Locals call it Baby Taj and even like more than Taj Mahal itself. I can say that it is nice but not comparable with Taj at all. If you have some money  and free time to spend  so welcome otherwise you lose nothing if don't visit it.

title: Beautiful
review: This place is well worth a visit besides the Taj and the Fort. It is a quiet place as less people visit and the architecture is amazing. the detail in the work is remarkable and the grounds are serene and peaceful. It gives you time to admire the beauty and remarable workmanship.

title: Don't miss this place
review: Truly a jewel box, and a welcome respite after the crowds at the Taj. There usually aren't too many people visiting, which gives you the time -- and space -- to linger over the many beautiful flourishes.

title: The baby Taj
review: Great architecture, beautiful building made up of marble. The lace work and carvings are simply beautiful.

title: A diamond in a rather dirty and disappointing Agra
review: Of course we went to the Taj and yes you have to go to see it but this is the magical place in Agra. No crowds, no hawkers just a beautiful building by the river, so peaceful and entrancing.

title: An important sight not to be mised
review: A wonderfully preserved, spiritual place that is well worth visiting! While it is a bit hard to get to, it is worth it.

title: See "the Baby Taj" first
review: We arrived in Agra early afternoon on a Friday and our first visit with our guide was this Baby Taj.  It was a perfect preamble to the Taj Mahal which we would visit the next morning. It does not have the crowds and so you are leisure to get a close long look at the intricate carvings. We had the peace and quiet to watch the birds nesting in carved marble alcoves.

title: Must see!!!
review: Its a must visit. The exterior is beautifully done. I read somewhere that the Taj Mahal inlay work was a cue taken from this structure. The insides of this structure are in a bad shape though.

title: As good as the Taj
review: Some might disagree with that, and certainly it hasn't got the size, perfect symmetry and grandeur of the Taj Mahal. It's also a bit harder to get to, on the other side of the river (crossing the bridges can be very slow, though we were lucky), but perhaps that's why it's so quiet, which very much adds to the enjoyment.

title: Very impressive as first sight to see Agra
review: this is my first step to travel Agra, its has beautiful platform and less traveller , i suggest travel here take more pattern wall pics, really admired the great nice pattern.

title: Don't miss the Baby Taj...
review: The Baby Taj, a jewel in marble built by Nur Jahan in her fathers memory in 1622, is perhaps not as well known as the Taj Mahal but is almost as lovely and has the added advantage of fewer tourists.   Difficult to believe that a country capable of producing such beautiful works of art so long ago now has its streets piled high with rubbish and a significant proportion of its population living in abject poverty.  Every inch of this fabulous tomb was decorated with semi precious stones.  Fruit trees and flowers were carved into the marble and  inlaid with lapis lazuli, agate, jasper and onyx.  Breathtakingly lovely.  See it during the evening before your morning tour of the Taj Mahal.

title: Nice art work
review: The place consists of few tombs located inside the beautiful structure and in the middle. It is near to Yamuna River.

title: Nice, tiny and peaceful
review: Little copy of Taj Mahal. But this place is not crowded. Very small. But anyway, if have time, you should go there. Located about 7 km away from Taj Mahal.

title: Perfection
review: This monument is gracious,perfectly balanced and was a source of inspiration for the building of the Taj Mahal.

title: See this in addition to the Taj Mahal
review: We were glad to have a guide, otherwise we would not have visited this earlier, smaller mausoleum. Considerably less spectacular than the Taj Mahal, but with its own both simple and ornate beauty.

title: The Little Taj Mahal
review: If you need to answer questions and connect dots with all that happened before in Agra at the time the Big Taj Mahala was built you need to visit this tomb to fill in your query. The intricate and beautiful stone designs here are fine and its history fits in your Agra travel . Try the visit at sunrise.

title: Better than the Taj?
review: Could I be saying that, well yes, nothing can take away the draw of the taj but everyone who visits Taj should come here first it is a real gem in Agra and seemingly overlooked because it's on the wrong side of the river,  don't miss fore runner to the big one

title: A hidden gem
review: We came to know about this monument from our tour guide during our visit to Taj Mahal. As shared by him, this monument was built by Noor Jahan and served as an inspiration to Shahjahan. If you have time please do not give this monument a miss. The sheer beauty of this monument is captivating. I wish the interiors could have been preserved.

title: Beautiful Architecture
review: Apparently this was a fore runner to the Taj Mahal. It is very beautiful, and there are views across the river to the Taj Mahal

title: Don't miss this little beauty
review: Well worth seeking out on the south bank of the Yamuna is this tribute to the mortal remains of Mizra Ghiyas Beg.  He was Mumtaj's Mahal's grandfather and wazir to Akbar's son Jehangir his son in law by the marriage to his daughter Nur Jahan.

title: A rival to the taj
review: Extremely romantic Persian architecture. A must when in dirty Agra! No crowds, no touts, no hastle! A welcome break between the taj and the fort.

title: Beautiful but small
review: Certainly worth seeing on a trip to Agra. Very pretty tomb, called the "Baby Taj." Need a taxi to get there. Views over the river. Beautiful but small.

title: Not to miss
review: Going to Agra means going to visit the Taj Mahal! However, the so-called "baby Taj" is a splendid building and architecture

title: The "Baby Taj"
review: Another tomb, but smaller and supposedly the inspiration for the Taj Mahal.   Beautiful at sunset and not nearly as many tourists.

title: See this "Baby Taj" prior to the "Real Taj"
review: We saw the "Real Taj" at sunset and then the "Baby Taj" the next morning but should have seen this as the "warm up" act. It was interesting to see this as the precedent to the Real Taj which is much grandeur in size and designed detail.

title: Comparison
review: It was interesting to see this and compare the architecture and design to the Taj Mahal. The designs on the walls were beautiful.

title: nice peaceful monument
review: Beautiful and peaceful monument to visit.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: Its a mausoleum that is located on the right bank of the River Yamuna and is a tomb of Mirza Ghiyas Beg, a minister and the father of Nur Jahan, the wife of Jahangir. Beautiful architecture and a must visit when you are in Agra.

title: CULTURE COMES TO LIFE!
review: This is another area in agra which is great to visit and if its your first time here its worth visiting.

title: Beautiful but too touristic
review: The interior of the tomb was very beautiful and I really enjoyed it. Unfortunately there were too many people who tried to get money from tourists there.

title: Not bad but not as good as Taj Mahal
review: They call it the Baby Taj because of the similarity it bears with the Taj Mahal. Unfortunately this place is not as well protected and inside, some paintings in the wall are already chipped off or gone, but the architecture is still beautiful and designs inside are intricate and lovely

title: Less known, quite spectacular
review: We were in Agra to see the famed Taj Mahal, and a friend had recommended this site, which she referred to as the "Baby Taj".  It was well worth the visit--very serenely set, and elegantly situated.  It has gorgeous inlaid stone detailing and flower motifs throughout.  It is peacefully set along the river.  We were lucky to visit when few people were there--early morning, weekday--which made a difference in being able to enjoy the lovely site without much distraction.

title: Back in Time!
review: The air around the tomb is very different. It takes you back in time. One must be there in person to feel that feeling..."back in time". This is a place, one must visit when they are in Agra.

title: Baby Taj - a tranquil spot across from the Agra Fort
review: Completed in 1628, this pristine white marble mausoleum has all the trappings associated with its big sister monument, carvings, translucency and symmetry. Worth visiting together with the Red Fort and before the Taj Mahal itself.

title: Agra
review: One more symbol of the Moghul rule in India, Its a tomb. Its a place must to be seen for its art and architure.

title: Amazing in its own right
review: This monument has been commonly referred to as the baby taj as it was the inspiration for the taj. However this name does not do this site justice. The intricate detail of the tomb and entrance gates are breathtaking. What makes this sight so pleasant is that it free from the bus loads of tourists unlike the taj.

title: Must Visit In Agra
review: This is a very beautiful building sitting on the bank of Yamuna river. Look like Taj Mahal and very peaceful. Garden is beautiful.

title: Not so fascinating
review: after visiting the taj nothing looks more fascinating. u can visit if time permits or else u can skip it

title: Beautiful Baby Taj!!!
review: It's true. It does look like a smaller version of the Taj Mahal. If you have visited both Taj Mahal and Agra Fort with ample time to spare, here's a good reason to spend an hour of your time.Itmad-ud-Daulah's tomb is an important place of historical importance in Agra Region. This tomb was built on the orders of Muslim Emperor Jahangir's wife Noorjahan for his father Mirza Ghiyas. The walls are made up of White Marble and embedded with semi precious stones. This place is less crowded then Taj Mahal and it is good idea to spend time here.This is one of very cute and small place in Agra . You would be finding some rich art work there . Was built before then Taj Mahal an inspiring place for Taj Mahal also . Must visit if you have even little bit interest in Art work & history . To enjoy it more please stop comparing it with Taj.This is a wonderful masterpiece that you should not miss. I feel sometimes its better than Taj owning to facts that its still beautiful, less crowded and more neatly maintained.

title: Deserted but Good place to visit
review: Not much to look at, but overall a nice place to spend some time relaxing. Not much people visit this place. No guides available, not much information is available except one at entry. Worth visiting once.

title: Magnificent Mughal monument across Yamuna river from Taj Mahal
review: This is a major monument of Mughal architecture that pre-dates the Taj Mahal, worthy of a slow visit. Like the Taj Mahal, it is set within an enclosed garden that is laid out with walkways and water channels. The building itself is centrally located within the garden (unlike the Taj Mahal), and exhibits extensive use of white marble slabs inlaid with colored marbles to form numerous geometric patterns; carved and pierced marble screens are set within recessed niches. Many interior surfaces of walls and vaults are painted in styles reminiscent of Safavid Iran. Born in Iran, Itimad al-Dawla was a key advisor to Emperor Jahangir, and father of Empress Nur Jahan, who was directly involved in design and overseeing construction of her father's tomb. Other family members are also buried/commemorated here.

title: Lovely, don't miss it.
review: I thought this was better than the Taj Mahal. Yes, the decoration was not as detailed but it was more extensive. There were less people here and I really enjoyed the tranquility. The grounds were very peaceful.

title: Worth to call it Baby Taj.
review: It seems this monument is inspiration to Taj Mahal. It is built before the construction of Taj and its an architectural master piece. The art work on its walls are one of its kind.

title: Loved it - better than the Taj!!!
review: Amazing detail, and wasn't very busy at all!!! We spent around 1 hour here, just taking in all the detail and the grounds.

title: a must visit
review: One of the must visit of agra...but do it before taj. Because after doing taj, it wont serve you anything extra. Beautiful architecture and quite than taj. Generally people visits here after taj and agra fort, if time permits. But this place also holds a great place in indian history.

title: Miniature Taj Mahal
review: The tomb of Itminad-ud-Daulah is almost an exact verson of the Taj Mahal, in miniature... its lies in the shadows of the Taj Mahal across the river... this place almost gets missed by tourists...so is not very crowded.

title: Beautiful Baby Taj
review: I actually liked this monument more than the Taj Mahal. The structure is smaller but so much more detailed and just physically beautiful. The grounds are also comparatively more peaceful and not as crowded.

title: A must-see spot!
review: While I have been to Agra before, this time I specifically wanted to visit Itimad-ud-daula's tomb. A good decision since I loved it. The tomb seems small and compact from a distance and also unusually dome-less. But as I climb up the platform of the tomb, I am dazzled by the intricate inlay work. This tomb is believed to be the first monument in marble built by Mughal India and is also supposed to be the inspiration for the Taj. It is also supposed to have formed the template for extensive use of inlay work with precious stones.  The façade work is well-maintained  and bright. I would strongly recommend a visit to this tomb.

title: The Mini Taj
review: The tomb of Itminad-ud-Daulah is like replica of the Taj Mahal Also it is in the shadows of the Taj Mahal across the river.

title: The little Taj!
review: One should visit here before visiting the Taj. It is called the little version of the Taj. One thing, I liked here most was that, there was hardly any people visiting the place. So, you have all the time in your hand to enjoy it. It's beautiful!

title: Beautiful baby taj!
review: We loved this attraction - a lot less visitors as it is obviously overlooked by the taj, but it is so beautiful. It is a must visit!

title: Bright and intricate
review: Not far from the taj but even more intricate suggested that this was a trial run for the taj. Worth a visit in agra

title: the so called baby Taj
review: Located on the opposite side of Yamuna. This tomb of the Grand mother of Mumtaj is worth seeing for its location. The place has a bit of resemblance to the Grandeur The Taj Mahal but very little in common.

title: Only Monument to have Yellow Marble Iranian Flooring
review: This monument was built by Mughal Queen Norjahan in memory of her parents, who was also King Jahagir wife. It has rare black and yellow marble architectural flooring brought in those days from Iran. It also has wine serving glasses carved on its walls as King Jahagir was lover of wines and spirits. A little out of main TajMahal area on the other side of river Yamuna but is must visit. It has well kept lawns. Great rare monument.

title: Don't miss this Mini Taj
review: This is an often overlooked Mini Taj. However with a fraction of the people, and a wonderful setting I would highly recommend it when in Agra.

title: Great little historical monument
review: Amazing place... Exceptional workmanship ..... They say Shah Jahan era was a golden era in Indian architecture, and this monument is a living example of that  ....

title: Gives you a close up look at architecture that you can't always see at Taj due to crowds
review: We visited this after the Taj Mahal with our tour guide. The Taj Mahal is really busy so you only get a short time actually in it. The baby Taj is a lot quieter so you have more time to look closely at the marble inlays and amazing architecture even though the actual workmanship isn't quite as skilled. It wouldn't have been as interesting without our tour guide explaining the history behind it, so if you don't have one it is worth reading about it in advance.

title: Great work to see that was done before the Taj Mahal
review: I kept being told I need to see the Mini Taj. On my return trip I took a Tuk Tuk ride to see and was very impressed.  As others have said the detail work is not as finished as theTaj Mahal but the opportunity to see not only stonework, but paintings still intact and to be able to walk around the whole building without limitations is something you cannot do at the Taj Mahal.  There seemed to be mostly locals who know how great this is to see.  Do not forget to go to the building overlooking the river to see the great view.  Enjoy!

title: Small but quite impressive
review: Nice warm up before a visit to the Taj Mahal. If you get here at the golden hour, you will get some amazing pictures from the property. Not as crowded as many of the other monuments, so it was quite a delightful experience.

title: More emotional than the Taj Mahal
review: Built before the Taj Mahal, it is more intimate in a superlative beauty of persian decoration art. A Must.

title: Marble Tomb
review: Made of only white marble and amazing piece of art in one small section of the fort to click great pictures.

title: A tomb poorly maintained but not to be missed
review: For people who keep visiting Agra, India to see Taj Mahal and Agra Fort, should surely add Itimad-ud-Daulah to their itinerary. Unlike the Taj, this is older and much more lively.

title: Surprising beauty
review: I am so thankful my guide brought me here!! What an exceptional monument, covered in inlaid semi-precious stones.  And the history of the monument is fascinating .... being built for  a Lord Treasurer for a Mughal.  Best of all, it is definitely far less crowded than the Taj Mahal, which made it even more enjoyable to stroll around.  Definitely make time to see it.

title: A smaller and more intricate version of the Taj Mahal
review: Whatever you do, do not miss the tomb. It predates the Taj and the inlay work is exquisite. Whereas the Taj can be intimidating and cold, the tomb is colourful and intimate.

title: Worth visiting - if you have the time
review: The tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah (commonly known as the Baby Taj, even though it was completed four years before construction of the Taj commenced) is located on the other side of the river to the Taj. This smaller less ornate white marble tomb is the mausoleum of Shah Jahan's father, Emperor Jahangir's wife, Queen Nurjahan's parents. There is a entry fee to visit the site but because it is lesser known than the Taj there is hardly any other visitors, which makes it more serene and peaceful than the Taj. You can easily see that Shah Jahan picked all the best elements from this structure to incorporate into his masterpiece. If you have the time then this is definitely worth visiting

title: The mini Taj
review: Go here after doing to see the "Taj" because it, to me, is more poignant so it's bigger sister may disappoint.The scale is intimate and the ability to get up close to the the sensitive inlay is excellent. It is so close to the river with cows walking the banks, lads playing cards and women drying colourful washing.

title: One time visit
review: A place worth visiting as Emperor Shahjahan was apparently inspired by the same. The place does seem slightly neglected though and travelling to and fro to the place is a chore.

title: Baby Taj
review: Popularly known as Baby Taj by the locals. Shahjahan was inspired by baby Taj to build Taj mahal in the memory of his wife.Well maintained.

title: Exquisite
review: This tomb is nicknamed the Baby a Taj and is rather impressive in its own right.

title: Cute, Peaceful Baby Taj
review: This is out of Agra city Hustle Bustle. Don't see much of crowd. Small Architecture made in White Marble and decorated with Colorful Stones, Filigree work is beautiful in Marble. Gates are also impressive. Middle Building has four gates around. Must Go.

title: Beautiful building
review: Beautiful, detailed building. Well worth a visit. Very quiet and only a few people around when I visited.

title: Mini Taj
review: This is like a mini-taj, so beautiful and peaceful place.

title: Not just a precursor to the Taj Mahal
review: This is nicknamed the Little Taj, and it was a precursor to the Taj Mahal by a generation. Shah Jahan was certainly influenced by it when he built the Taj. It was built supposedly under the rule of a man, but actually under the complete governance of his wife as a mausoleum for her father and, later on, her mother and other relatives. There is a distinct feminine cast to this edifice, although a subtle one. It is just that much more realistically floral with painted walls and ceilings still showing after all these years. One nice things is that there are far fewer visitors here than at the Taj. It has beautiful grounds and lovely views.

title: Impressive
review: One of the many jewels in India. Once you visit India and are somewhere close to it, please don't miss the Baby Taj. So many stories to tell - the pictures on the walls, the architecture, it has very uniqe energies for the ones sensing them. Please let the guide tell you the story of the building - you will adore it!

title: A small but beautiful location
review: This is worth seeing as in someways though the exterior is small the interior has some beautiful carving and details. The carving is really excellent. The only let down id that the baby Taj is in rather drab grounds.

title: Baby Taj stands tall
review: The monument is being restored by the government currently. Its a prototype that preceded the Taj Mahal. The monument is built of red sandstone and marble with unique pietra dura inlay. The gardens are well maintained. Definitely worth a visit when in Agra as it is one of the few places that isn't overcrowded.

title: Beautiful tomb but bad experience!
review: We visited in Nov-2015. We were excited to visit it after hearing much about "Baby Taj" (as it is locally called) from locals. However we were appalled by lack of parking space outside the tomb and heavy traffic jam on the access road. Tomb itself is beautiful but not at all comparable to the scale and beauty of Taj Mahal. Extensive garden preparation and maintenance work was going on and typical Mughal style garden greenery was missing.
