There is intricate art work on tomb walls in stone and Yamuna river in the backside of the tomb can be seen. Overall it is an average place- do visit if you have ample time to spend in Agra.

title: Beautiful Excellent Architecture
review: beautiful excellent architecture, with full of inlay, carving  , stone work and great piece of building in a small area with surrounding gardens ..

title: You will receive a real pleasure looking at the magnificent carving and inlay of this wonderful tomb
review: This small, magnificent tomb called "the marble casket with jewelry." It was built in the 17th century to the treasurer of the emperor, by his daughter Nur Jahan, the wife of Emperor Jahangir's favorite. The style of this construction is a kind of transition from style to style the Emperor Akbar the time of Shah Jahan. You will receive a real pleasure looking at the magnificent carving and inlay of this wonderful tomb

title: Tomb of Itimad-Ud-Daulah @ Agra
review: The Tomb of Itimad-Ud-Daulah or commonly known as "Baby Taj" is the tomb of Mirza Ghiyas Beg, the father of Nur Jahan, the wife of Jahangir. This structure is a great example of Mughal architecture built with red sandstone and marble.

title: Make sure to see the baby Taj while in Agra!
review: Our guide took us to this tomb after visiting the fort and it was a great surprise! There were few tourist here but this site is certainly worth the visit. The baby taj is less ostentatious then the Taj Mahal but had a lot of gorgeous details in the architecture and design.

title: Better known as The Baby Taj
review: Our guide, Islam from Agra took us here and what a treat it was. Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah (known by locals as The Baby Taj) was built approximately 100 years before the Taj Mahal and the King who build the Taj got his idea for the monument by first seeing The Baby Taj. The King took the minarets off the building to enhance the grandness of scale, and your notice The Baby Taj has the minarets attached. Both buildings look exactly the same from all sides and from every view.  They are both exquisite. The Baby Taj has carving and ornamentation that will blow your mind. It was such a treat and not to be missed. We had it all to ourselves.

title: Very nice - do not miss it!
review: Visiting Taj Mahal is mandatory, but try not to miss the Baby Taj as well. This place is not as popular but is definitely worth the visit.

title: Tomb
review: No need to specifically go. If you time its okay. Will take about 30 minutes to see the place. Dont worry if you do not visit this place.

title: Does not get as many footfalls as it rightly deserves.
review: It is not to be missed while on a trip to Agra.

title: Baby Taj - a good intro
review: Impressive small mausoleum in Agra is a good intro before visiting the main event itself. Its quiet and you get to see all in close up. good setting by the river and very similar marble work. Its a comfortable visit and well worth it.

title: Really loved the marble and design
review: Reason I gave excellent is it's only a single structure with tombs inside, but the marble outside looks so fresh (comparison with Taj Mahal) and the design is also amazingly beautiful. I would surely recommend this , it wont take much time. plus you get to see the bridge and Taj Mahal from behind (far view althughj)

title: Baby Taj
review: This is ten year older building than Tajmahal. This is the tomb of Queen Mumtaj mahal's grandfather.

title: Baby Taj.
review: Visited here after Agra Fort.....It was much quieter than the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort.

title: Lovely, lovely place to visit
review: I do wish people would not call this 'the Baby Taj!' Its other nickname 'the Jewel Box' is much more accurate.

title: Better than the Taj
review: This was but before the Taj and is charming and far less visited. I think its prettier and far more interesting

title: A worthy rival to the Taj Mahal
review: The beauty of this tomb comes close to that of the Taj Mahal. It is small and exquisitely carved in marble and decorated with semi-precious stone inlay. Inside the tomb are glorious botanical paintings that are hard to see until revealed by camera flash or torch.

title: Not even comparable to the Taj
review: This baby taj is not even close to the beauty of the Taj Mahal! Its cheap to go but to say its better than the Taj is ridiculous! Its an average stop if you have the time

title: Wow really worth a visit!
review: The 'little taj' was a very pleasant surprise - perfectly formed but small and less busy than the main attraction in Agra - we really enjoyed this visit, don't miss it

title: very good historical place
review: it is very good historical place built by mughal emperor sahajahan.this place is very nice i go there in the month of july so i sit there in the grass and fell relax.

title: Little Taj, big reward.
review: This small tomb complex can be picked up on the way to Taj Mahal from Delhi and is worth an hours stop. It has not got the Dome of its big brother but the marble work and paintings are beautiful and benefit from a much smaller scale. The inlaid stonework is very impressive.

title: cute litle site
review: not a lot of time needed here but extremely worth while. they call it the Baby Taj. Great workmanship.

title: Review
review: The tumb is extraordinary and it makes you wonder what resources and effort was spent on building a tumb hundreds of years ago at a size of a mall when the people in the street doesn't have food to eat.

title: Small Taj
review: This is a very good monument and less crowded.  This small taj is very attractive with a beautiful garden.

title: Not to be missed
review: You must visit this tomb even if you have done Taj :) people often call it Baby Taj but there are some really interesting surprises

title: Baby Taj
review: Smaller and less crowded then Taj, but this is the monument from which Shah Jahan got inspiration to build Taj Mahal.

title: Magnificent Architecture
review: In contrast to the Taj Mahal, this beautiful building benefits from fewer visitors, thus one achieves a much more rewarding experience. In the tranquil surrounding it is possible to get a real feel of serenity and fully appreciate the magnificent architecture of this historic masterpiece.

title: avoid the holidays
review: We went to agra the weekend after Diwali and the traffic was gridlock and we were unable to get to the tomb.  Festivals are great for the experience but this site is worth seeing so don't go during festive times when you might not be able to get there.

title: Worthy Visit.
review: It is less popular and won't be as great as taj, this was my feeling, but after the visit, i really feel that it's a wonderfully constructed and beautiful structure.

title: Delhi Agra 2015
review: Itmad ud Daulah is a must visit on an Agra trip. It detail and intricacy of work on stone is breathtaking..In my opinion better  than the Taj itself.

title: Amazing Place
review: This tomb was actually an inspiration for Shahjahan to construct Taj Mahal. Precious and semi-precious stone inlay work at this tomb really beat inlay work at the Taj. Tourtists generally give it a skip. I must say if I have choose between Agra Fort and this tomb, I will always opt of the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Saulah.

title: Not to be missed
review: Often visitors to the Taj will skip this monument. Don't as it is one of the finest examples of mogul architecture and the carvings are very detailed. It is a great place to take pictures.

title: The Taj prototype
review: Known as the Baby Taj this was built before the Taj Mahal and built purely of Marble. Gardens are being restored but the building gives both an idea of the opulence of the Maharajahs and the wickedness of the looters. Quieter than the Taj this allows more time and space to view the artistry involved.

title: Nice and tranquil
review: It is a nice and tranquil place on the other side of Yamuna river. No way it is comparable with other attractions of Agra, but the early edifice of Mughal architecture is worth visiting. Not very touristy.

title: Another great thing to visit
review: The tomb is a great place to visit; few crowds and amazing artwork and views to the river. It was well worth going

title: I'm surprised more people don't visit
review: It is a 100% must see in Agra along with the Taj Mahal, I'm very surprised that more people do not visit. It is comparatively smaller than the Taj, but the work is much more detailed and it boasts of more colour and marble work. If you have a day in Agra it's definitely worth going to.

title: Beautiful and not crowded
review: India should make more of this tomb. It has all the beauty of the Taj but on a much smaller, and less crowded scale

title: Nice additon to our tour
review: A minor attraction, this "mini Taj Mahal."  Undergoing restoration of the gardens now.

title: Worth a visit
review: It is amazing to see how much time and effort goes in to building and decorating their tombs. Worth a look

title: Baby Taj
review: This monument is worth seeing and not a lot of visitors go here at one time. This was my third visit and it is well worth seeing you have to cross over the Yamuna river to get here, over the new bridge. You can view the tombs close up and the art in the marble work is worth seeing. Don't forget to use your ticket from the Taj Mahal for entry to this place.

title: The 'Baby Taj' !
review: It's certainly on a smaller scale than the 'big Taj', but has more intricate carvings and inlays.  We visited just before sunset and would recommend this to avoid tour groups and to get the best light for your photos.  A cursory visit would take about 10 minutes, and the most detailed ones would take about an hour.

title: Just wonderfull!!
review: In Agra is known as the baby taj mahal,  it is very beautiful,  not too many tourist. Increíble art in the walls and floors.  Must visit if you come to Agra

title: not worthy to visit
review: waste of time and money. the development was going on at the time of our visit and dust was in the air.

title: There's more with this baby...
review: This maybe small complex but it has more to offer. The designs are more intricate, this is worth seeing. The complex is being restored. There's not much tourist so i was able to see closely the details of the walls... I bought ticket to this complex because my guide in Taj collected the ticket so I have nothing to show at the gate.

title: Intricate designs
review: An interesttng visit, the tomb had a beautifully intricate design - it was easy to believe that it provided some inspiration to the building of the Taj Mahal.

title: Well worth a visit
review: This interesting site was unexpectedly added to our itinerary by our guide when he realised our interest in Mughal art and architecture. We enjoyed our visit to the mini Taj Mahal as it is simply beautiful. The art is stunning and whilst the grounds in which it sits aren't anything to write home about, the building makes up for it.

title: Agra Trip
review: I really liked my trip to Agra and love to travel India again. Taj Mahal was highlight of my trip and this Itimad Ud Daulah tomb was very nice to vist. Its really look like jewel box.

title: Sunset best
review: We visited this tomb near sunset so had a fantastic view of the river, then city from the site. The architecture was stunning and the marble 'carvings' so intricate. The two tombs inside were clean and beautifully preserved, the ceilings were decorated as were the 'ante-rooms'. I took some of my best trip photos from here.

title: Beautiful and not too busy
review: Unexpected quick little stop when we visited "baby Taj" - inspiration for Taj Mahal. Was very quiet, only a few groups there at the same time as us and protected from the road noises. Beautiful detail to be seen. Gardens were being redone so bare soil but you can imagine it being gorgeous.

title: The baby Taj
review: Aptly named the Baby Taj, this tomb is well worth a visit to splendour at the beauifully intricate detail of the building and decoration. It would be a shame to miss it if you have travelled to Agra.

title: Beautiful inlays
review: Another mausoleum but with some gorgeous inlays. Very small and you only need to stay half hour. All original stuff.

title: Beautifully compact
review: Also colloquially called 'the baby taj' is a beautiful monument in itself, exquisite carvings albeit with significant water damage inside after a freak high water event

title: A gem
review: We'd not heard of this before our trip so it was a surprise. We visited at sunset when the light was beautiful and, being so late in the day, there were virtually no other visitors there.  It precedes the Taj Mahal (it is known as the Baby Taj) and is also perfectly symmetrical, made of white marble and features marble inlay work.

title: Beautiful
review: Known as the Baby Taj. Beautiful marble architecture. There are many interesting rooms and view points from this tomb.

title: Small copy of Taj
review: Good for one hour visit ..beautiful Islamic architecture with amazing details inside .

title: Loved it!
review: This was by way of a surprise and very few people. We found it quite romantic and the fact that money is being spent , using local labour , to resurrect the gardens, encouraging.

title: Known as the Baby Taj
review: What a beautiful building and full of enchantment... Worth the visit in AgraI I have always enjoyed my time seeing the handiwork in the stone....

title: Sublime at sunset
review: We visited the site just before the sun set, and the soft, golden light brought out the colours and textures of the inlaid decoration beautifully. The Baby Taj is every bit as attractive as the bigger version, just on a smaller scale and more tranquil due to smaller numbers of visitors. The gardens were undergoing extensive work when we were there, so consisted mainly of deep holes and piles of soil, but you could still understand their symmetry and see the water courses. The (non-functional) gateway facing onto the river provided some interesting photo opportunities. The inside of the tomb was a bit the worse for wear (including some damage by a subsequent invader of the city), but the damage has been stabilized without attempting modern restoration, which makes the largely intact inlays all the more impressive. Don't leave it too late in the day if you want to photograph the insides.

title: Little known, but beautiful--don't miss if you have time
review: We had a rather short, but meaningful visit to this little gem. I loved the marble inlays and architectural details. Our guide was great at explaining the history, but it was hot, we had gotten up at the crack of dawn to see the Taj and it was in one ear and out the other. Now that I'm home, I'm going to read up. I would definitely recommend visiting if you have time. The "baby Taj" as our guide referred to it, is yet another example of exquisite craftsmanship and preserved history. The views of the river and the water buffalo were interesting, too. Made me want mozzarella di bufala! :)

title: Must visit
review: The monument is a beauty, not visited by many tourists .Cannot be compare to Taj Mahal but has a very tranquil feel .. best time I think is before sunset.

title: Its a Surprise
review: We went here on a lark since we had a bit more time than we thought we would and decided to check this place out.  Very beautiful little spot and also surprisingly quiet since it was so close to such busy street.  Once we got through the gate the traffic noise instantly stopped.  Very tranquil and refreshing to walk around and see the beautiful architecture and not have the noise and crowds of the Taj Mahal.

title: GREAT HISTORY
review: The structure of this tomb is amazing. I found a guy who told me all the related history and it was so good

title: Dedicated to her father by Queen "Noor Jahan"
review: Not many people visit this place for two reasons. One, who visit Agra for a Day will not have time to visit this place and secondly most people do not know about this place as its not included in their itineraries. However its a beautiful place and if you are in Agra for 2 days, you can definitely make it. The Tomb was dedicated by "Noor Jahan", wife of Moghul Emperor Jehangir, to her Father "Mirza Ghisas Beg", who was a Minister (Wazir) in Emperor's Court. Made of White Marble in the middle of a large walled area on banks of Yamuna River, its a beautiful piece of architecture. Its said that Noor Jahan made a similar Tomb for her husband Emperor Jehangir near Lahore, which is now in Pakistan. Even the entrance to Tomb is very nicely built and the entire place is well maintained. I had visited in July 2012 along with an American Friend.

title: good tomb but need to mantain
review: nice place for love birds and family

title: Splendid Architecture
review: No doubt that tourists from across the globe come to Agra, to see the famous Taj Mahal, built by Emperor Shah Jahan in remembrance of his beloved wife Mumtaz Mahal. However besides Taj, there are various others architectural marvels present in the city,capable enough to hold one's breath; Itimad-ud-Daulah is one of them. Located in the heart of city, across the banks of river Yamuna, it's a splendid monument. The calmness and serene atmosphere of the tomb is one of its highlights along with its marvelous design and architecture.  For a person visiting Agra, even just for a day, it should also be a part of the itinerary.

title: A real gem
review: If you are in Agra be sure to try and visit this site. It is a true jewel. It will cost you about 600 rupee return by tuc tuc from the Taj Mahal. The real joy of this site is the lack of people unlike the Taj Mahal. I have visited on three occasions and shared the site with little more than 50 people. Small is beautiful.

title: Baby Taj!
review: Our guide referred to this as the "Baby Taj" and we thought it stunning! A wonderful building which you should definitely take time out to see. There are no crowds, in fact, we were almost alone on our visit. Supposedly the inspiration for the Taj Mahal, it is an impressive and beautiful structure. Visit before you see the Taj Mahal and get a guide!

title: Impressive baby Taj
review: This is known as little taj. It is beautiful building with extensive marble inlay work. It is less crowded.If you plan to visit itimad-ud-Daulah, visit before Taj because it is predecessor of Taj. You understand Taj better if you have seen this. Our guide Rsahid told us as taj shows dedication of husband for wife, this building shows dedication of daughter for her parents. It is impressive.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is called Baby Taj. Constructed 20 years before Taj, the painting on the walls is excellent. It is not less beautiful than Taj, though smaller in size. Itimad-ud-Daulah was treasurer of the Mughals. A board of ASI says this monument along with Tomb of Akbar at Sikandara and Taj shows the development of Mughal architecture.

title: Dating spot for Indian youngsters
review: It is very beautiful, it even rivals the Taj in beauty and since there are not as many people it is even more enjoyable than the larger copy.

title: Marble splendour
review: Built by the grandmother of the emperor Shah Jahan (of Taj Mahal fame) this was the first building in India to be entirely constructed from marble, and is supposed to have been the inspiration for the design of the Taj Mahal. It shows a fusion of Persian and Islamic influences, and there are still remnants of the beautiful 23 carat gold paintings and frescoes which once decorated the interior.

title: Little know Gem of Agra
review: Itmad-ud-Daula is known as Baby Taj- for its smaller size though its campus is also quite spread out. When in Agra, you must visit this little gem for its remarkable inlay work - that is far more intricate than the one at Taj - though not as fine though. The Frescos are well preserved / restored and photography is allowed.

title: Not Crowded. Worth a Stop
review: It wasn't busy when we went, despite the actual Taj being so crazy busy I thought for sure other sights in Agra would be as well, but this place was nice and calm. The architecture is something to behold. you have to take your shoes off and leave them when you go up into the main building, so just note that. We kinda got yelled at since we didn't get that memo at first. There aren't a whole lot of sights in Agra, so this is definitely a nice stop.

title: Nice
review: Very less tourists visit this place. Therefore it's a good place for photography .there is nice engraved work inside the tomb with lots of painted mughlai ceilings.don't miss this.

title: Surreal!
review: This is a beautiful gem in Agra. I insist that you visit this Tomb early in the morning when the fog is still lifting so it looks fresh and new. Even though much smaller than the Taj Mahal, the attention to detail is amazing. Take a tour guide so you can learn about the specifics.

title: Ok
review: Not much to see. Worth if you have extra time. Quick visit possible. Guide not essential. Som historical facts on site to ecplain.

title: This is called the petite Taj Mahal
review: This, too, was a complete surprise to me, having never heard of its existence. It is a beautifully designed building with marble and inlaid work.  This was built as a tribute to the parents of a majaraja's wife by the wife. It was not something that was usually done which adds to its uniqueness.

title: Magnificent
review: Whilst the Tag Mahal is rightly the "top dog" in town this place pushes it a close second and shouldn't be missed. The nickname "Baby Tag" says it all.

title: Overall good
review: This place is also one time visit. On the we visited this place there is a tomb inside under which it is said that itimad-ud-daulah was burried. good

title: If you like the Taj, this is a must
review: Just as stunning and far less crowded than the Taj Mahal. Obviously, it's on a smaller scale, but it's fascinating to see the place that inspired the construction of the Taj. Personally, I found the inlaid stone-work here to be even more impressive. I really appreciated being able to take all the time we wanted here and we had the place to ourselves.

title: Worth its time
review: Much less crowded than the Thaj Mahal, this place is nevertheless a magnificent 23-m wide mausoleum that cannot pass unnoticed. The visit is short : you can do it in 20-30 mins, since there is less queue and almost no walking distance. You thus have a much more intimate insight in the mughal architecture.

title: Don't miss this
review: Not on the tourist map but wow what a gem.

title: Must see site in Agra
review: If you thought Agra was only about the Taj Mahal think again.  This site is as beautiful and much less crowded and essential to see if one is to fully understand the inspiration for the Taj.

title: Worth Visiting
review: Known as the baby Taj, in some respects i liked this more than the Taj in that it was smaller and we could spend more time looking around and no crowds.  Nice views from the site as well.

title: Must visit if you appreciate art and architecture
review: The 'Baby taj' pseudonym for Itmad-ud-ulad doesn't go well with me. This tomb was built by Nur Jahan for her parents, it's built of marble and has great detailed inscriptions and varied colour stones engraved on white marble. On keen observation, one can find the detailed architecture of various flowers and geometrical shapes that the artisans have carved. It will definitely leave you spellbound about these beauty lovers and the mighty Mughals eye for architecture. Must see if you are an art lover and the place is quite calm unlike taj.

title: Make Sure To Include This
review: I had wanted to come here after reading Indu Sundaresan's trilogy of books concerning the woman who built this exquisite monument to her father.  It is like a jewel box!  With hardly any tourists there to disturb our experience, it was most memorable.  It doesn't take long to visit, but is most worthwhile.

title: Worth sometime...
review: This is the first ever structure in India that was built entirely using marble stone.   Empress Nur Jahan commissioned this tomb in the memory of her father. Her parents and some of her close relatives are buried in here. The similarities of this tomb with the Taj Mahal indicate that the Taj's architecture was greatly inspired by this tomb

title: spectacular!!!!
review: Probably one of the most beautiful jewels of India. A little treasure chest carved in inlay marble... Spectacular!!!

title: tomb of itiad ul daulah
review: musoleum of the mughal king itimad ud daulah.. aong the banks of the yamuna river in agra..designed in marble..beautiful.

title: The mini Taj
review: Another stop on our heritage tour, what was so impressive was that this was built before the Taj and its design by a persian architect was the inspiration for the Taj buily some years afterwards.

title: nice
review: It has a special place in the history as well as in architecture. This is precisely because Itmad-ud-Daula is the very first tomb in India that is entirely made out of marble. This is actually a Mausoleum that overlooks the river Yamuna and is a tomb of Mir Ghiyas Beg, a minister in the court of Shah Jahan. It is a pure white and elaborately carved tomb that conforms to the Islamic architecture. The Indo-Islamic architecture becomes prominent because of the fusion that this tomb displays. It is the first tomb to be built in white marble instead of red sandstone and marks the departure from the red sandstone buildings of Mughal architecture.

title: Please don't ignore this beautiful monument
review: If you are visiting Agra, you must visit this spectacular monument. Its close to Agra fort. Its less crowded and situated on the bank of Yamuna river. Its open from sunrise to sunset.

title: Worth popping in if you're passing
review: It's worth calling in to see this if you're nearby but it's not with a special trip in our opinion. That said our tuc-tuc driver was very keen on the site so we're happy to have gone and had a look around!

title: Miniature Taj Mahal !
review: The Tomb of Itmad Ud Daulah is a precursor to the historic Taj Mahal. Built by Empress NurJahan for her father, Ghiyas Ud Din Khan, it is a beautiful white marble structure with fine petre dura work. The graves of Itmad Ud Daulah, his wife, and NurJahans daughter, Ladlee Begum are inside the mausoleum .

title: visitrajasthan privat tour & Taxi - A Day tour
review: This is " Baby Taj Mahal " and it is back side on the river

title: More Agra
review: Tombs are always cool places to visit, plus its in Agra. Very historical and mystifying. If you take a guided tour, you might get the most out of this visit.

title: avarage
review: if you are interested in history then only you will find this place interesting for me it was so and so visit

title: Beautiful Baby Taj
review: This monument is very beautiful in terms of craftsmanship. This is considered the first tomb in India made out of white marble. It is believed that Taj Mahal was inspired by this monnument only and so it is a baby or mini Taj. A must visit place.

title: Unforgettable expression of love & memory by a daughter Queen Nurjahan
review: This exquisite marble tomb was got constructed by emperor jahangir's queen, Nurjahan ,for her parents Mirza ghiyas beg and mother during 1622-1628 A.D.The craftsmanship at itmad ud daulah foreshadows that of the Taj Mahal.It was here that " PIETRA DURA"the inlay work on marble -so characteristic of the Taj - was first used .Narrow road to lead to this tomb so visit during non traffic timings.If u have time then u must visit.

title: Baby Taj Mahal
review: Who ever visit Agra I strongly recommend to visit the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah. No crowds! but very good place to see. right on yamuna river....

title: Tomb Itimad-ud-Daulah known as Baby of Taj
review: this tomb is beautiful and awesome, but our administration is poor which destroying Mughal empire history and i luv too much this historical building

title: Mini Taj for Parents
review: Opposite side of Taj you can find this monument as a gift from a daughter to s parents .it is also know as Baby Taj also , you can see it for it beautiful tomb in the middle and for the love of a daughter for her parents . A very beautiful river side also where you can sit and relax a bit .

title: Skip If you have busy Schedule
review: Though, you may find a lot to apreciate if you are an art lover. But , if you are tight in schedule, you can skip this monument.

title: Baby Taj
review: Across the river from the famous Taj Mahal, this quite different mausoleum contains tombs that are marble yet designed to look like wooden coffins. Really interesting and set in a beautiful building in lovely grounds. Well worth seeing. Just remember to carry some small cash in order to buy your shoes back at the end of the tour. Otherwise, the entrance is free.

title: Beautiful hand craft works inside
review: We visited this place after Taj Mahal and It was surprisingly beautiful as well! and the intricate hand works for paintings was exquisite. definitely worth a visit!

title: A wee beauty
review: If Agra was not dominated by the Taj Mahal, the mini Taj could be Agra's biggest draw card. A beautiful monument, well worth a visit.

title: Beautiful Tomb
review: Amazing architecture with marble and inlay work.  The site is poorly kept.  This apparently was the inspiration to Taj and hence "Baby Taj" and does live up to the name.

title: Tranquility in a sea of people
review: Like so much of India, the city of Agra is teeming with humankind. This tomb offers tranquility in all this activity and is a stunning piece of architecture though perhaps less well appreciated than its close neighbour, the Taj Mahal.

title: Giant Jewelry box
review: its a small monument located across the river yamuna, it looks like a giant Jewelry box, the carvings and intricate floral works are really beautiful

title: Baby Taj
review: I visited this place before going to Taj Mahal so as not to spoil this so called baby taj. they looked almost similar, architecture, designs and all but it was so small you'll left wanting for more. in which case, that is what the mother taj is for right? fill up what was missing on this place. :)

title: Preferable to the Taj Mahal
review: This is a must see when in Agra, much less high profile than the Taj Mahal but in my view much more beautiful. Perhaps it was the lack of fellow tourists - at one point we had the whole place to ourselves - or the more intricate designs and paintings on display. I just loved the 'baby taj', as it's known to locals, and feel very lucky to have visited as it isn't on the usual tourist trail - we asked our guide to take us somewhere different and we ended up here and the Mehtab Bagh, the gardens opposite Taj Mahal.

title: Small(ish) and beautiful
review: Located on the opposite side of the river to the Red Fort, this is sometimes referred to as the 'Baby taj'. It's a gem of architectural detail and was built before the Taj itself, being completed in 1628. It houses the mausoleum of Mirza Ghiyas Beg and his family. Beg was the father of Emperor Jehangir's wife, Nur jehan

title: Excellent
review: Very beautiful building. Its design will look similar to Taj Mahal and it is also a gem to watch. Worth a visit if u r in Agra................................

title: force you to have tourist guide
review: No information in Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah they force you to have tourist guide or you will not understand any thing

title: Baby Taj
review: This is a Mughal structure in Agra, India, in the state of Uttar Pradesh and is also nick named as Baby Taj. It is basically a tomb where many of Nur Jahan's (wife of Emperor Jahangir) family members are en-tombed including her father & mother. It is located on state highway 39, at Etmadpur, Agra.

title: Excellent Place
review: Its design will look similar to Taj Mahal, beautiful building and it is also a gem to watch. Worth a visit if u r in Agra. So once visit this place.

title: Baby Taj is worth visiting
review: This place is less known than the Taj Mahal and the Agra Fort, but it remains a nice Mausoleum whick nickname is "Baby Taj" because the architecture is similar. If you have enough time, go there !

title: Good for a quick visit
review: This monument is a small but beautiful tomb. Beautiful inlay work. Doesn't take too long to cover the entire tomb.

title: Deserves a visit!
review: The baby Taj Mahal deserves to be visited. Just a ten minutes ride from the main attraction in Agra.

title: Baby Taj
review: Baby Taj, this is what the people of Agra call this place, it truly mesmerize the traveler on the visit.

title: Very nice, we enjoyed this more than the Taj Mahal
review: We decided to visit this tomb just before we would go back to Delhi by the express highway and we didn't regret it for a moment.

title: Baby Taj
review: This a very intricately decorated tomb, known locally as the Little Taj. The jewelled Pietra Dura, or Parchin Kari work here is as impressive as that at the Taj Mahal. We visited just before sunset and found that we almost had the site to ourselves. It's only a short ride from here to Mehtab Bagh where you can watch the Taj Mahal change colour as the sun sets.

title: Amazing tile and mosaic work..nice place to sit back and relax after Taj Mahal
review: Less crowded than Taj Mahal...amazing tile and mosaic work.View of the river. Take your time here, and you'll be rewarded by peace and quiet.

title: Surpasses the Taj!
review: This little gem is the tomb of the grandparents of Mumtaz Mahal (for whom the Taj Mahal was buit), and it is an absolute masterpiece. While tiny compared to the more famous edifice, it is not visited by the crowds, going at the right time of the day one can have the whole place to oneself to marvel at the intricate details. It is a must-see in Agra, and possibly more rewarding than braving the crowds at the Taj.

title: Amazingly Done
review: A brilliant sculpture built by Jahangir in remembrance of Parents of Noorjahan.

title: Baby Taj, Damn Right
review: Tomb of the father of Nur Jahan, the wife of Jahangir and mother of shahjahan and it rightly called baby taj. Totally beatiful, the structure is. A must visit at agra. very near from mehtab bagh. Strongly suggest a  visit at afternoon and then see the sunset from Mehtab Bagh.

title: So Beautiful and unfortunately underrated
review: When in Agra you have to come to see this absolutely Beautiful gem.  It is said that this was the building that inspired the construction and style of the Wonderful Taj Mahal and once you visit both place you will agree.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is one of very cute and small place in Agra . You would be finding some rich art work there . Was built before then Taj Mahal an inspiring place for Taj Mahal also . Must visit if you have even little bit interest in Art work & history . To enjoyed more please stop comparing it with Taj Mahal .

title: Baby Taj - Second to None
review: When you enter the gate your jaw will drop in awe at the magnificence sprawel out before your eyes - beautifully laid out gardens with lawn and a structure that will make you gasp for air. In my view and opinion this structure though smaller in size supercedes the Taj Mahal in beauty. The four minarets and the facade are completely inlaid with most intricate flower designs. The inside is as beautiful as the outside. Fine lattice work marbled, arched windows and doors. i was particularly impressed with the four corner minarets. It should definitely have been rated as one of the marvels of the ancient world. Great stuff - please do not miss this one.

title: Small and Exquisite
review: This beautiful small mausoleum was a precursor for the Taj Mahal . Much less visited by tourists it really should be seen if you are in Agra. Should be included in the price of Taj Mahal admission but this was not honoured on my visit .

title: A place also called baby taj mahal
review: This is another small worth visiting place. It is small replica of Taj Mahal and very impressive sculptures around. Good place to visit with Family in mid of the city area.

title: Not sure why I've never heard of this place if the Taj is world-famous
review: The Taj is just this place made larger.  The guy totally stole his grandfather's idea and just made it bigger.  So ridiculous that the Taj Mahal is a world famous monument with millions of tourists but all it is is a bigger version of his grandpa's idea.  If you don't like crowds you might like this place better than the Taj Mahal.

title: Not Upto The Mark !!
review: The original tomb is situated below this rebuilt one , although both look exactly the same , the original one contains the burial of Shahjahan's wife Mumtaaz ! So Disappointing !!

title: A MUST VISIT FOR ALL VISITORS & TOURISTS
review: This was my last sightseeing booked tours I had arranged while staying in AGRA for 4 days from 24/05/15 to 28/05/15, my tours were booked at my accommodation THE GATEWAY HOTEL. I waited in reception for my 6am pick-up on Wednesday 27/05/15 with my driver and a different tour guide [the same tour guide I had during the last 2 days days wasn't available]. On arrival at TOMB OF ITIMAD-UD-DAULAH I paid Rs 220.00 admission fee [cash only], the grounds and old historical buildings looked very impressive especially with the sculptures and amazing stonework. A very large open area with well maintained gardens, I'm glad I arrived early to avoid the daytime scorching heat and spent around one hour at this TOMB. This was my very last full day in Agra and pleased I choose to visit this amazing landmark and left Agra on the 28/05/15 returning to New Delhi on the train with many happy memories during my sightseeing tours around AGRA.

title: Majestic Tomb
review: Also called the Baby Taj, this is a beautiful piece of architecture. It is actually studded with semi - precious stones and has fewer crowds as compared to the majestic Taj Mahal. Of course it is not as grand as the Taj itself but it is well worth a visit and a nice place.

title: A great place to start your tour of Agra
review: A great start to your Agra historical viewing. This is the link between the Mughal's sandstone and marble (Humayun to Shah Jahan) No need of a guide here although there are plenty of government approved guides available cheaply. Never any queues and usually pretty easily accessible. On the main road.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ual
review: In the summer of July of 2007, part of Golden Triangle package.  Nice architecture small but very pleasant.  Beware of the season that you are travelling in, certain months are muggy and steamy and can reach well above 40s celcius.

title: Baby Taj
review: It may be small but it is filled with amazing detailed stone work. Well worth a visit to look upon the beautiful tomb nicknamed the Baby Taj.

title: A Quick Side Trip
review: It's true. It does look like a smaller version of the Taj Mahal. If you have visited both Taj Mahal and Agra Fort with ample time to spare, here's a good reason to spend an hour of your time.

title: Mughal mausoleum
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is a Mughal mausoleum in the city of Agra Before going to Mehtap Bagh, just stop by & see this place.

title: Quiet and with better inlay than the Taj
review: This is not very much visited, so it is relatively quiet. The tomb is exquisite, with intricate inlaid and carved designs that surpass those of the Taj. It is not so massively impressive as the Taj, but is worth a visit, especially if you want to photograph the designs. The ticket-takers here seemed to want to take our tickets and not to return them to us, like they were going to reuse them. There was also an elderly gentleman who seemed to be a hanger around at the gate who magically appeared where we had been asked to deposit our shoes (he wasn't there when we left them) and he was demanding rupees for watching our shoes. The Indians seemed to chide him for this and they did not pay, so neither did I.

title: One of the many tombs we visited
review: Please note although I have put the date as April 2015 as Trip Advisor only goes back a couple of years. We actually visited in April 2008, so this is a retrospective review. On our tour of India we visited many tombs, this one was one of the earlier ones as we were in our second city. Interesting architecture, reflective of the period in which it was build

title: Master piece
review: a such monument which is really a master piece of art i recommended  this place for tourist before taj mahal here they can have an idea abut world famous monument of taj mahal

title: A truly beautiful place!
review: This was for me the best place, of all of the places I visited, in India. Included the Taj Mahal. It is not much visited, so we were almost alone there. It's a beautiful and calm. It's not as big and grand as the Taj Mahal, but that just add to its beauty. You also have nice views of the river, and you should use time to relax here. I had not read about it in advance, or heard about it, so that might have given me a special feeling about the place. So go there with an open mind and just experience it.

title: Mini Taj- beautiful
review: Wife of Aurangjeb (son of Shahjahan) has made this in the memory of her loving father.

title: Another great Agra Monument
review: Known as the Mini Taj, this is one of those monuments that although, certainly not as impressive as the Taj, is all the same very interesting.

title: just another wonder
review: A monument which is just same as taj Mahal in design and style, one of the popular tourist attractions in agra so if you come to Agra so don't miss it.

title: Tomb
review: It has a mini taj mahal and is a small place. The kind of work done on marbles is excellent. half an hour max and you are through this place

title: Hidden treasure of Agra
review: When it come to Agra or even India, Taj Mahar is what most people come to associate with but this is much superior in term of art (mostly inlay work) and built before Taj Mahar.

title: Loved this
review: A beautiful monument and gardens. Well preserved did not know this was built prior to the Taj Mahal. Stunning

title: Idmad-ud-daulah
review: Idmad-ud-daulah is basically a tomb, Emperor Akbar and his kin's tombs are here. The entire construction is huge and unique. The floral and ornamental stone carving is its main atraction.

title: Beautiful.. exceot yamuna in the backyard.
review: the architecture is really beautiful with a quiet environment except there is lot of littering and garbage in the yamuna adjoining the place.

title: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah -- Must Visit Before You Visit Taj Mahal
review: On the left of the Yamuna River there's a beautiful surprise, the Little Taj. Constructed between 1622 and 1628 by Empress Nurjahan in memory of her parents. The entrance gate is very imposing, this is very beautiful place but don't have lots of visitors. After the entrance gate you can see the square tomb with two floors designed with white marble. It was the first monument made with white marble in India. The ticket costs 50 INR.

title: Agra is not just The Taj - you need to do more things there and you can
review: The Baby Taj is calm beautiful fascinating but only a few metres from the amazing building you have problems with monkeys and if you try to get a picture from elevation within the boundaries of the tourist site you might find a real troop hissing at you so watch out.  Monkey warning over, still insist to your driver or hunt out by public transport this under publicised building only a couple of kilometers from the Taj herself and spend time there as it is fabulous.

title: Worth seeing while in Agra
review: If you have time and not in a rush do stop here, it is known as baby Taj because of the marble monuments similarity to the taj mahal. if you are pressed for time don't feel bad the architecture is similar to all other palaces or forts or monuments from the Mougal period.

title: Baby Taj Mahal well worth a visit
review: Across the river this small site is well worth a visit. It is the model on which the Taj Mahal was apparently based. It cost 100 rupees entry.

title: Adds an extra layer of history to the Taj
review: This masterpiece adds another dimension to your visit to Agra. The construction of the building is beautiful and it shows in the details of the building.

title: Worth making the effort to visit
review: As with the Taj Mahal, the "Baby Taj" also is made from marble and beautiful inlaid stonework. What it doesn't have, however, are thousands of visitors every day pushing and shoving - that, in itself, was a very pleasant surprise. The atmosphere is very relaxed and you can take as long as you wish to explore. The only thing which detracted from the beauty inside the building was the pigeon crap on every surface.

title: Another Mughal Piece of Architecture
review: India is known for Mughal architecture. One of the best pierces of architecture of the Mughhals is Itimad-ud- Daulah. This is regarded as the first and the best red stone architecture in the world. The place not just brings in memory the story of the Jahangiris, but also shows the intricacy in the olden architecture. This place is definitely a must to visit, while you are on a trip to Agra and Fatehpur Sikri.

title: awesome!!!!!!!!!!!
review: much better than the taj mahal, less crowd there, no security, same type of the building, i really love it there!!!!!

title: Beautiful Baby Taj
review: Okay, this is not as stunning as the Taj Mahal itself, nor does it have the love story. However, once we had convinced the wannabe "guide" that we did not want his services, nor would we part with any money this was a much more peaceful visit. The building is beautiful in its own right and having the relative tranquility to enjoy it really enhanced the experience.

title: Worth a visit
review: If you have the time then add "Baby Taj" to your itinerary. Fewer people and a nice change from the usual tourist haunts. Take a tuk-tuk for the fun of seeing the city and the drive this way.

title: Visit Once
review: Baby Taj only 5 mint. away from Agra Fort.  I don’t think it similar to Taj Mahal,   But very beautiful stone work in the marble. The exquisite marble carvings and the perfectly painted and decorated walls.  No crowd.  Good for photography.  You can see tomb peacefully if you have time.

title: Marvelous
review: This is an excellent monument of Mughal's time. It doesn't get the desired attention in Agra because of the mighty presence of Taj Mahal, but its a worth visiting monument. This was constructed during the rein of Jahangeer, by his witty and powerful wife Noor-e-Jahan. This monument shows excellent planning and excellent inlay work in while marble. This laid the foundation of excellent architecture work in while marble by Mughals, which culminated in the form of Taj later.

title: baby taj
review: small but good grounds and view of river. We saw the buffalo  being washed in the river. Inside the tomb there are some nice mosaics. When we visited they were fixing the roof. Watching men climbing up a bamboo scaffolding was just as good to watch  as the monument !

title: Baby Taj
review: Not much to see but still definitely worth a visit, nice building and the tombs inside are beautiful. Also has lovely grounds and some trees to sit under.

title: Easy to access monuments
review: There are many historic monuments worth seeing in Agra. Now it is easy to access there from New Delhi

title: The "Baby Taj"
review: The similarities between the "Baby Taj" as guides refer to it and the Taj Mahal are there - much smaller and less visited but just as beautiful ... do go there, it is worth a visit.

title: Well worth a visit
review: Visited in the cool of the evening - we were virtually the only people there - plenty of time to appreciate the architecture and we managed to take some lovely photos!

title: Should not miss
review: Most travelers dont take the effort to go to see this piece of work.

title: 45 minutes of quality time.
review: This place is rightly named as Baby Taj.This place draws less number of people but gives you a chance to see the Moghul Architecture pretty closely.Try to see this place before Taj, because once you have already seen Taj,you may not realize the value of this place,because Taj offers you more grandeur.However this tomb has great piece of Marble Work.In Agra,the last thing you should see is Taj.Because once you see Taj that occupies your mind.

title: 'Baby Taj'
review: This is the tomb of Mirza Ghiyath Beg, the grandfather of Mumtaz Mahal of Taj Mahal fame. It was built about 1625 AD by his daughter Nur Jehan, Emperor Jehangir's wife and its pietra dura marble inlaid walls are thought to have been the inspiration for Shah Jahan's later Taj Mahal. It's a very quiet and peaceful site compared to the crowds at its much bigger and more famous successor and is a really nice spot to spend an hour or so.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is a small version of the Taj. Day we visited we were only people there. Well worth visiting. Exquisite construction.

title: Beautiful Blueprint of Taj
review: While visiting Agra, Tomb of I'timd-ud-Daulah shouldn't be overlooked. Often described as a "jewel box" or the "Baby Taj", and is often regarded as a blueprint of the Taj Mahal. Located to the north of the Taj Mahal on the Yamuna River.

title: Similar with Taj Mahal
review: We chanced upon this place when we had last visited Agra. It looks similar to Taj Mahal and it hardly draws any crowd. You can roam around at peace and enjoy the mughal architecture... One should visit this place to marvel at this hidden gem.

title: Baby Taj
review: Must visit, it' on the way to Taj and can be covered within 15 mins. Truly stunning and great place to start the Agra tour.

title: BABY TAJ
review: Often described as a "jewel box", sometimes called the "Baby Tāj", the tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah is often regarded as a draft of the Tāj Mahal.

title: A WOMANS TOUCH
review: We had the feel as soon as we walked into the complex that this had the touch of a woman .

title: Beautiful
review: We went here before the Taj Mahal and this is beautiful.  Not as many people here, pretty much to ourselves.  Very quiet and peaceful.  Would recommend a visit.

title: Adorable! Worth the visit!
review: Exact replica of the Taj Mahal! So cute and less crowded which is a huge plus. Visit right after the Taj Mahal and you'll appreciate Baby Taj much more! Many beautiful picture opportunities and not too many sellers. Take the time to go see this site it won't take up too much of your time.

title: Also called the Baby Taj, must visit
review: Definitely make time to see this wonderful tomb. The marble inlaid with precious stones is magnificent as are the lattice screens carved from a solid piece of marble. The paint work on the inside is wonderful too. Shoes had to be removed to go inside.

title: Mini Taj
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is also an architectural marvel which is situated on the bank of Yamuna. This is also called as mini  Taj Mahal, because it has  many a similarity like -Minars, stone work called as  pietra dura and  lattice work.  Like the Taj Mahal its marble work is also delicate and intricate.

title: An old heritage.
review: Its a pity that the travellers immerse themselves in the beauty of Taj and the fort  but miss the others like this! Definitely a place which should not be missed on an Agra trip!

title: Beautiful
review: This is a wonderful masterpiece that you should not miss. I feel sometimes its better than Taj owning to facts that its still beautiful, less crowded and more neatly maintained.

title: Baby Taj
review: Very nice and peaceful. Remember, the people who work there are all trying to make and extra few rupees, even the security guy who checks your tickets then offers to take pictures with your camera. The guy who hires out the dirty shoe covers who doesn't have any change until you tell him you won't pay him, and then he miraculously has change!

title: Nice Monument
review: Nice small monument in Agra . Good architecture and beautiful inlay work. Can be covered in 15 - 30 mins

title: A great stop
review: It was a pleasant visit, we didn't even have it on our to see but our driver told us Go and visit Baby Taj..you would not be disappointed. He was indeed right. It was not crowded and one can take time to explore, appreciate the beautiful and intricate carvings, Islamic architecture of the mausoleum. A great view of the Yamuna river too. Rs110/adult totally worth it. Highly recommended.

title: Interesting site, quiet and peaceful
review: A very well preserved building, a lovely, slightly smaller, version of the Taj and obviously much, much quieter. Not somewhere to visit instead of the Taj but is definitely worth a look while in Agra. Nice views out over the river towards Agra.

title: feast to the eyes
review: the cleanliness and the work that is there is simply mesmerizing.one day visit is good. food i did not enjoy

title: Resting place of Emperors
review: Superb construction , well maintained by Government authorities,

title: Beautiful
review: In my opinion this tomb is almost as beautiful as the Taj Mahal.  It is also known as the "Baby Taj".  Somewhat surprisingly this is not on the standard tourist trail so when we visited mid afternoon we were the only tourists there and overall visitors numbers were very small.  So we had the opportunity to really take some time to explore the site and the Tomb.

title: When in Agra, do look beyond the Taj Mahall ...
review: at other great Mughal monuments, and don't let yourself be turned off by the silly, cheapening misnomer 'Baby Taj' for this exquisite tomb garden for Jahangir's father-in-law and grand vizier Itimad-ud-Daulah.  The central structure, the mausoleum itself, is a superb composition of white marble with polychrome stone inlays (quite different from the more Italianate work at the Taj Mahall) and, of course, elegant calligraphy.  The interior rooms are painted in a more Persianate style recalling the arts of the book and suggesting what palace rooms at Fatehpur Sikri might have looked like originally.

title: Beautiful forerunner of Taj
review: This is the baby Taj. It is on the banks of the Yamuna. Outside construction is of red sandstone. The inner structure, exquisitely carved and with intricate inlay work, is made of white marble. There are several tombs here which was made for Noorjehan's father. Not to be missed. Doesn't take too long to see around.

title: Itimad ud Daulah- an inspiration for the Taj
review: A beautiful marble mausoleum dedicated to Jahangir's father in law ( i,e the Empress Nur Jahan's father Ghiyas Beg who was given the name Itimad-ud-Daula or pillar of the state). Beautifully maintained with very few visitors. The pietra dura or inlay work in marble is stunning and the tomb is located amidst splendidly laid out gardens. For more details, do check out my blog on this monument at www.wanderndiscover.wordpress.com

title: must see
review: This is a very special place to vist while you are here a lot of history about the people that are here

title: Put this on your "must see" list for Agra
review: I adored this beautiful building. You can see elements of the Taj Mahal (stone inlay or pietra dura, lattice work, corner minarets, etc.) in its construction. It's so delicate and intricate (almost lace-like), and made of gleaming, white marble. Like the Taj Mahal, it's set high on the banks of the Yamuna River.

title: Nice and calm
review: Commonly tomb is included in the round trip (sometimes called "little Taj") . At this time there were a handful of monkeys around (in case you like ;-). Mostly I was impressed about the place itself and the fact that it was so calm - nearly peaceful...

title: Our favourite building in Agra
review: Known as baby Taj, we loved this place.  Hardly any tourists there and the setting on the banks of the river in a park like setting was glorious.  We watches hawks swoop for the many chipmunk like tree rats.

title: Good Time pass
review: Recommended for Indian tourist, who is staying for more than 01 day at Agra. it is very big with lots of walking. Even you do without guide.

title: Hidden Gem
review: Amazing little building - completely off the beaten track, hardly anyone else there - incredibly intricate and beautiful marble work mosaic reminiscent of Alhambra / Alcazar

title: Called the Baby Taj and well worth a visit
review: This is simply gorgeous, we had a guide and he was fab, explaining everything about it, showing us the different tombs and the intricate semi precious stone work on the walls. It was built before the Taj Mahal and is simply gorgeous. You do not need to spend much time there, under an hour and you will need to remove your shoes, if time permits in Agra, this certainly should be on your list.

title: The "Baby Taj"
review: When people think of Agra, most people first think of the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort, but the Tomb of  I'timād-ud-Daulah shouldn't be overlooked. The tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulahthe is often described as a "jewel box" or the "Baby Taj", and is often regarded as a draft of the Taj Mahal. Located to the north of the Taj Mahal on the Yamuna River, the Tomb is less crowded than the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort.

title: A wonderful handicraft
review: We visited Baby Taj a day after visiting Taj Mahal. and it is so marvellous that it is more beautiful then Taj Mahal . the artwork, the handicraft are more grandiose. It is really a hidden gem.

title: Interesting to see
review: It is only a small site so you won't be there any more than 30 minutes but definitely worth stopping by to see. It is a beautiful building and lovely to see close up. There is lots of monkeys there, and a nice view over the river.

title: worth a visit..its cute
review: the workmanship is better than Taj..the way marbles r cut to make jali. If you can hire a guide, more information can be available. I hardly spent 10 mins to go in the tomb & come back

title: Beautiful building,  great muslim detailed artworks
review: Well mantained and much calmer than Taj - must see while in Agra! 100 % worth to visit,  entrance 100 Rs per person

title: Visit this as well as the Taj
review: Everybody visits Agra for the Taj Mahal but this is little gem in the city. It obviously benefits with fewer tourists and is very pleasant in the late afternoon sunshine.

title: A really nice place to visit
review: I visited this place after visiting Taj Mahal. It's nothing close to the Taj Mahal but it has a beauty of its own which stands out. Also, this place is much less crowded than the Taj Mahal which allows you to sit and just look at the structure and appreciate its beauty without any hindrance and disturbance.

title: Baby Taj is nice
review: They call this the Baby Taj but it was actually built first. This place is simply beautiful.  It is hard to imagine the amount of work that was required to build a place like this.  I would not really compare this to the Taj Mahal on a scale of grandeur but for attention to detail it is comparable.  It is worth the time to see this along with the Taj Mahal because it gives you something to contrast things that make the Taj special.

title: Lives up to its nicknames; a "Baby Taj" and "Jewel Box" indeed...
review: Mausoleum of Mirza Ghiyas Beg father of Nur Jahan, and grandfather of Mumtaz Mahal. Fine example of pietra dura and inspiration for one of the most famous architecture of all time. Worth a visit for art and architecture buffs.

title: Highlight of Agra
review: This was by far my favourite part of Agra. The design of the building, whilst not on the same scale is beautiful. The grounds are better layer out than Agra and the colours of the building are very intricate.

title: Intricate work and built before the Taj
review: I think this is probably the most under-rated attraction in Agra. I found it extremely interesting that it was built before the Taj. It therefore seems grander than the Taj to me. It was an original idea and it has very intricate work. I read the history of the building and the woman who built it and I found that fascinating.

title: By far the most beautiful in Agra
review: You have to cross a bridge to come to this place. Its a bit far from the Taj Mahal and Fort. Its near the Chini ka Rauza. The tomb lies in a well maintained complex. ASI maintains it. The tomb lies right on the banks of the river and from the pavilion at the back, you can see the river flowing more or less right below you. The tomb's wall and ceilings are beautifully decorated with intricate curving and calligraphy in Persian. Its a truly beautiful place.

title: Visit to Baby Taj
review: This was just as enjoyable and just as beautiful as the Taj Mahal.  There aren't as many tourists so it is quite peaceful.  The grounds are well kept and were very enjoyable in the afternoon.

title: Magnificent Agra
review: It is another wonderful place in Agra.

title: Beautiful !
review: The baby Taj as they called it, is a nice, beautiful and quiet place. Give it a try if you're in Agra !

title: A great place to sit down by the river and reflect
review: Very few people come here which is both a boon and a pity. It is a peaceful place and the tomb is spectacular. This is the first instance of an entire building being made of marble in India - the Taj would have never been conceived had Jahanara not created this monument to her father.

title: Not the 'Baby Taj' at all
review: This is a beautiful and modest (by Mughal standards at least) memorial and was ground-breaking in design.  The extensive use of pietra dura works perfectly and the marble lattice screens are wonderful.  Lovely to visit; the scale is easier to cope with than the lack of people to contend with make it a relaxing place.

title: Cool
review: This was a nice stop as our guide explained the story and history. Good design, very beautiful and detailed.

title: A lovely add on to your Taj Mahal visit
review: Another beautiful monument in Agra. It was built by Noor Jehan for her parents and is testimony to a daughters love and respect. Don't miss!

title: Worth more than a brief vidit
review: This really was the surprise of the visit to Agra.  I had no idea it pre-dated the big Taj but it clearly influenced the latter.  The idea of designing such an intricate tomb for your family is really impressive.  The tile work wasn't as fancy but still was inspirational and intricate.  I wish we had the time for just sitting in the garden there.  No massive crowds to get in the door, pushing stuff on you, or once inside.  Unlike the Taj, though, there are no shoe covers so be prepared to walk around in socks or bare feet for awhile.  Total time could be 15 minutes, but for a respite's sake, make it at least 30.

title: Don't miss it ifin Agra to visit the bustling Taj Mahal
review: On the riverbank north of the Taj Mahal is the 'baby Taj', which pre-dates it. It is beautifully crafted marble tomb, with stunning decorative panels both on the inside & out. On the inside they look as bright as the day they were designed.

title: good design
review: Some different and good looking designs.Not much time is required to visit and not much crowded.Have to remove shoes, which if flooring is hot, then it is inconvenient.

title: Exquisite
review: A charming, beautiful and well located "mini" Taj Mahal. Well worth the visit for the place, tyhe environment and the story.

title: Worth a visit
review: The Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is given the monicker of "Baby Taj" and was constructed about 100 years before the actual Taj was built. It is definitely worth a short visit especially if one is coming to Agra from the expressway as it comes on the same route .

title: Beautiful place and tomb
review: Loved the magnificent tomb - you see where Shah Jahan got his idea from! Asked to remove shoes or put on coverings (old, previously ones) and then a "tip" was summoned. When I said it tip is something I give you for good service, not for something that is mandatory (especially after a rupees 110 fee), he ripped it off my shoe and told me to take off my shoes, which I willingly did. Agra is full of liars, cheaters and thieves. Question everything.

title: Small but impressive
review: A forerunner to the main Taj. This is sometimes know as "Baby Taj". A quiet place with few tourists, which made it pleasant and relaxing.  Although quite small, the attention to detail on the structures made it interesting to study.  Well worth a short visit

title: Wonderful
review: We thought this was different and unusual and interesting and enjoyed our visit - interesting that a woman could do so much in those days and a beautiful building

title: See this before the Taj
review: Called the "Mini Taj"  it is so much like the Taj Mahal - on small scale.  You can take pictures inside here.  Not very busy.  Overlooks the river - got great video of water buffalo going in for their end of day baths.

title: Beautiful
review: "Baby Taj" is the precursor of the grand Taj Mahal. Much less touristy to visit than Taj Mahal, no queues etc. While its not as impressive when you enter as the Taj Mahal, the detail in the work inside and the carvings and paintings are absolutely stunning. Doesn't take more than 1hr - its well worth visiting if you are coming to Agra.

title: Easier than Taj Mahal
review: I think visiting and enjoying this is much for easier than visiting Taj Mahal. While the latter is crowded and access requires a whole lot of test in patience, Tomb of itimad or Baby Taj is much more convenient and if not equally, still a beautiful sight.  The gardens are breathtaking, refreshing and they even have food stalls around. You could even see Taj from here.

title: Evening treat
review: Make sure you go late afternoon to this attraction to fully appreciate the peace and calm that exudes in the grounds. Be aware of dodgy touts who will try to prize you from your money for all sorts of goods and services.

title: hardly any people
review: It is well worth a visit. A beautiful layout off the place, peaceful and great symmetry of the buildings.

title: A preview to the Taj Mahal
review: Suggest visiting this site before visiting the Taj Mahal. There are few crowds here and the site is on a small scale that the Taj. One can appreciate the beauty of the inliad marble and stonework without guards blowing whistles ion your ear like you will experience at the Taj.

title: Absolute Must See
review: In every way as wonderful as the Taj Mahal. It's precursor, the Pietra Dura work is far more striking than the Taj Mahal. The grounds and setting are special and evoke a time lost to civilized people. The only other true star of Agra and an easy thing to recommend to my clients.

title: Precursor to the Taj
review: Located on the banks of the Jamuna river, this is yet another Mughal tomb built by Noor Jehan, the aunt (and step mother-in-law) of Mumtaz Mahal for whom the Taj Mahal was built. Noor Jehan built this for her father a Persian general. This shows more Persian features including the inlay work showing cypress tress and Persian flowers. Quieter and way less crowded than the Taj. Its sometimes referred to as the baby Taj, though its older than the Taj. It really is an entity in itself and the name baby Taj does it a disservice.

title: Baby Taj
review: If you go to Agra to see the Taj Mahal, it is really important to go first to this mausoleum as it gives the link between Mumtaz Mahal, for whom the Taj was built, and her grandfather, Mirza Ghiyas Beg although not as magnificent as the Taj, it is one of the first to be made from white marble rather than sandstone.  When we visited late afternoon, there were very few visitors, so unlike the Taj Mahal, you could linger untroubled and really appreciate the architecture.  Looking across the river, was a hazy view of the Taj Mahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: It was definitely interesting visiting the place after having been to Taj Mahal. Of course under its shadows the glamour of this place can be a bit muffled but otherwise this is not something that you should avoid while in Agra. The gardens and the beautiful marble works all around at the place is definitely something that makes your visit rewarding

title: Baby Taj
review: That’s what it goes by. Baby Taj. It truly seems apt too as in terms of beauty and architecture it is no less but still stands far from Taj Mahal though both share similar styles. This tomb is peaceful, far from maddening crowd and gives you enough space to appreciate and explore it. Taj can be quite chaotic compared to this one. The place also comes with beautiful gardens and even a view of the Taj Mahal itself.

title: Not to be missed
review: This Baby Taj  or the jewellery box as it is also known is easily overlooked.  It was not on our itinerary and we nearly didn't go.  We had a couple of hours free after our trip to Taj Mahal and The Agra Fort so decided to get a car and driver from the hotel.  I m so glad we did this is almost a hidden gem, very beautiful you need 45mins to an hour here as it is quite small.  Small entrance fee is well worth paying.  Try and fit this in if you have time.

title: Worth a visit
review: Small site right on the river.  Probably should have got a guide but we were getting a bit mausoleumed out by that stage (which is sad because they are all really impressive).  Just a short tuck tuck ride to the park across from theTaj and also near Chini Ka Rauza.  All of which worth doing that side of the river.

title: lovely
review: Smaller but very pretty. Older than the Taj. View this on the way back from viewing the Taj from the other side of the Yamuna

title: Free from the hype, away from the craziness...
review: The so-called 'Baby Taj' is usually depicted as a dry run for the real thing and thoough it is smaller and less imposing, it is still a beautiful building set in tranquil grounds on the opposite bank of the river.

title: Worth A Visit
review: This was a time filler while in Agra.  Worth the visit. A mini version of the Taj.  Consistently awesome architecture and beauty evident in the construction.  A photographer's dream.

title: It's like little Taj Mahal.
review: I was told that this is little Taj Mahal. You can see Jamuna river here. Entry fee 100 indian rupees.

title: Worth a short visit
review: Went here later in the day after the Taj. The Baby Taj is worth a visit. Although small it is beautiful and much less crowded. This was built before the Taj.

title: Second Best
review: The Baby Taj as it is known is smaller and yes less impressive and not as well maintained but still is impressive with nice views of the river at the rear of the property.

title: Beautiful building and a great view
review: This was the first building in Agra to be faced with marble under the mughals' rule.  It was the most stunning Persian and Arabic inlay work.  Floral and geometric designs in a wonderful array of colours which are still so bright and vivid.  Definitely worth the visit.

title: 'Baby Taj'
review: This is known as the Baby Taj, and is a beautifully and decoratively carved marble tomb, much smaller than the Taj Mahal, but fantastic in a more intimate way.

title: Baby Taj.
review: This is called the baby taj. Not quite as impressive as it's big sister but nice and sereen surroundings we had the whole place almost to ourselves. Also worthwile as only for the bridge you have to cross to get there.

title: Worth a visit
review: While this is not as grand as the Taj Mahal, it is often referred to as the "baby Taj" and has some lovely ceilings worth seeing.  It's usually not crowded so you get more time to soak up the atmosphere.  The gardens are nice here and you can usually see some nice birds and other small animals.

title: "Baby Taj"
review: This monument often described as a "jewel box", sometimes called the "Baby Tāj", the tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah is often regarded as a copy of the Tāj Mahal. Along with the main building, the structure consists of numerous outbuildings and gardens. The tomb, built between 1622 and 1628 represents a transition between the first phase of monumental Mughal architecture – primarily built from red sandstone with marble decorations, as in Humayun's Tomb in Delhi

title: Nice Place to see
review: This place also has a history whereas very few of us are aware about it. Anyway, the Baby Taj is really nice, and it was wonderful  in all.

title: worth to visit once you are in Agra
review: the tomb Itimad-ud Daulah is known as a baby Taj mahal.its smaller than Taj mahal but so worth to see it.its on the bank of river Yamuana .

title: Across the river Yamuna - A Mini Taj
review: Worth to see it, just other side of Yamuna river and good to cross through old narrow bridge.

title: Marvellous!
review: I'm sure most travellers to Agra make a beeline for the Taj Mahal. But if one visits Agra and give the Itimad-ud-Daulah a go-by its criminal. The monument with its exquisite, delicate beauty, has a charm that in a certain manner exceeds that of the Taj. The pietra dura work is marvellous, and look out especially for the niche with the "fish" flower vase. Walk around to the red sandstone gates of the monument and see the fine marble inlay work depicting flower vases, wine jars and goblets on the sides. The work is particularly pretty on the southern gate. The Yamuna on the western side of the monument is filthy but one can catch an egret daintily going about its business in the water.

title: baby Taj
review: This wasn't in our itinerary, but our guide took us here and I'm glad he did. I lovely place, serene, clean and in lovely gardens.. We worth a visit

title: Mini Taj
review: We went to see the Itimad-ud-Daulah before seeing the Taj and I'm glad we saw in that order.  The marble work is not intricate as in the Taj.  I think I would have been disappointed had I gone in the reverse order.

title: Stunning
review: It had the same elaborate wall design as Taj Mahal. Stunning Islamic artwork covering each inch of the building. Loved it

title: Brilliant monument
review: Impressive architecture, design, simmetry, artwork. Must see in Agra. A great concurrent of Taj Mahal.

title: A small piece of solitude
review: This is just so beautiful.  We preferred it tom the Taj Mahal which was excellent - so how can rate something to be more than excellent?  The secret lies in the garden around the tomb.  It is a small marble palace on the banks of the river and a place of quietness.

title: The baby Taj
review: This is indeed the Baby Taj. A beautiful tomb that was the inspiration for the Taj Mahal. Much quieter to visit than the Taj Mahal. Well worth a visit.

title: Nice, better than the Taj?
review: A precursor to the Taj Mahal, this tomb is perhaps more elaborate in some ways, the semi precious stone encrusted walls for example. But its nowhere near as famous.   Nice to visit.

title: Beautiful and peaceful
review: The Tomb is also called Baby Taj. Its having intricate carvings like the Taj Mahal. Its white and beautiful. Also its not that crowded like the Taj Mahal. Worth a visit. Dont forget to buy Taj Mahal Tickets from this venue to avoid long queue at Taj Mahal.

title: So very beautiful and peaceful
review: We were lucky enough to see the taj in the morning light without too many others around but we were even more pleased that we made the effort to come and view the exquisite "baby taj".

title: Beautiful building
review: This tomb of Nur Jahan's parents is a delight. It is truly a jewel box of a structure with superb inlay and a beautiful location. It is also a bonus that it is never as crowded as other sites in Agra. Often compared to the Taj it is actually very different and should be viewed on its own terms.

title: Serene and beautiful
review: This tomb is called the Baby Taj and it was built by the Empress Nur Jehan for her father, Chief Minister of Emperor Jahangir. The style is Mughal, therefore dedicated to perfect symmetry, and it really is like a jewel box. Many things, although in a smaller scale, are very similar to the grandiose Taj Mahal, like the gardens, representing the gardens of Heaven, the marble structure and work, the semi-precious inlays and so on. In addition there are not nearly as many people visiting and that makes for a more relaxed visit. Beautiful!

title: A good monument and a must visit in Agra
review: This is the tomb of Nur Jahan's parents and family members. Built before Taj this monument is the first building in Mughal period built entirely on Marble and it is said that the lot of ideas were taken from this monument while building Taj. Beautiful inlays is the special in this monument.

title: Good
review: Again nice piece of White Marvel and it shines in sunlight and you can see across the Yamuna river also.

title: Mini Taj Mahal
review: Its like mini Taj mahal. Its peaceful, probably few tourists visiting the structure. Best to see before visiting Taj Mahal or your first tourist spot in Agra

title: Questionable in terms of staff & its value as a sight
review: It's a nice sight to see if you are long on time.  If not, skip.  It pales next to the Taj and Agra Fort.

title: A fitting prequel
review: We came here before visiting the Taj Mahal. What a lovely spot, well cared for and so peaceful. Highly recommend a visit here.

title: A pleasant experience !
review: The place itself is very beautiful, no doubt why it has got the name "BABY TAJ". The roads to reach their is very congested so start early. Food items are prohibited.

title: OK for a fast visit
review: This is also called the "mini-Taj" and is a recent addition to the tourist circuit in Agra. Not nearly as impressive as the Taj Mahal, but nevertheless worth a quick visit, especially if you combine with a stop on the river opposite the Taj Mahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: A good prequel to the Taj Mahal. Very intricate marble work. Beautiful site. You need to take off your shoes to enter the mausoleum.

title: Cute!
review: The 'Baby Taj' has much more feminine aspects, almost replicating a jewellery box type aura with intricate patterning and colours. A lot less impressive than it's peer but equally admirable. A little bit of a shame there was a construction stand set up but cleaning maintenance is an admirable factor in a beautiful building, something that unfortunately gets forgotten in so many landmarks these days! Definitely worth a visit!

title: Great start to any tour
review: We were taken here as part of an organised tour (only the 2 of us with a guide and driver). This was the build up to the visit to the Taj Mahal and to try to allow the weather to clear up.

title: Nice
review: Visited with my family but the government needs to do more on the maintainance side and facilities there.I felt it is not a must vist site in agra.

title: Interesting and not to be missed
review: Agra is not just about the Taj right? One attraction worth a visit is the Tomb of Itmad-ud-Daula. The minarets, the inlay work and the details gone into is fascinating. Worth a visit even if one has to get across to the other bank of River Yamuna.

title: Worth for an afternoon visit
review: The monument itself does not have much too offer except that it looks like Taj Mahal and has 4 courtyards.

title: Gotta visit this one if visit Agra
