review: Tomb of Itmad-Ud Daulla is a Mughal mausoleum often described as a "jewel box", sometimes called the "Baby Tāj", the tomb of Itmad-Ud Daulla is often regarded as a draft of the Tāj Mahal. So yeah... you got to visit this tomb if you visit Taj Mahal as well...

title: A mini Taj but a real beauty!
review: This is a truly beautiful monument with absolutely stunning inlay of tiles.The  white marble walls are highly decorated with intricate tile work including semi-precious stone decorations. Although nothing could compare with the Taj Mahal this is a dfinite 'must see' when in Agra.

title: Beautiful!!
review: best to visit before the Taj Mahal so you can fully appreciate its own beauty. Absolutely beautiful Tomb with the most stunning roof that still have the carvings and paint on it. Don't know if guides are available but i don't think one is needed anyway. Definitely a must see along with the Taj Mahal and Agra Fort

title: Excellent
review: This is an absolutely amazing site. Located on the banks of the Yamuna River with a picturesque view, it is a must visit.

title: Not to miss
review: Agra is much more than the Taj Mahal. It is a city that has been blessed with many exquisite examples of Mughal or Islamic architecture, with a strong Persian influence. I'm so glad that I got to drink this in.

title: Stonework is stunning
review: Pierced stonework and inlays are the major feature of this tomb. There are threads tied to stones which is supposed to bring good luck. Not sure how this is part of Islam but there you go.

title: Example of variety in desing
review: Not to miss, very detailed design with intricate grill work, recent restoration sample gives the real idea of the beauty, colours & splendor.

title: Good historic place to visit
review: It is good place. Nice scenic view. I think grass should be done properly on the ground so it will look more beautifull.

title: It's a monument wort visiting when in Agra
review: Not many travellers add this in their itenerary, I strongly recommened it. The carving & the look is excellent.

title: Best place after Taj Mahal
review: The tomb building is a beautiful, wonderful place. This is a must-visit and is the most beautiful place to go to in Agra, after the Taj Mahal. The architecture of the building is so beautiful, you must spend some time admiring it. Absolutely stunning architecture and facade.

title: A little Gem!
review: Is it me or is the inlay work at the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah prettier than the Taj Mahal itself?!!! The best time to visit this place is either during sunrise or little before sunset....makes for some amazing photographs!

title: Beauty and the beast
review: The tomb was beautiful, the backdrop of Agra was pretty grimy!Nice taster before the taj!

title: less occupied, still very beautiful
review: This tomb is located on the other side of Yamuna rover so it is worth to take a tuk tuk fom Red Fort to go there. The visit here is a very pleasant experience as the place is much smaller and not crowded, but still beautiful. Pay attention to the colorful decorations on the ceillings.

title: Let down after being to the Taj
review: Visited here today but a bit of  Let down after being to the Taj

title: Beautiful precursor to Taj
review: This is a well preserved monument and speaks volumes about the vision and wealth of Indian regents and skills of the artisans. Unmatched in the world.

title: Peaceful
review: I visited this toward the end of the day with my guide.  Having a guide with me to explain the significance of the tomb and the backstory really made it more interesting to put into context with the Taj.    Was pretty empty when I visited which meant I was able to wander round to my hearts content.  Beautifully situated further upstream on the same river as the Taj,  it was a lovely place to visit and admire the craftsmanship and intricate inlay work.

title: Baby Taj - simply beautiful!
review: This was a lot less busy with tourists than the Taj Mahal which made for a lovely place to visit at leisure. Tombs are inside and in full view. The story behind the building of this marble vision is a lovely story so well worth having a guide to talk you through it.

title: Simply Wow
review: If you want to see & touch Mughal carvings & paintings this is a must visit place which is also known as Baby Taj

title: Beautiful and peaceful
review: Far smaller and less visited than The Taj Mahal, but still worth spending time here. Its a beautiful building situated in peaceful gardens. Do visit before The Taj though, otherwise you are likely to be disapointed.

title: False expectation caused by its name
review: Also called the baby taj, we ended up expecting something similar to the taj. The only thing similar is the symmetry aspect. It is not as majestic as the Taj. Otherwise its a quiet place that you can spend some time looking at the designs.

title: BEAUTIFUL!!
review: The story was half the visit.  A really great place to go to know more about India and her people. The art and skill of the architecture are amazing.  The grounds are beautiful and the story behind it are all well worth the time and effort to see.

title: normal place
review: not much to see you can finish this in 15 mins it just has 4 graves and a small tomb  so you can avoid  entry ticket is 10 rs

title: Dont miss it for the world
review: The intricate workings in this monument dwarfs the of the TAJ.

title: Must visit
review: I would urge all to visit this monument. The tomb is relatively well preserved and is a fine example of the intricate and rich work of the Mughal period. While the Taj is always crowded the number of tourists to this site is less.... and that accentuates the appeal.

title: go before Taj
review: Hard to be impressed if you've already seen the Taj. However, it's very quiet and you can have it almost all to yourself

title: A Baby Taj
review: That's what its called as it is also made of marble and was built before the Taj. It is on the other side of the Jamuna River and is good for picture taking. Easy access to the Tomb if coming from Delhi via the Toll Road.

title: Not a Mini Taj but still beautiful.
review: I loved the tranquility of this beautiful uncrowded monument which offers a quiet sanctuary after the hustle and crowds of visiting the Taj Mahal. Beatifully designed and a treat for the eyes.

title: Just more amazing India
review: As I've said before, you'll never see all of India so what you do see, see it well and take time to savour. And, take the guided tour or hire a guide or buy some literature understand the context of why it's important outside of the wonderful architecture.

title: A Monument under the shadow of its sibling
review: An excellent example of a women's insight and the feminity expressed at its best,this monument has fine latice work which can at best be described as feminine,the design,the conceptualisation,design all are excellent,this monument is certainly under the shadow of Tajmahal,had this monument been at another location it would have been star attraction and a crowd puller,in a nut shell dont forget to visit this beautiful piece of architecture on your next Agra visit.

title: Simle and nice
review: You can say a small version of Taj,

title: Baby Taj
review: Its a call Baby Taj make befor the The Tajmahal so This is similer like taj mahal Thats why call Baby Taj but maybe better to call this this is origenal in The Seven Wonders in The world Thank

title: A gem
review: Located across the river from the Taj Mahal and known as the Baby Taj, but actually built before the Taj Mahal. Built in a similar style and using white marble with intricate carving and inlay.

title: Wonderful little place
review: This is not a big place but it's really beautiful. It doesn't attract much crowd, so it's very peaceful as well. You can spend some good quality time in the lawns or around the tombs. There is not much to see at this place but can be a good relaxing experience.

title: Worthwhile
review: Went mid morning and hardly anybody there, nice to be able to enjoy. Worth visiting this monument as its impressive

title: historic
review: a nice  historic setting and  one feels  the mood of the  times as reflected in the setting , its a good place to vist

title: Baby Taj
review: By far, the best place to be visited in Agra. I was impressed with this  place much much more than the Taj Mahal. The place is beautiful. It is not so crowded and noisy,its vaassttt. One can sit there in the quiet and relax. There is a beautiful wind even in the afternoon as the place is open from all sides and next to a river. One can enter the room where the tomb stones are kept. All in all, a fantastic experience!

title: Quiet glory
review: This tomb is older than the Taj and the first mausoleum made fully of marble. We were there during sunset. Do not miss this.

title: lovely and cute
review: at first there were lots of emperors and got muddled with but the guided was kind to explain them and it was great to see this monument.

title: Loved learning about this place
review: Although it can get annoying quite quickly, having to pay 250rupees at every sightseeing spot while the locals pay 10rupees, this is worth the fee.

title: Small but stunning
review: A truly special architectural jewel in Agra....overshadowed by the Taj but well worth visiting all the same. Since this is not a large monument it is probably not on every visitor's schedule but it shows that Jehangir , like Shah Jehan was a great patron of splendid architecture.

title: Very nice place
review: Very well maintained place.

title: Baby Taj
review: known as baby taj a betiful monument in agra well persevered  and well kept i recommend to take a Up tourism police guide with you

title: Easily overlooked - but don't!
review: Everyone thinks of the Taj Mahal but this is beautiful too. It is not as refined or on the scale of the Tay Mahal but certainly more peaceful and worthy of visiting.

title: It is worth a visit
review: I have never heard of this attraction before, and the tuktuk driver I hired kind of "force" me to go. And I am glad he did it, as baby taj is a very beautiful place, peaceful and well preserved. What is important is visitor can really enjoy and feel the place without the over crowded like in Taj Mahal.

title: Baby Taj-- No way comparable to Taj mahal
review: Can not be compared to the magnificent Taj. There were monkeys everywhere! our driver had suggested that we didn't need a guide but a guide was necessary as the monument consisted of many tombs which we couldn't  understand.

title: Tomb of Itimad ud daulah
review: This is known as baby taj though of course not comparable with Taj. It is better to have a local guide to get to know the history . There are many guides available at the gate. This was built by Noorjahan,wife of Jehangir, in memory of her father. It looks exactly the same on all for sides. You can see beautiful carvings and inlay works many of which has been looted. This structure is also close to 400 years old and is about half an hour away from the city

title: Oft overlooked place, excellent workmanship
review: The tomb of Itiamduddaulah is tucked away on the banks Yamuna and is often overlooked by a lot of travelers.

title: Baby Taj!!
review: It is called Baby Taj because of the looks and construction of the Tomb. There are no Minars like Taj, this property is designed and commissioned by the Jahangir's Wife Nour Jahan for her parents. This property is located on the banks of Yamuna river.

title: Definitely worth a visit while in Agra!
review: We thought the only attractions in Agra were the Taj Mahal and the Red Fort but the "Baby Taj" was my absolute favorite!  This tomb is intricate and beautiful - even more beautiful decorations than the Taj Mahal.  The floors and ceilings are exquisite and the smaller number of tourists makes this a more comfortable and enjoyable place to visit.  Highly recommend it!

title: nice n clean...worth a quick visit
review: this is a monument that also explains that in mughal era, by this time there was a shift in construction style.

title: Good place
review: Also called the "baby taj", it is a must see. It shows the transition from red stones to marbles during the Moghul era. Small place, right next to Yamuna river, also very less crowded. Can be covered in 30 to 45 mins.

title: Little Taj Mahal!
review: The place is worth visited if you have enoigh time in Agra. It is similar to Taj Mahal but way smaller. The advantage is that there are not many people, you can take nice pictures and enjoy the scenery.

title: An architectural gem!
review: Although named Baby Taj the description might leave visitors a bit disappointed when seeing it rather than looking afresh and seeing it for what it is. The inlay work on the walls is gorgeous and the location by the river adds to its attraction. It, too, is well viewed from the opposite side just .ike the Taj. Well worth the visit and conveniently located too.

title: Mausoleum with most amazing stonework
review: Everyone goes to Agra to see the Taj, but this mausoleum steals the show in terms of the delicate stone work and is a very pleasant and quieter place to visit. A "must" when in Agra.

title: Baby Taj Mahal : do it while visiting Taj Mahal
review: Of course not so impressive and smaller than Big Brother but certainly worthwhile. Much more peaceful and not so crowded, this monument is a little jewel , standing in the shadow of Taj Mahal on the other bank of the river. Take a tuktuk from Taj Mahal for max 200Rs and drive 4km. Entrance fee : 110Rs/pp (1,5euro, 2$)

title: A good stop if you have extra time
review: Overall the "baby taj" isn't as spectacular as the original, but it's in a beautiful location overlooking the river and the gardens are immaculate. It's worth a visit if you have extra time on your hands but if you've already visited the Taj Mahal don't go out of your way.

title: Beautiful gem
review: If you are in Agra this is a must see. Small but beautiful history and architecture. Lovely stonework.

title: Less traffic
review: Traffic was less may be it was a foggy day with light drizzles all the way. Once on the expressway we could estimate the time to Noida, my next place of halt.

title: Fine art architecture
review: In my opinion, art works of painters and carvers is interesting and beautiful more than Taj Mahal much. This place should not be missed when you com to Agra.

title: Quiet place near the Yamuna
review: One of the underrated shrines of Agra. Very peaceful, quiet and sublime. The tourism department should take prompt initiative to popularize this shrine to the overseas tourists.

title: Do Not Miss This
review: This is the inspiration for the Taj Mahal- having been built approx 40 years prior to the Taj.  (affectionately called the "Baby Taj") Granted it is not nearly as large as the Taj, it has lots of elements worth seeing.  Not nearly as crowded either.

title: Nice and easy
review: Great place to visit before de taj mahal. Otherwise it would impress you less. A good place to sit at the river and just watch the coming and going of the people there.

title: Beautiful
review: Across the river from the Taj Mahal there is another small complex built along similar principles and affectionately known as Baby Taj.  I believe it pre dates the Taj Mahal by about 40 years.

title: magical murals
review: I am so grateful to our government for preserving this monument.  There's treasures galore for those of us who enjoy buildings. There's such detail in the decorative arts that adorn the walls. Such precision, such symmetry, and yet such unexpected variety. Would love to learn more about the art of those times.

title: Great. Peaceful
review: Not too many tourists at this very well maintained tomb. Well worth a visit for an hour or so - especially watching the river traffic and life from the back.

title: Baby Taj
review: Very well done and beautiful structure... I understand that this was the one that inspired the actual Taj Mahal. Not much rush so easy to visit and look around.

title: the baby Taj
review: Absolutely wonderful and gorgeous.  Rashid Qureshi ( would rate him as a one of the best Agra Guide) took us through intricate details of the architecture, the lattice work and the brilliant inlay work. In many ways, I found it to be the most beautiful monument in Agra ( my personal view).

title: Must Must Visit!!
review: The tomb of I'timad Ud-Daulah, or "The Pillar of the State", a title given to Mirza Ghiyas Beg who served Emperor Akbar as the Treasurer. He was the father of Nurjehan - wife of Jahangir, and grandfather of Mumtaz in whose memory the Taj Mahal was built. This building marks the transition of architecture from primary red stone buildings with a little marble work here and there, to fully marble-clad buildings. Built around 1620 by Nurjehan, this houses the tomb of her parents and other relatives. Going by the extraordinary art work on marble, this can easily said to be the model or inspiration for Taj Mahal. If you happen to visit Agra, make it a point to ask for "Baby Taj" as this is colloquially known here. You will not be disappointed.

title: Special place
review: We visited on the afternoon after a morning visit to the Taj Mahal and I almost enjoyed it more.  Of course it doesn't have the wow factor being at the Taj Mahal, it is much smaller but to me the pietra dura and jali were prettier and more intricate and it was so peaceful, we spent some time relaxing, sitting in the shade on the cool marble and enjoying the surroundings.

title: Baby Taj
review: A typical small Indian temple. Some well kept grounds, with loads of monkeys. A few photo opportunities. Not spectacular but if you want to visit another place in Agra you van head here.

title: Not to be missed.
review: I have visited agra several times but never missed Taj Mahal.  My last Trip allowed me two hours of leisure. so I had planned to visit Tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah for the first time, all I can say why no body mentions this monument?  unlike other monument visit, here it less walking, less crowd, peaceful, Clean, looks like a new monument, you  can cover the main monument within 15 mints if you want,carry extra socks for rent ,rest is like walking in a park, you can walk  in your shoes.

title: Good Inlay work but nothing great
review: If you love to complement the detailed indian art and sculpture and can afford to spend one hour..its a good option before you enter mehetab bagh to see the Taj Mahal during Sun set. Its near Mehetab Bagh.

title: Beautiful
review: This place is smaller than the Taj, but just as delicate.  The preserved paintings are amazing. It is nice to experience this place without the crowds, which is easy to do.

title: Impressive
review: in many ways this is much more appealing and a comfortable visit than Taj Mahal. The place is less crowded and have more space for tourists. Plus what you are looking in Taj can easily be found in its architecture as well. No wonder why my guide said that this was an inspiration for Taj. This is also known as Baby Taj. the place is also filled with monkeys so no visible food while strolling through the place.

title: Some things worth..
review: A bit far from the hotel aroung 5 Km, but this monument is worth watching.The baby taj (second name) is very nice and well maintained.

title: Wonderful
review: Absolutely great piece of art near the Yamuna river. If you go there at the sunset you will see a nice warm light on the Western side of it. The decorations of the whole building are absolutely amazing and there is a nice view from the balcon of the complex on the river.

title: Visiting the "Jewel Box"
review: I have been to Agra several times and this is my favorite spot.  I love the Taj Mahal but this lovely spot is not to be missed.  It is a little complicated to get there but well worth it.  The tomb was made made by Emperor Jahangir's queen, Nurjahan , in the memory of her father Mirza Ghias Beg. It is built entirely in white marble and inlaid with semi-precious stones and is well preserved.  Mirzā Ghiyās Beg was the grandfather of Mumtāz Mahāl ( daughter of Asaf Khān), the wife of the emperor Shāh Jahān, responsible for the construction of the Tāj Mahal.  Visiting here is well worth the effort and is much less crowded.  It is a peaceful moment of exquisiteness.

title: First this tomb, second Taj Mahal!; just fall in love!!
review: It's just great to see this first tomb and then known that Taj are from same persian architect.

title: Really beautiful and quiet place to visit
review: This place is also called as Baby Taj, really beautiful, nice wall paintings and art work inside.  It has lots of tombs inside, but no sign has been placed anywhere inside that tells who each tomb belongs to.  Overall nice architecture, beautiful quiet place, lots of monkeys, no touts around, and nice view of the river in the background.

title: exquisite
review: the inlay carvings on marble walls are a feast to the eyes.well preserved piece of monument.also a must see in Agra

title: A must see Attraction on a 1-2day tour of Agra
review: is your into Architecture, History, and one of the main attractions in Agra, then this tomb is a must do agenda item on the tour.

title: Worth a short visit
review: Stopped on our return journey from Taj Mahal to Delhi. Probably takes no more than 20 minutes if you have already done the Taj. It has a number of similarities but just on a smaller scale.

title: go before doing The Taj
review: Of course it's not as beautiful as the Taj Mahal (even though some people like to state it).

title: Mini Taj
review: Well nothing great in this place some people like to refer it as Mini Taj and you hae higher expectations from it Although not much frequented by Tourist so this is very quite compared to Taj

title: See this
review: Small intimate and set in a lovely park this 'baby' taj sets the scene and puts the Taj Mahal in context.  If you visit in 40+ HEAT dont walk on the white marble floors barefoot!  Very pleasant

title: A Must See for Indian History or Moghal Architect Buffs
review: Our visit was in fact a long time ago -- 1971.  But our memories are quite pleasant...  I am writing this review to correct an unintended low-star rating recorded by us by mistake.  Never fear you will enjoy your visit there.

title: Baby Taj
review: Quiet and peaceful place to visit. Quite a beautiful structure. Interesting back story and history. Very well maintained gardens.

title: Visit this Tomb of Itimad ud Daulah
review: As one comes to expect of these buildings the architecture is beautiful and the inlaid design work of the marble amazing. wonderful photos, not a busy at the Taj Mahal, but a beautiful place

title: It's a quite beautiful outside and inside
review: It's a quite beautiful outside and inside. The red gates are similar to the gates of Taj Mahal. The Tomb is smaller, then Taj Mahal, but ornate and very nice.

title: Unsung beauty
review: It is a gorgeously ornate 17th century tomb - largely ignored by the tourists. Its on your way to the Yamuna Expressway so you will pass it anyway. It is not crowded. The only turn-off is it's approach - filthy lane and no parking.

title: Little Jewel Not to Be Missed
review: Our guide referred to the tomb as the "baby taj." It is an uncrowded, beautiful site that has, on a smaller scale, some of the similar beautiful architecture and stonework of the Taj Mahal. It is a quick stop, less than an hour is sufficient, but you will find that it sticks in your memory as a place not to be missed.

title: Less popular, but a worthwhile monument
review: The tomb is an older sibling of Taj Mahal - it does share a number of unique features and is set in a pleasant garden. Furthermore you can enjoy it without hordes of tourists as at present it's largely ignored by majority of tourist. If you can spare an hour or so to visit it - do, it's a very good experience.

title: A small miniature with no crowd
review: nothing amazing here.while the big monument stands near no crowd at this place.but if u have time do watch it.not a must see if u have limited time.

title: A beautiful piece of architecture
review: Unfortunately overshadowed in popularity by the Taj, it is a beautiful tomb surrounded by a well kept garden, well worth a visit if in Agra. Amazingly detailed marble work. If you are here near dusk you can see the sun setting over the river. Not as often visited by tourists and hence quite a peaceful experience.

title: Unbelievable inlaid stonework - Better than the Taj Mahal
review: This place is smaller than the big one but has much more detailed inlaid stone work. The little man who provides you with your shoe covers is such a character. He was the highlight of our visit. .The architecture and gardens are also worth the visit. Much quieter than it's big brother as well

title: Mogul Architecture
review: Another piece of magnificent design and architecture with a lot of history.  A lot of masterful building work to be enjoyed.

title: Mini Taj in Agra
review: This is tomb of Mumtaz Mehal, grandfather Itimad-ud-daulah.  He served as a Prime Minister, in the reign of Jehangir.  Delight for eyes, a must visit place for photographers.

title: Simply beautiful and peaceful
review: Also know as baby taj, the tomb of itidma-ud-daulah was beautiful. We didn't know much about the tomb nor did we get a guide, but walking arounds the grounds of this place was beautiful enough.

title: "Baby Taj" a must see.
review: What a beautiful sight! Similar to the Taj but so much more peaceful. Was overcast when we visited but none of it's beauty was lost. Only half a dozen other people here compared to the thousands a the Taj Mahal so definitely a great way to enjoy some amazing Mogul architecture without the crowds. A must see whilst in Agra.

title: historical importance
review: This structure is known as the "Baby Taj" and you can see the influence.  Very beautiful decorations. Built between 1622 and 1628.

title: Baby Taj ?????
review: Recently visiting Agra, we visited this place and were quiet disappointed as this place has nothing in compare to the workmanship and beauty of original Taj.I am wondering what these so many great reviews are all about.Place is not being kept well ASOI and slowly the workmanship is falling apart.they have a huge open land for the Garden but it was mostly grass every where, in fact they can p lough many beautiful Flower and Seasonal Plants in to this area to bring  life to the place as there is no energy for any one to feel.Disappointing.

title: Baby Taj
review: There is no comparison with Taj Mahal. This is very very small place situated on the other side of river Yamuna.This is tomb of  Itimad-ud-daulah, grandfather of Mumtaz Mehal. You can visit the place for few snaps if  you have spare time, but again it is not at all comparable with Taj mahal.

title: Little Taj Mahal,very nice, no crowds
review: Last stop while in Agra, very nice place to visit, similar to the grand Taj Mahal, accept for the dome.   Very few people visiting at this place, which made it nice for picture taking.

title: Spend some time and feel happy
review: Of course I liked the monument and disliked the outers here. While coming from NOIDA/DELHI to Agra via Yamuna Expressway It is situated at the entrance of Agra. One can stay for just 30 minutes in this monument and pick a historic vision of Agra City.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is not as spectacular as the Taj Mahal but it is worth remembering that this place was copied on a grander scale to create the Taj and does pre date it. Well worth the visit.

title: Nice monument
review: It is another beautiful monuments in Agra and inlay work is fantastic and even we called it as Baby Taj.

title: The Mini Taj, well worth a visit
review: No crowds here but well worth a couple of hours of your time. Beautiful architecture and gardens. Indian monuments don't come complete with refreshments rooms but straight opposite the entrance is a row of local shacks where you can sip a soft drink while making contact with the locals.

title: Interesting aside from the Taj
review: If visiting the Taj, you will visit the 'baby-Taj'.  But you would not come to Agra to visit it alone.

title: This is what led to the Taj Mahal
review: It is kind of evident from the beauty and the structure of the whole place that this was what inspired the basic construction of Taj Mahal only on a much bigger and grand scale and compared to Taj Mahal, Baby Taj so as popularly known lack luster but at the same time is a perfect tourist spot with views to inspire and awe and less crowded leaving you space and air to breathe and enjoy this beauty. There are ouple of food stalls around to grab a bite after your intake of this architectural beauty.

title: hidden gem
review: Truly beautiful, you must see this to truly understand and appreciate the Taj. It is both similar and different. The amazing thing is as unlike the Taj there are so few visitors and it is not commercialised. Highly recommended

title: Baby Taj
review: The baby taj is also a hidden gem as it is as beautiful as the taj mahal..i don't believe guides saying that it is made before taj mahal, but believe it ...

title: Worth the extra time
review: We paid extra for this excursion after visiting the Taj Mahal, the trip took us over the river and we were treated to the view of village life.  We arrived during the long sun of the late afternoon and this beautiful venue was quiet with very few tourists.  We enjoyed this after the business of all the other venues.  There were no traders, only a man offering to look after our shoes which we had to remove. The gardens were beautiful and the view over the river sublime.

title: Go prior to the Taj Mahal
review: It's a mini TM  with lots of history- beautiful building with stunning inlay of semi precious stones, only a few tourists and so peaceful after the busy streets of agra.

title: Beware the monkeys!
review: Worth a stop to visit this 'Mini Taj Mahal', also in a beautiful position on the banks of the river.  Its worth going inside as the the decorations are amazing. Beware the monkeys as one of them went for me and swiped my ankle.  I had been taking a photo of another monkey and had no idea the others had moved in behind me and one of them was not too happy that I was there.

title: Not to be missed
review: Often called the "Baby Taj" it tends to be overshadowed by the Taj Mahal but is certainly worth visiting if in Agra. It is gorgeous in its detailed structure with marble inlay and far less crowded then the Taj Mahal. It is an architectural beauty both internally and externally. We visited towards the end of the day although there still were quite a few visitors. It boarders the river as well so it has beautiful views. It would definitely suggest visiting if you want something a little less mainstream.

title: Don't fall for the Baby Taj catch, the Itimad-ud-Daulah has a beauty and story of its own to tell.
review: Every one of the Mughal monuments are a marvel of their own and the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is no different. The story of a daughter's love so great for her parents to scenic gardens to the beautiful white marbles used in the tomb is just mesmerizing. The tomb is not as famous or overly-crowded like to Taj Mahal so its peaceful and calm. A place where you can just sit, enjoy the view and marvel on how the Mughal's lived their lives.

title: Quiet and a tiny version of the Taj Mahal
review: Likes:  Not crowded compared to the Taj Mahal.  But on Fridays, when the Taj Mahal is closed, I hear this place is crowded.

title: exquisite
review: We didn't really know much about this tomb but were encouraged to visit by the family at our homestay. The Tomb is much more intricately decorated that the Taj Mahal and although much smaller is a lovely peaceful place to visit.

title: Baby Taj – when she grows up will be a stunner!
review: Was thinking that this visit would have been a waste of time after seeing the main course earlier that morning. But very glad that Annurag our excellent Guide from Trinetra Tours took us there. Yes smaller, but the crowds are nowhere near as big and with a lovely aspect over the river Yamuna a real pleasant surprise. The tomb itself was built by the Empress Noor Jehan as a memorial to her father, Mirza Ghiyas Beg. Restful gardens a few eagles overhead and yes you have a worthwhile 35 minute visit.

title: Beautiful Tomb
review: Sometimes called Baby Taj, it is not as imposing but nonetheless worth a visit. Some of the craftmanship is more intricate than the Taj and its location by the river is peaceful although it is just off a main road.

title: Baby Taj, very nice place
review: It is much smaller than Taj Maha. However, I really like the nice deco on the wall and the dome flora design. I think it is completely worth the visit. And also, it is much less crowded, so take your sweat time to sit around and enjoy it.

title: Baby Taj rivaling Mother Taj
review: I found this one to be more striking less persuasive and intruded than Taj Mahal. Mughal architecture no doubt stands with its elegance and charm and a glaring example of the same is Taj Mahal itself but Baby Taj is not far behind in its beauty or charm. The best part is that this place is open for you to explore at your own pace as there is less crowd and the whole area is without the range of touts and vendors that hawk around Taj Mahal. If you want to sit and enjoy the best of Mughal architecture then it is better you head over to this place

title: peaceful and beautiful
review: When we were done with the Taj , agra fort , lunch and shopping and we went to see the Tomb of itimad ud daulah. It is also known as the name of baby taj. We love the peaceful environment of this place not crowded as taj. But beauti of this tomb is fantastic. It is also made of white marble makran. But we found one difference in this tomb and and the tomb of qeen mumtaj{taj mahal}. Here tomb is in center of four gardens. But at taj mahal the tomb is at the northern end. But according to islamic concept of paradise tomb should be in center. Its mean tajmahal has a hidden meaning which serves higher purpose. This tomb of itimah daula was built three years earlier then the starting of construction of tajmahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: A must,  its older than The Taj Mahal & smaller in scale, the views across the river are amazing . The mosaiacs are really pretty and colourful

title: "Baby Taj" - Peaceful Counterpart to THE Taj
review: You really should visit the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah while in Agra, especially after visiting the Taj Mahal.  You will find this tomb nestled in a quiet garden.  The tomb itself is beautiful and intricate, but lacking the hordes of tourists at the Taj.  We sat in the garden for a while just soaking up the beauty and history.

title: Excellent historical monument
review: It is always nice to review history when you visit such a old monument which is surprisingly kept well by the authority.

title: "Nice to see "
review: It is Located on the right bank of the Yamuna River,The walls are white marble from Rajasthan On each corner are  hexagonal, about thirteen meters tall......

title: Hamburger after Prime Cut Steak
review: Basically after you've seen the Taj Mahal, the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah ("Baby Taj" as they call it) pales in comparison and also gives you a feeling of ennui (not even deja vu).  It's very much been there, done that, and I personally think this is one site you can skip.

title: Known commonly by English speakers as "baby Taj"
review: A beautiful, smallish tomb, on the shores of the Yamuna River, Agra...

title: Not to be missed
review: The mausoleum is rightly compared to a jewel box as it is built entirely out of white marble and the gem inlay is much more visible than it is on the Taj Mahal. It is quite spectacular to behold from the outside. I visited around noon and there were only a few other tourists. The surrounding garden is green and relaxing and you have some nice views of Yamuna river.

title: Inspiration for Taj Mahal
review: This was commissioned by Nur Jahan (a woman) to honour  either her father or father-in-law (we got 2 stories!) She was also related to Shah Jahan builder of the Taj Mahal. It is believed to be the inspiration for the Taj Mahal which was commenced a couple of years later. It's a pretty building, not on the same scale as the Taj but well worth seeing. Features much of that era's design features: carved and latticed marble and inlayed precious stones. The committment to symmetry makes all these buildings pleasing to the eye. Try to get dropped on the same side as the building as crossing the road in Agra took us nearly 10 minutes and I'm sure took several years off our life! BEWARE: If you have a driver and guide they will try to take you to a marble inlay factory to see the "same families still doing inlay work" Who knows? The pieces are expensive, however if they are genuine are quite beautiful. Probably the most likely place to be sucked in to an expensive buy is Agra...because after you've seen the big Taj and baby Taj with their romantic stories you do tend to get a bit mushy!

title: Mini Taj
review: This 'little' tomb is situated on the outskirts of Agra, and benefits from being completely overshadowed by its much larger sibling the Taj Mahal. Although not quite as beautiful or as intricately carved it is still very engaging and a perfect example of the symmetry that is seen in almost all Mughal tombs. Plus it is often almost deserted. Admittedly we visited on a day when it was persistently raining but even this did not detract.

title: Enchanting
review: If it could be possible for a tomb to be enchanting, Itimad-ud-Daulah had pulled it off. The architecture of the tomb is mesmerizing, reminding of the grandeur of the Mughal era via its architecture and the inscriptions on it. The beauty of the engravings, the flowery pattern carved on it was unspeakable.  The tomb is made of white marble, the color of peace and that’s what one feels here: peace and calm all around even though there is quite a crowd to see the tomb here.

title: good place.
review: it is very good place to see when you are in agra with your friends and family.it is full of adventure and thrills.

title: Must see
review: This mausoleum should be on everyone's itinerary. It is amazingly beautiful in its perfect and intricate design. The gardens are well maintained and the whole aura is peaceful as not too many people visit it. It has paid washrooms at the entrance. The only problem is lack of parking space.

title: Lovely building, with fine detail
review: Worth visiting prior to the Taj Mahal.

title: Quiet getaway...
review: Not impressed with the security guards throwing stones at the monkies (needs must I guess if you don't want your flower bed destroyed!) but the building is more intricate than the Taj with prettier inlays.

title: BABY TAJ
review: This Tomb is situated about 9 Kms from Agra Cant Railway Station on the Banks of Yamuna River. This place is also known as 'Baby Taj' and also as 'Jewel Box'. This exquisite marble tomb was made by Emperor Jahangir's queen- Nurjahan- in the memory of her father.

title: Too often overlooked in the rush for the Taj.
review: The monkeys I can do without but the peace and beauty of the building and gardens are unequalled in Agra. There is an intimacy that never fails to lift the spirits, especially after the battle to enter the Taj.

title: Beautiful inlaid marble work
review: It takes time to get there, but it was worth it.  It was not crowded so you could have a really good look around.  So quiet and peaceful. Very beautiful buildings. Truly stunning inlay work.

title: Definitely worth a visit
review: The so-called mini-Taj is more worth a visit than Agra Fort and, unlike the Taj Mahal, is not crowded and you can wander freely with minimum security. Rather like a jewel box on the opposite side of the River Yamuna to the Taj Mahal.

title: Overshadowed by the Taj, but do not miss
review: Itmad Ud Daulah's Tomb in Agra is an exquisite place with extraordinarily beautiful "tomb".  The stone inlayed white marble building is well restored.  Traffic in Agra can make getting to it a bit of an ordeal, but resist temptation to skip it.  It's much less crowded than the Agra fort and the Taj, and that makes it easier to absorb the beauty and the surrounding gardens.

title: Tranquil and beautiful
review: This tomb and gardens were quite quiet late afternoon, which from a selfish point of view allowed us to fully absorb abd appreciate its beauty. Well worth a visit.

title: Beautiful place! To visit (before the Taj Mahal)
review: Also called the baby Taj, this tomb is beautiful, elegant and definitly  something I would recommend seeing!

title: Good to have a quick look
review: Nice to see!If you are going by Express way then you see this place on the way. Not a bad idea to have a quick look.

title: To be visited before the Taj Mahal
review: It is gorgeous and to be appreciated in full, it should be visited before the Taj Mahal. Bring socks as you have to leave your shoes outside.

title: The Baby Taj
review: This was the first tomb in India to be built entirely of white marble. We were amazed at the vibrant stone inlays and elaborate carvings. This tomb predates the Taj Mahal and was built for the father of the Emperor's wife. It is true that this tomb resembles an intricate jewel box.

title: Beautiful baby Taj
review: Another beautiful building - smaller that the Taj Mahal but so beautifully decorated with frescoes and stone inlays it is quite breathtaking.  Set in lovely gardens overlooking the river it is a must-see in Agra.

title: Really very nice, go!
review: It takes 15 to 20 minutes to visit and has a lovely garden. The only concern is the entrance guard kept the tickets and did not want to tear them...

title: The first marble structure in Mughal India
review: Itt is a tomb constructed by Noor Jahan in memory of her father who came to Akbars court from Persia.it was constructed in the time of Jehangir and it is thought to be the inspiration of the later Taj Mahal.Beautifully constructed in the midst of a Mughal with the Jamuna flowing inthe back, it is a must see in Agra.

title: A treat for eyes
review: This is a very interesting monument. The paintings on walls and the general ambiance and scale of the building is quite amazing.

title: Motivation behind Taj Mahal!
review: This is a beautiful mausoleum which is rightly called the jewel box. It is completely made of marble with fine carvings and designs.  The tomb overlooks the yamuna river and has beautiful gardens. Must visit!

title: pretty jewel
review: the Baby Taj is a must see....the intricate lattice work fascinated me. It was good to visit after the Taj Mahal..it seemed more intimate

title: Baby Taj
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah or baby taj is mausoleum made for Mirza Ghiyas Beg who was the father of Nur Jaham and grandfather of Mumtaz Mahal ( wife of Shah Jahan). It is a beautifull building built from red sandstone with marble decorations. I would highly recommend it to be visited before visiting Taj Mahal. Do wear socks as shoes are not allowed inside.

title: Mini Taj, even more beautiful than Taj itself
review: Absolutely grand! Though smaller in size it is much more beautiful. Great craftsmanship. Could be kept a little better. Carry your shoe covers when you go   to visit thistomb

title: Jewel Box
review: Less crowded, but very beautiful. It is said that this monument was precursor to Taj Mahal. It is on the other side of the river so best visited while leaving Agra.

title: Really pretty, actually
review: I wasn't expecting this site to be as wonderful as it was. It doesn't take very long to go around so you don't need to plan too heavily for it. Very well maintained.

title: A real treasure
review: Difficult to believe one can be moved so soon after seeing Taj Mahal.  It was a cold day but this monument was virtually deserted a great shame not to see more tourists. This site is also very well maintained and presented. Well worth visiting as this is very beautiful.

title: Baby Taj
review: Well worth a visit...we only spent 30-40mins there...which was enough...in my mind not quite as beautiful as the real thing

title: Tomb Itimad-ud-Daulah
review: This is a serene place to make a quick visit. It is a beautiful tomb made of marble and had a high ground view of the area. Can be done when up at theory area of Agra.

title: Mini taj! Wonderful!
review: Quiet and peaceful. Most of it is very well maintained. Not many folks around when I was there. Clearly not as big as the Taj but very beautiful work.

title: A nice place to visit when u go to Agra
review: Located on the right bank of the Yamuna River, the mausoleum is set in a large cruciform garden criss-crossed by water courses and walkways. The mausoleum itself covers about twenty-three meters square.

title: A real gem in Agra, even more beautiful then Taj Mahal.
review: We visited Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah also known as Baby Taj before visiting Taj-Mahal. It is a hidden gem in Agra. Although not as Majestic and large as the Taj, this place is relaxing and peaceful. It was not crowded at all. The architecture of this monument is excellent. This monument, visible as you cross the bridge over the Yumana River is well worth a visit. The tomb of Nur Jahan's parents is relatively small, but very beautiful. Itimad-ud-Daulah was the treasurer for the Mughal Empire during the reign of the Emperor Akbar. His daughter Nur Jahan was the wife of Emperor Jahingir (father of Shah Jahan who built Taj Mahal). Highly Recommended.

title: Really pretty
review: We were very pleasantly surprised by this site.  It is stunning and the workmanship fab.  Set in big garden with the usual four gateways which were equally grand.  also great view over the river.  Well worth including this on your visit to Agra.

title: quiet amid chaos
review: The "baby taj" was a lovely surprise after the majesty and crowds at "the" Taj Mahal.  Quiet, elegant, low key.  A serious, smaller scale memorial.

title: Peaceful place
review: Really liked this place - quiet, so could be reflective - no hawkers allowed inside grounds! Lovely views too.

title: Marvellous Site Baby Taj
review: It is a Jewel Box! A monument built by Nur Jahan, the wife of Jahangir, for her parents, is a serene place to visit. Unlike the Taj Mahal, this place is not crowded but please make it a point to visit the place since this place complete the story of love (Taj Mahal), power (Agra Fort) and respect (Baby Taj) by the Moghul Kings. It is built with red sandstone. Has a plenty of marble and semi precious stone decorations. Truly a pretty site.

title: A day in Agra
review: This was a hidden gem. Not many visitors and so peaceful and calm. This is a must see when in Agra. You get to wear little orange shoe covers so you can feel like an Oompah Lumpah, but it is for the well-being of the monument. A oasis of calm.

title: Exquisite
review: Smaller than the Taj, this tomb is stunning and not so crowded.  Inlay work and architecture are absolutely worth the visit.

title: A small but lovely site
review: The 'Baby Taj' is a nice place to wander. The main building has lovely paintings on the walls inside. It is quite small so you don't need long to visit. There were lots of monkeys when we visited, so don't bring food! Toilets are 5 rupee per person.

title: Fantastic place to visit
review: Well worth heading slightly out of town to get to this stunning structure. Go before seeing the Taj Mahal, as in all reality once you have seen the Taj nothing will come close to it. That said the skill and detail on the building is of the highest order.

title: Baby Taj
review: Nice monument for a short visit, was not crowded when we visited and probably spent no more than an hour in total.

title: Another Gem of Agra
review: Regular visitor to Agra since 1970,visited monuments many times.

title: Another highlight in Agra
review: Very special and interesting place.  Very different feel from the Taj Mahal, definitely an important stop in Agra.

title: A miniature of the Taj Mahal - yet much less crowded
review: Locals call this mausoleum "the baby Taj Mahal".

title: Wonderful and peaceful
review: We visited Itimad-ud-Daulah right after arriving in Agra, just before sunset. Forgotten by some tourists, who only focus on Taj Mahal and Red Fort, it is a treasure that you cannot miss. We do agree with another reviewer who suggested to visit Itimad-ud-Daulah before going to Taj Mahal. It is a good idea indeed, since otherwise you are likely to underestimate it, forgetting that it is not the size that matters! The place has a lot of charm, and very peaceful atmosphere. Do not hurry up – give yourself time to wonder around, contemplate the architecture, and study the meticulous decorations and carvings. A must-see!

title: Worth Visiting
review: If you can visit here before seeing the Taj Mahal.  It is a very beautiful building and worth visiting.  It didn't take us long to go round it.  The gardens are peaceful and a nice place to relax if you have time.

title: Underrated but beautiful!
review: Excellent architecture, marble carvings and inlays with semiprecious stones, much less crowded than Taj, but again a must visit, except for the size and scale it matches Taj in  beauty/splendour/architecture etc An enjoyable one hour very tranquil in early winter mornings

title: Very beautiful but understated
review: We visited this tomb early in the morning and it was very quiet there. It is beautiful with lovely marble and inlays. The gardens around it are well kept. It is well worth the hour or so that we spent there.

title: Worth a look
review: Pales against the Taj Mahal and the Agra fort but cheap at 100 rupees and worth every penny. Won't take up too much time but an easy way to spend an hour or two. The tuk tuk ride across the bridge will be an experience in itself.

title: Well-maintained edict
review: Dating back to well before Taj-Mahal, this edict has stayed in the shadows of the Taj. Well maintained, the sheer lack of footfall of the common Indian ensures that it is far better a visit than the run-of-the-mill places where everyone wants to be photographed.

title: The Little Taj
review: Don't miss this gem. It would be more famous if located anywhere but right near the Taj Mahal.  It is truly beautiful and quieter. We wandered around here for an hour or two and only saw a couple of Indian families.

title: Lovely ...
review: Do visit this place. This is said to be the original Taj. The good part is since this monument was not studded with precious stones, the raiders of history did not find it worth stripping it. The original design is still intact on all sides. Now if you imagine the Taj was similarly decorated but with precious stones, the awesomeness of the Taj really hits you. This place is a must visit to understand the grandness of the Taj which it is now stripped off.

title: ITMAD-UD DAULAH
review: it is about 9 km from Taj one can hire a auto to visit there. It is a tomb made by Nurjahan the wife of emperor Jahangir in the meory of her father. built in white marble in a persian style local people named this tomb as Baby Taj.

title: A little out of the way but worth it
review: Breathtaking architecture outside Agra. I would highly recommend. Like almost every site in Agra there is a ticket charge. Other than the Taj Mahal most places cost 100 or 110 rupees to enter. It's worth it. Can be combined with Ram Bagh, Chini Ka Rauza and Mehtab Bagh

title: A Special place
review: This so-called Small or Baby Taj actually pre-dates the Taj Mahal by a century. It, unusually for this period, uses white marble with wonderful inlay. This is a peaceful spot not inundated by tourists and a wonderful place to relax, observe the Yamuna River and see superb architecture.

title: Very beautiful almost no other tour groups in peak season
review: We were here mid morning during Xmas season and unlike Taj Mahal there was literally no one here when we got here so very peaceful.  There were tour groups as we were leaving but not very many.  It is definitely worth the visit.

title: Beautiful
review: This is a tomb of father of Begum Nur-Jahan. So intricate work been done her. One would not believe that this is hand work. Very beautiful. I would have loved to stay there even though it is a tomb.

title: Interesting
review: Very nice to see all the carved marble inlay work on the Mausoleum.The tomb has a peaceful feeling once you go inside the building.When you walk to the far end of the gardens,you also get a nice view of the Yamuna River.Worth the visit after being to the very busy Taj Mahal.

title: Golden Triangle Tour
review: Not on every tour but a must as this is less crowded and has much more atmosphere  This building was used as a blue print for the Taj Mahal and the similarities are there for all to see.  Really look at the buildings as they are amazing

title: Baby Taj Mahal
review: One of the four attractions we visited, it is a smaller mausoleum and known by the "locals" as the Baby Taj. It is set in gardens and laid out in a very symmetrical way. A nice place to go after the more popular Taj and less noisey.

title: Very much worth visiting.
review: Going early in the morning (9am ish) and you find the place very tranquil and inspiring and our learned guide spent a great deal of time explaining the history and some of the tragedy to the Tomb, all fascinating and enhancing the experience.

title: See it before Taj Mahal
review: Like I said in a title try to visit the "Baby Taj" before the main Taj. In that way you won't be overwhelmed with Taj splendour, and I think you will be more delighted with engraved marble work, carving, etc...

title: Very Nice
review: Although the Taj Mahal was bigger and more breathtaking, we are still glad to have visited this site, Itimad-ud-Daulah! The detail working in the carvings & inlay work was just as impressive. Plus, you did not have to fight through the big crowds or wait for picture opportunities as we did at the Taj Mahal. Must see

title: Good place to visit
review: This is the tomb of Mirza Ghiyas Beg and his wife Asmat Begum. He hailed from iran and served Akbar. He was father of Nur Jehan and grand father of Mumtaj Mahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: Very nice handwork made in Marbel...

title: Mini Taj Mahal
review: It's like a mini replica from the real Taj Mahal, very neglected structure. The ambiance is very calm.

title: Very beautiful - nice ambiance
review: The 'Baby Taj' is well worth a visit - It is a magnificent building and it contrasts well with its Big Brother !

title: Not to miss it in agra
review: Must to visit due to below reason:-

title: Don't miss out on Baby Taj
review: Absolutely fascinating to see this having already seen the Taj itself.  Baby Taj is the perfect nickname. It's absolutely beautiful on a miniature scale.

title: Highly recommend
review: Very interesting story of the very poor Persian merchant who became a minister and trusted treasurer to Akbar.the baby Taj name tag is obvious as soon as you see it,but for me it has it's own qualities,beautiful in a tranquil park setting and exquisite carving and inlay in the white marble.

title: Baby Taj
review: I first came here in 2001 and it was spectacular then. I love the fact that it was the forerunner to the Taj Mahal and I know that the Taj is bigger and on a larger scale but the intimacy of the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Dualah is just so inviting. I recently revisited it in December 2012 and you can see the design features that inspired the Shah Jahan to make the wonderful monument to Mumtaz.  I probably spent as much time looking around this lovely building as I did with my second visit to the Taj Mahal. You must see the Taj Mahal but reserve some time to see the "prototype". It is worth the experience.

title: Petite beauty
review: If you still have some time after visiting the Tal Mahal and the Agra Fort, this would be a nice finish to your visit to Agra. It is a mausoleum which the Taj Mahal is modelled after. It has beautiful in lay marble to adorn its walls, and has a nice surrounding.

title: Good if you have spare time
review: Great little place, very quiet compared to manic Taj Mahal and Agra Fort. Really good precision marble and picture opportunities.

title: Exquiste
review: We went to the Taj Mahal first and loved it of course but the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah was built first and we felt was more exquisite.Not as big but the workmanship is awe inspiring. As we traveled we talked to people and asked if they had seen the Baby Taj as it is nicknamed and they had not. Make sure you ask your tour operator to find time for it. You will not be disappointed. Less crowds too

title: A one time visit.
review: Its a good historic building but if you have to choose, prefer agra fort and akbar's tomb. You don't need a guide here but at other places. you can complete the visit in just one hour. there is not much to see. prefer to carry only small bags and water. the place is not crowded therefore it can be visited at any time of the day.

title: Worth a Visit :)
review: It is the precursor of Taj Mahal.A very beautiful monument made up of marble by Nur Jahan remains lost in the city of Agra overshadowed by many integral monuments like Taj Mahal and Agra Fort.Due to this reason it is serene and peaceful and visiting this monument is worthwhile .

title: Must see - little gem
review: As it is located on the opposing riverside of the Taj Mahal, it is often left unvisited by the hordes of tourist visiting Agra.  That's a shame as this mausoleum is as special as the Taj Mahal, but on a more intimate scale.  The drive across the bridge offers typical Indian city scenery!

title: Beautiful Baby Taj
review: This monument, visible as you cross the bridge over the Yumana River is well worth a visit.  The tomb of Nur Jahan's parents is relatively small, but very beautiful.  Itimad-ud-Daulah was the treasurer for the Mughal Empire during the reign of  the Emperor Akbar.   His daughter Nur Jahan was the wife of Emperor Jahingir (father of Shah Jahan who built Taj Mahal).

title: The Baby Taj came first!
review: The Baby Taj, though small, is as impressive as the Taj Mahal.  It's less crowded and you have so much more freedom to explore and take it all in (as opposed to taking a lot of pictures in a hurry).

title: Extraordinarily intricate marble inlay: a jewel of a building
review: An earlier example of Mughal monumental architecture than the Taj Mahal, this beautiful building helps to provide the context for Shah Jahan's super-confident display on the other side of the river. We visited here after the Taj Mahal; in retrospect, we should have done it before in order to understand and take in better the stylistic development and technique at the Taj.

title: Mughal Monument
review: A road less travelled. There are a lot of things to be seen and history becomes alive with the inscriptions and the Mughal architecture. To think of such man made intricate carvings. Do we have the potential or patience now??

title: Popularily known as Baby Taj
review: it is sometimes clalled by the guides as Baby Taj (after the Taj Mahal), but has nothing to do with that wonder of the world. This is again a tomb but was built before the Taj. It is also on the banks of the Yamuna river but on the opposite side.

title: Most Overrated place in Agra.
review: Its' not the Taj Mahal. And thats the main reason why people avoid it and the government and tour operators avoid it as well. But i would strongly recommend it. I personally loved it. I don't know if it was the fact that is not as crowded as other places or that is just such a quiet place.

title: minitaure taj
review: indeed taj wa s inspired and  built the same way this monument is built,small and  beautifull,the true work of semiprecious stones embedded on white marbel was  ist tried out here which later inspired to become the taj mahal

title: Stunning
review: I found it very interesting,and will suggest whilst in Agra go and pay a visit to the Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah. A person can just learn more, and probably appreciate more when you visit these places. Enjoy.

title: The Baby Taj!
review: Absolutely beautiful and stunning. Wish the Government maintained these amazing monuments better.

title: Baby Taj
review: This fort is near to Taj, and a must see structure. I believe there was a series of inspirational forts built and seen by Shah Jahan, before he embarked upon to build Taj Mahal. You can make out even from a distance that the fort is build by a mughal King because of its use of white marble.

title: A little gem
review: This is a very approachable little Mughal era gem. Its scale is not monumental and therefore very personal. Definitely worth a visit if you have the time after the Taj, the fort  and Fatehpur Sikri.

title: Worth seeing the Baby Taj
review: Also known as the Baby Taj. Fairly quick visit; 45min to 1 hour. Bring cool clothing and plenty of water.

title: Warm up before Taj Mahal
review: A small, but beautiful building on the right bank of Yemuna. We didn't spen a lot of time here, but the tomb is quite delicately carved with nice handcrafted work on its walls. Better known as Baby Taj.

title: Small but perfectly formed
review: This garden tomb lies on the other side of the Yamuna river from the Taj Mahal and the Agra Fort. It is an oasis of quiet after these busy sites and is perfectly situated within walled gardens with monkeys running around the lawns. The tomb is elegant and perfectly proportioned with beautiful marble inlays and the surroundings make a peaceful respite from the hustle and bustle outside. Definitely worth visiting for a couple of hours.

title: Better than the Taj Mahal
review: The "Baby Taj" - less grand, but just as good, and not nearly as crowded. Plus: lots of monkeys, and hardly any obnoxious guides. Must see!

title: Baby Taj
review: This lovely little building is the Baby Taj, although it is a little run down and in need of some repair, it was beautiful, very peaceful, not many tourist were there, so we were able to walk around by ourselves and just take it all in. Had a certain appeal about it, not as grand as the Taj but still a site to remember.

title: Baby Taj
review: This is on the other side of Yamuna and is actually tomb yard. The construction is almost similar to Taj way but it is not made that much perfect.

title: less people and more peace
review: when i was in Agra to see how it would be for our volunteers ( daanfoundation.org) i went to see all the beautiful monuments and i find this one a good place to be specially if you wish to stay for a bit longer time. I would say if you are coming to Agra one day can be spend in looking the Taj and the fort ( for which i think u can get some discount if you keep the tickets for the taj with u) (for only non Indian people)

title: Moghul wonder
review: Although the moghul era is not as long ago and the buildings in agra only maily really span three generations, they were sure building wonders. This thomb is not royal but has seriously royal features. It has the same grandure as the tah mahal, though smaller, and feels a bit more 'girly' withe the inlay made into flours.

title: The Baby Taj
review: Though not as impressive as the Taj itself, the Baby Taj is definitely worth visiting if you're in Agra. An incredible example of Mughal architecture, the tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah is a finely detailed marble mausoleum located on the west bank of the Yamuna about 6km from the Taj Mahal.

title: interesting history if you get a guide
review: Nice to see but very very worth the 100Rs guide. Without this we would not have appreciated the attraction in the same way and may have left disappointed. Guides outside are aplenty-check their badges/credentials before you choose. Many wanabee guides were following our one listening in for tips!

title: another site to visit
review: the story behind this tomb site is great...the grandparents of the builder of the taj are here...i enjoyed the walk around even though i had to don recycled booties...good example of mughal architecture...

title: A tomb different from the rest, come see how non-royals did it.
review: This structure built by the daughter of a grand vizier to honor her father merits a quick visit.  Many members of this family is entombed here.  The design is unique from other Mughal tombs, there isn't a large dome here, instead a unique rectangular roof structure.  The interior adornments are ornate and interesting.  Don't pass this by, especially if you have the time.

title: Not a must
review: Nice place to visit. Not a must see, but if you have time left..visit it. We even saw some peacocks.

title: nice and quite place to visit
review: good to visit in the middle of the day to have a break, it is quite and you can enjoy the park to have picnic

title: A nice surprise
review: Off our plan, but what a nice surprise to be able to fit it in.  Well worth the visit - the stone inlays are just amazing

title: A beautiful pre-cursor to the Taj Mahal
review: We viewed this place just before the Taj Mahal and I'm so glad we did. The Baby Taj as it is known is sooo serene and you can see just where the inspiration for the Taj's design may have come from. A truly beautiful building and a pleasure to view.

title: "Mini Taj"
review: Hiring a knowledgeable guide made a whole difference as we visited the "Mini Taj".

title: death and love together
review: For the traveller that likes to stop when something takes their interest, this will. It is total different from the taj and therefore really incomparable. The area is clean and the building is under-going some restoration but I think this is a slow process. There are different and beautiful architectural features to marvel at. What I like is the contrast between the greatly damaged gates and the fully restored gates. You can also marvel at the giant wasp nests at the top of the arches. They reduce the beauty of the photo but add life to a tomb. As you walk around the place you may occasionally trip over one or two young lovers courting. Lots of nooks for hiding. Well worth seeing.

title: Hidden Gem
review: While much of the focus in Agra is rightly focused on the Taj and the Fort, this Tomb was my personal favorite.  The architecture is much more intimate and personal.  The faded murals and paintings inside the tomb were a real gem.

title: Although referred to as Baby Taj this place is not small on features!
review: This really is a hidden gem. Although not as Majestic and large as the Taj, this place is relaxing and peaceful. In the past this would have been as opulent as they come. Although time has caught up with this attraction and there are some parts that have been poorly restored including the artwork it still has a certain appeal to it.

title: much overrated
review: known as baby taj,i dnt feel this place anywhere near to taj,much over rated,i think the only similarity it is also made of white marbel nothing else.

title: "A Little Known Gem of Agra"
review: Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah also known as "Baby Taj". Based on mughal architecture style, this building has actually suggested the idea for the decoration of the TajMahal. The Gardens, water Channels & The Inlay Work just create a Magic & one automatically says - "Its Beautiful"...

title: Amazing little tomb
review: I think this tomb has work more intricate than the Taj Mahal. Honestly I did not to go there when my taxi driver suggested this place. But he insisted that we should see it and took us there. This place is surely worth a visit.

title: hidden treasure
review: gorgeous hidden site with a calm and lovely feeling - much to see and learn.Very easy to get around and very few people there in am .A professional guide was a great benefit

title: The baby Taj
review: When you visit the Taj Mahal then this one you also have to do. Its smaller but also beautiful, the carvings, paintings,decorations...how could they do in that time. Maybe not so famous as the Taj but certainly in the same ranking of beauty.

title: A Definite Stop
review: This a great stop. You don't need a lot of time. The exterior of the tomb is beautiful and full of detail. The grounds are not too big and you can view the river from the edge of the grounds. Make sure you bring exact change because they don't seem to have change.

title: Architecuter marvel of Moghul era
review: The architecture of this monument is excellent. Most of the visitors to Taj Mahal do not have time to visit this place and that is a mistake. The entrance is rather clumsy and the authorities have to clean it up.

title: Amazing
review: Most beautiful place, unbelievable the marble and gem stones and size, and you can see why it's one of the seven wonders of the works.

title: Also know as the "Baby" Taj Mahal
review: Worth a visit.  The architure is stunning and easier to see then the larger Taj.  Our guide was very informative, this made the visit even better

title: Be Sure to Stop Here
review: It may be smaller than its much more famous neighbor (the Taj Mahal), but it's well worth a brief visit.  It doesn't have the crowds, it doesn't take long to see, and when you get up close to it you'll see that it actually has more extensive and elaborate marble inlay work than the Taj Mahal itself!  It has earned its nicknames "The Jewel Box" and "The Baby Taj".

title: A secret treasure.
review: Built before the Taj, this mausoleum is just as beautiful if a lot smaller and well worth the110 Rupee entrance fee. With very few visitors this quiet, peaceful garden is used by local young couples for their assignations. It does taken much imagination to have an idea of how fabulous this would have and potentially could be.

title: The "Jewel Box" or "Baby Taj"
review: The tomb of I'timād-ud-Daulah, also known as the “Baby Taj” or a “jewel box” is a marvel of excess decor. Looking at it, one feels they are seeing a beautifully decorated cake made of marzipan. It is the tomb of a Persian advisor to the Mughal Emperors Akbar, and Jahangir and grandfather to Mumtaz Mahal (Shah Jahan’s wife).

title: A beautiful Mini Taj
review: Itmad-ud-Daulah's Tomb is also known as a mini-Taj. This is the tomb of Mirza Ghiyath Beg, who handed out under Akbar and fathered Nur Jaha.Tthe potent wife of Jahangir who helped to encourage her father to his position as Lord of the Treasury and protected him here in this "bejeweled marble box" -- proof of her powerful hold on the purse cord.

title: worth a visit
review: After the scale and grandeur of the Taj and Agra Fort, the "Baby Taj" is a welcome respite: small and easy to take in.  Calm and peaceful, delightful to behold.

title: Wonderful garden tomb.
review: This beautiful garden tomb is rarely visited by tourists, which is a shame, as it provides a great beauty without all the hassle of the Taj Mahal.

title: Baby Taj
review: This place is also called Baby Taj. Of course nothing is comparable to the Taj mahal, but this can be counted as one other attraction in Agra.

title: No crowds, beautiful detail
review: Second visit and still found lots of intricate detail to photograph. Not as magnificent as the Taj but I find the overall experience here to be more satisfying. There were very few people there both times I went.

title: Just Lovely
review: We visited the inspiration for the Taj Mahal before visiting the Taj. I think that was a good strategy. This is a wonderful mausoleum to visit when you first get to Agra along with Akbar's tomb. You can see it at any time during the day. We saw it near sunset and it was quite lovely.

title: Nice Place to Visit India
review: I visit  Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah in march i recomnded to all my friend toi visit there.Agraindiatour expert arrange my trip

title: It's brilliant!
review: Made in shape of a jewel box, it's an exquisitely carved monument built by Nur Jahan, the wife of Mughal king Jahangir (the son of Akbar) as a memorial to her own parents- Mirza Ghiyas Beg and mother Asmat Begum.  Commissioned by Nur Jahan, Itmad-ud-Daulah was constructed between 1622 and 1628 . The mausoleum is situated a half kilometers upstream of the Taj Mahal, Agra.

title: Agra - Tomb of itimad-ud-Daulah - Fantastic little Temple
review: After a long day we got to 'Baby Taj' not long before sunset and I was extremely surprised to see such a wonderful small temple and monument set in some lovely peaceful and serene gardens. The view also across the Yamuna River is great. We spent a good hour here just admiring the detail of the build and also peacefully wandering around. The sight was not very busy and it was brilliant to get away from the bustling streets outside. It is probably on everyone's list when visiting Agra but you really do not want to miss this if you are seeking to compromise on time. Miss something else. Whether we were lucky or not getting here later on in the day certainly meant there wasn't that many other visitors. This added to the attraction and it was a very romantic place. It is different from the larger Taj Mahal and its size gives it something more realistic and something you can connect with. I loved this.

title: Nice tomb
review: It is a smallish area but well maintained. The tomb itself is in beautiful marble with some exquisite inlays of stones. Located right next to the river it has some nice views of Agra.

title: Mini Taj
review: Small building but worth a visit. Amazed to see fine detailed work on the white marble. Should visit during evenings or early mornings. Very crowded approach roads during peak hours.

title: Must see
review: So beautiful. So compact. Such wonderful carvings and as usual a hauntingly wonderful story behind it. Go there.

title: Beautiful precursor to  the Taj Mahal
review: Built by Nur Jahan, wife of Moghul emperor Jahingir, in memory of her father, the first mausoleum built in white marble. Worth seeing for the elegant design and the  beautiful  floral designs inlaid into.the marble using semi-precious stones.

title: Baby Taj, well worth it!!!
review: Did not plan to see this and glad I did prior to Taj. Need only 30-45 mins and tuns 110 Rs (100 on Fri.) Not so crowded, a nice change.

title: A must see (before the real Taj if poss to see a smaller schale effort)
review: Just as I state above and in accordance with the other reviews.  This is a really impressive peice of craftsmenship from some of the worlds best architects.

title: Good place to start in Agra
review: Also known as the "baby Taj", this place is nice but quite small & simple compared to the main touristic sites of the Agra (the fort and the Taj Mahal).

title: Worthy of a visit
review: This is a small structure, but well worth the time spent to stop for a visit.  The grounds are well maintained, the overall area clean and well kept.  Take the time to visit.  You'll not regret the time spent.  Just wandering around the grounds is enjoyable.

title: Small but beautifully formed!
review: A fraction of the size of the Taj Mahal but its form and decoration bear comparison. This 'Baby Taj' is a 'must-visit' for all tourists coming to Agra.

title: Elegant tomb with beautiful, lacy stone carving
review: This beautiful tomb is made of white marble, has intricate, lacy carvings (jalis), stone inlay work (pietra dura) and lovely mosaics. It's stunning and does not get the crowds the Taj does so it is a more leisurely experience.

title: An exquisite companion to the Taj Mahal
review: Agra is a fortunate city,indeed, to have two such incredible monuments. Itimad-ud-Daulah is simply exquisite, more human scale than the Taj Mahal and far more ornamented with inlays of precious stones that must have kept a small city of artisans busy for a very long time. This is only a few minutes drive from the Taj Mahal. Don't miss it.

title: They call it mini Tajmahal
review: It was just OK to visit there as I didn't found any thing special there. If you have time then it's not a bad monument to visit.

title: Outstanding!
review: This is a terrific gem of a tomb! No crowds, perfect "little Taj." And if you go at sundown, you can get the most amazing pictures as the light casts wonderful shadows and brings out the marble in all its glory.

title: A small version of the Taj Mahal
review: Sometimes known as the baby Taj, it is situated over the Yamuna river from the main city. A rickshaw would be advisable. There is a nominal charge. It was nice to visit but not essential if on a tight schedule. The monkeys on site can be entertaining. The 17th century tomb is set in symetrical gardens.

title: Nearly as good as the Taj Mahal
review: I liked it better because there are far fewer visitors.  The maintenance of the site is nearly as good, but there is less security to deal with, it is smaller, so you can explore it more thoroughly, and, as I said, there are fewer visitors to contend with.  It is also cheaper than either Agra Fort of the Taj Mahal.  Lastly, I think it is open on Friday, while the Taj Mahal is not, but check on this before making the trip across the river.

title: Rightly called "baby taj"
review: The inlay is fantastic... I think even better than Taj. It is a pity it hasn't been maintained half as well.

title: AKA Baby Taj.
review: This place is little known to the usual visitors. We stumbled upon it via a very very very nice tuk-tuk driver. The entrance fee is not very expensive, but the place is mesmerizing. The marble work is even more plentiful than the Taj Mahal itself. Would definitely recommend seeing this place.

title: Should move this to another city
review: This is a beautiful building and in almost any other city in the word would be outstanding. Next to the Taj and the Agra Fort it is a distant third. Built before the Taj shares a lot of its style.  Worth seeing but don't neglect the other two for this.

title: The baby Taj (go here 1st & neither will disappoint)
review: They call this the Baby Taj. If you visit after the Taj Mahal, it'll probably seem small and disappointing. But as a first stop it's perfect. The Tomb of Itimad-ud-Daulah is very beautiful in its own right. It's not grand like the Taj Mahal, but it's another lovely building with exquisite proportions, symmetry and decoration. At sunset, it's peaceful and lovely. Highly recommended.

title: ok monument
review: if you have time in agra you can go there not very attractive very small monument beautifully build, this place is on other side of the monument you can say out side of agra is guess

title: Not very popular
review: this place is behind the river, very small monument if you have time go there not very special, architecture is nice though

title: Nice to see
review: After the Taj Mahal this is probably the second best monument in Agra and I went there and was impressed. Unlike the Taj it is much more interesting to see inside, there are still a lot of wall paintings and I like it. Go there.

title: Beautiful building
review: Beautiful detailed building, not very crowded which was nice, and no hastle wandering about.the momument.  Food stalls/shops are opposite the site if you want to grab anything.

title: Baby Taj is quite beautiful
review: Beautaiful and not at all crowded.  Of course when compared to the Taj Mahal, it pales; however it is really quite beautiful.

title: Baby Taj
review: Well worth going to even if you're going to the Taj Mahal.  Can be combined with a visit to the park for sunset.
